text: Recommended by a friend from my hometown and thought I'd give it a try. Food and drinks were great! Potato salad was like nothing I've tasted before...so good! Highly recommend the caramel milkshake. Max, our server, was so friendly and helpful! He made sure we were enjoying our time and was very good at checking up on us. The guy refilling water and taking dishes was so sweet too. They were also able to adjust a meal to my friend's allergy and gluten free requests! If you're in Vegas go to the Venetian hotel (the restaurant is inside by the casinos) for lunch or dinner here...so worth it.

Food is mediocre, nothing special. Service is pretty bad, just don't seem to care. Over $30 for a burger and beer, In and Out would be a better choice. 8 guys on expense accounts and they would only split the check between 2 of us.

Burger was decent but not great. There are so many options at the Venetian it would be tough for me to go back here. Was hoping for a great burger, got a decent one. The service from the bartenders on the other hand was great.

I was very disappointed in this place.

The hostess & servers were lazy, and seemed very annoyed that I expected the service that I'm (over)paying for. For example, all of their booths were open, but the hostess acted like it was a huge inconvenience to seat me at one. 

I can't even count how many times I was sitting here needing something (like a refill on water, as they refused to give me a full-sized glass), watching my server Max stare slack-jawed at the TV as I tried to get his attention.

Bud light is $7. That's expensive even for Vegas. 

There was a screaming child and the staff did nothing to urge the parents to silence the little hellion.

I've never been to a restaurant that serves a burger without fries (except maybe McDonald's?), so I was a little taken aback. The seats were covered with crumbs, and thanks to their substandard sanitation, I ended up with a grease mark on the back of my pants.

The burger was great, but they got my order wrong on the first try.

Maybe they were just having an off day, but the place was dead, and there's no excuse for this kind of service (or lack thereof).

There are plenty of restaurants with employees that give a shit about their customers. Try one of them instead.

Went on the 2nd day...actually saw Mario Batalli walking from this restaurant to his other..sort of fun.  Had the Drive Thru Burger. 2 patties, lettuce, pickles and tried the Robiola cheese - similar to Mozz. Sesame Bun.  Burger was OK. Not a knock my socks off burger or a bad burger...just a burger. $12 for the burger.  Fries - just normal. $6 by themselves. So $18 for Burger and Fries. Everything a la carte. Friend had her burger on the Pretzel bun...looked good. Sounded good - she didn't really comment.  I can say the Potato Salad the table got next to us looked great...wish I would have ordered. I would expect the burgers to be outstanding - but just a burger really.
Amazing Burger!! The onion rings were great too. Fries were good. We are going back for the shake before this trip is over. I had the drive thru and I will have it again.

Finally tried B&B Burger the other day despite the 3 star rating on Yelp...

I definitely don't recommend anyone to waste their money at this spot. I got the drive thru burger. It was ok... barely ok. For a $10.00 burger it wasn't very big or any distinctive taste. Ordered a side of fries, another $6, but understandable cause where we are. The fries came out with so much salt on them I could not even eat 1 fry. The waitress came over n asked because I had not touched the fries, n i had told her they were way too much salt on them. Her reply was: I'm so sorry, picked them up and left. Never to offer me a new batch or a refund... 

After tax n tip, their cheapest burger, and fries, no drink was over $20. Not worth it!! Better off next door at Grand lux Cafe.

Great burgers, beer, fries, service, atmosphere. Pricey, but competitive and reasonable for Las Vegas Strip. My wife and I split The Morning After and Royale with Cheese burgers. Wonderful blend of beef, cheese, sauce and bun for both.

Stopped by with friends last night after catching a show & was very pleased with both the food & service. We sat at the bar & our bartender Manny was fantastic! He was very knowledgable about all of the different beers and the food too. The Morning After burger was delicious. I will definitely return to sit on the patio that overlooks the canals at the Venetian.

Service was great, the food not so. I ordered the chicken sandwich and it was soggy, the juices saturated the pretzel bun, and the chicken was thigh meat not breast. We also ordered the picked which were great and not flavorful.My wife's eggplant sandwich which was ok but not for the prices that they are charging.  I won't be back. There are too many other great places to eat at in Vegas tho.

Because Vegas didn't have quite enough celebrity-backed burger joints, the Venetian recently opened the tongue-twisting B&B Burger and Beer by Batali and Bastianich. This restaurant replaces the short lived and highly touted Rattlecan, which served some fantastic burgers and had a great interior. There was a lot of drama surrounding their early demise, but rumors flew around of the space not being what the Venetian wanted to display, and other odd things. That rumor is slightly hard to believe when you look at the atrocity of design close by that is the Bourbon Room, so who knows. Regardless, this duo provides some great meals in other locations within the property and throughout other parts of the country, so surely it would be a good replacement?

As I mentioned above, the interior of Rattlecan was great; custom graffiti everywhere, cool artwork, and a great bar made of skateboard decks. What has replaced it is a bright, boring, and poorly decorated space that feels much smaller than its predecessor and somehow way less inviting. The orange, yellow and red tones are horrible from the floors to the wall sconces, the tables look cheap, and the space overall just doesn't look like a burger joint that sells $14+ burgers. The muted wood tones in the clunky booth section bisecting the space as well as the dull back bar do nothing to spice up the environment, and the wavy ceiling feature made me feel like I was in a Denny's. Their menu is pretty simple; snacks, salads, shakes, burgers and heroes. The snacks and salads don't seem offer much, and the heroes sound more impressive than their small handful of burger choices.

With a recommendation by the waiter I went with the Royale with Cheese: robiola cheese, caramelized onions, grilled treviso and parmigiano-marscapone cream. What came out was a decent sized burger accompanied by an odd side of pickled carrots and onions. The bun was fresh, gooey, and well proportioned. The meat was really good; very fresh and juicy, just lacking any seasoning or flavor. The burger was very creamy, almost too much. The onions were barely noticeable aside from a couple bites, and the treviso wasn't strong enough of a flavor to be noticed, but good on its own when pulled out. Overall it was a very good burger; messy, creamy, juicy, all the things you'd want, but there was just that bit of beef flavor that was missing.

As for the fries, this is where the restaurant starts to piss me off. Spending $6 for a side of fries when you're already spending $31 on two burgers is just insulting, even on the strip. These on-Strip places need to remember that there is a huge local base of customers here to support them if the prices were even somewhat reasonable. This price is not. The fries themselves had good flavor, were of the thin, natural cut variety, but they were completely undercooked. You get a good sized portion that can be shared by two people, but spending that much for just one person on a bit of potatoes is stupid. For our two burgers and fries we spent $40 before tip, and that's just ridiculous. While they do offer up at least one decent burger, I wasn't crazy about the bite I had of the Really Good burger, I didn't really try much else. The slightly ridiculous prices combined with my longing for what used to occupy this space may not bring me back to try anything else.

I have eaten everything on the menu but the Hot Dog. The Eggplant parmesan is my favorite. You can go wrong with most items on the menu. The service is always friendly. Mario's restaurants all have love in the food! 

Areas for improvement.

I'm not a big fan of the warm potato salad. Something is off with the flavor profile. 

This may be a little critical; I think it would be great to remove the seeds from the lemons, the get caught in my straw. 

There aren't any desserts on the menu other than the yummy alcoholic shakes. I work so I can't ingest alcohol on my lunch. A couple Seasonal rotated desserts would be nice.

Had a salad and hummus. They were both good! Although the hummus plate is small for $7. Beer is a bit pricey. They like their 80s metal music here, which I enjoyed. Service was prompt but seemed very indifferent.

Appetizers are pretty good. We got the shishito peppers and fried oysters. The main dishes were not as good as the appetizers. Got the morning after burger and the lobster roll. Both were below average of a rating of 4 out of 10. Decent one time try but will not attempt again in the future.

Unfortunately, the B&B Burger & Beer is an absolute flop. If you look at all of the advertisement, you see a thick, hand formed burger patty on a sesame seed bun, quite appealing. THAT IS NOT WHAT THEY OFFER and for that Mario Batali should be absolutely ashamed of what he is doing. Talk about a "bait and switch," I cannot believe his management team allows this. What IS served at B&B is an upscale Double-Double In/Out burger. Two THIN and flat burger patties are cooked on a grill, well seasoned, fresh bun and produce, etc. But what you get is just in the same family as any other fast food burger. Chocolate shake was outstanding, onion rings were fine, nice store, clean, great service. Here is the pisser, I ordered lunch for my brother and I, two burgers, one shake, one soda, two sides (slaw - rings) and my bill out the door was over $50 bucks. 

Absolutely over priced, false advertising in every sense, do not bother with this location. Tons of great burgers in Vegas, plenty of options inside the Venitian/Palazzo for a burger such as Legasse's Table 10 or his sports bar, or Grand Lux Cafe for lunch. Another location inside the Palazzo that serves an OUTSTANDING burger for lunch is Buddy V's, it is an Italian restaurant with great, great, hell, outstanding pasta, but man do they serve one hell of a burger. I predict B&B will close within 6 months unless they do a serious retool. Shame on Mario for allowing this to happen.

B&B Burger & Beer is a really great burger restaurant. 
Excellent burgers, onion rings and a great beer selection.  Modest the bartender was very friendly, gave great service and recommendations.
Lets skip the long detailed review part. The really good burger was awesome and our server Steve was awesome. Great food great atmosphere great people.
Went for the Nutella shake and it didn't disappoint! The service was wonderful too.
Great service, flavor-filled burgers, tasty fries!  Watch out for the low-hanging lights!

Food and drinks were good but I'm writing about our waiter, Steven. To be fair he was a good waiter and attentive. But at the end of the meal he asked what we had planned for the night. When I mentioned we were going to a gay bar, he got an ugly look on his face as if to say "why?" I then added that we were all gay so it is something that we enjoy and are looking forward to. His face got even more disgusted, he said "ok..." and walked away. 

It is 2015 and we have Marriage Equality in this country. It's fine if you don't like gay bars or even gay people, but you are in the service industry in Las Vegas of all places. Instead you can laugh and say, "Not my cup of tea, but have fun!" Scowling at your customers and judging them vocally and visually is inappropriate and I will never be returning.

Burgers were decent, meatball sandwich was good, but not worth the price considering the names attached to it. Seems like you're paying solely for the names. You would think the food would be fantastic, but it was just OK. 

The fries were ordinary. The onion rings have a sweet batter- almost like a donut. Not very good, and a bit greasy. 

$78 for hamburgers, a meatball sandwich and fries/rings to share is a little ridiculous. I realize it's Vegas, but we're talking hamburgers! 
It was deserted when we went late on a Friday night. It was always nearly empty, even during peak dinner times when we walked past it. Pretty telling. 

I'd save yourself the trip and go to another burger place w/o famous names.

After waiting for an hour for our food it came out cold. We had a large party and we were told they were trying to be able to serve us at the same time. Then five orders were incorrect. The worse thing was instead of saying she was sorry the manager starting arguing with us. Will never come again

Total disappointment, I cannot believe Batali Restaurant were such a low stardard.  To begin, the staff were not friendly, my server didnt seem to know what she was doing.  My order came totally diiferent what I have ask for, the fries were cold, and there after, it was so hard to get hold of the server, most possible.
There after, nothing felt right, just wanted to finish my food and leave as soon as possible.

Me and my boyfriend decided to dine here after watching Human Nature because my boyfriend mentioned that this restaurant features 2 famous chef. I was thinking that I should give it a chance despite the low ratings on yelp. 

Oh how I wish I didn't! First, I drink a lot a lot of water. And the water glass are so small that I would need it filled many times and I would have to wait or make sure to stare at my server until he realizes I need more water. 

Second, the server was seriously rushing us! We already knew what burger we wanted but not the sides. Once me and my boyfriend told the server what burger we wanted but still thinking between the sides, he asked if he can come back later at least 3 times! Why don't you recommend what's good instead of leaving in the middle of a food order? Of course right when we were done I noticed he jumped to another table (who sat down before us) to take an order.

Right when the food came and I had one bite of a side order of fries...the server asked me how my food was......ok whatever 


Third, My royal burger was super plain with no flavor but my boyfriend's was really tasty. He ordered the really good burger. The fries were half burnt and too thin, also no flavored or had a burnt flavor.  

So this restaurant and food isn't really memorable and I'm pretty sure I'll forgot about this place really soon.

A little pricy but quality is good. Wish that they had a standard reg burger as well as cheeseburger without charging extra for sauce pickles & such. The standard with everything included has 2 patties for 10$. Not bad overall with alcohol variety as well & shakes are wonderful.

We are always looking for a great burger experience in Vegas.  This was NOT it.  We had The Really Good Burger, chips and IPA.  The burger was average.  The few chips were not fresh.  It is a hassle for a local to get in here, it is pretty far from parking and not conveniently located within the Venetian.  Two stars are for bright and clean environment and attentive staff.  Perhaps too attentive, hardly any other diners so perhaps that was it, but we had to say " not yet" a number of times when staff tried to remove our drinks and plates before we were done.   That was Monday.  Last night we went to a Red Robin and had a tavern burger, chips and IPA.  The bill was half the price but the food was twice as good.

Mario Batali, how do you put your name on this place? I ordered a chicken sandwich and it was the greasiest thing ever. Literally grease dripping down my hands. I couldn't eat more than a few bites of it. We ordered fries for the table and when they came out they were burnt to a crisp- we had to send them back. Everyone at the table said the same thing about their sandwiches - greasy as anything. My insides are now paying for all that grease. The only reason this place is getting two stars from me is because of the beer selection. Otherwise, don't bother going here.

Wow I was so looking forward to this place, until I actually visited ! (Obviously I hadn't read any of the Yelp reviews!) 

The good was I wanted beer and a burger and to watch some sport and they had all three! Yay them. 

The bad. The service was average... The guy was pleasant but again pretty uninterested he didn't have any suggestions, didn't seem to know much about beer. Which is odd, right? Because they really only sell two products. 

Anyway the food was just flavourless. It was cooked just as we asked but it didn't taste like anything. Salt your food people, salt yo food ! It was lackluster and considering the names behind the restaurant brand it just doesn't seem to fit.

You can do better than B&B in Vegas... !

For a burger place, you can't beat the prices and the view. Thanks Mario and the other "B" (I know, the other B is for Joe Bastianich, Lidia's famous son!) for bringing this burger joint to Vegas! We had several menus items and all were excellent! Dinner included:

  Fried Pickles - very good, batter was tasty, not soggy, and fried perfectly. Highly recommend if you like sweet pickles.
  Eggplant Parmesan Hero - we opted for a non-burger mainly because I love eggplant parmesan and wanted to see how Mario and Joe decided to prepare this sandwich.  I've eaten a few of these in my lifetime and would rate this as a pretty good rendition served on a ciabatta roll.  The eggplant was fried and not too greasy and there was just about the right amount of marinara sauce.  Nice and fresh buffalo mozzarella and the fresh basil pesto gave it a nice mellow taste.  I would order this hero again at this restaurant.     
  Side of Onion Rings - again, like the pickles, the onion rings were crispy and not soggy!
  Side of Slaw - had peanuts in it and dressed with a light dressing that wasn't overdone.

Tip for locals and visitors alike:  visit during the week and ask for an outside table.  

Oh, almost forgot to mention...best Manhattan I've had in a casino restaurant in quite some time. Posting pictures now.

Decent burger cooked perfectly, but not very juicy or seasoned. Fries were the kind of old limp shoe strings that you would find at the bottom of a bag of Mcdonalds. $40+ for 2 waters, 2 burgers, and 1 fry. I Wouldn't recommend this place to anyone who enjoys a good burger and fries, Unless you've got a lot of money and enjoy a decent burger with sub par fries. Also the wait staff and bussers wouldn't stop bothering us. Kind of strange.

Mario I don't think you would be happy with your name on this restaurant .

My friend and I were starving. Ok, that means we could eat a shoe and I sent my burger back! Need I go further! I will!

We walk up to hostess, two girls who were grilling us if we had good allergies. Then we sit down and the waiter grills us if we have food allergies. 


He then says ask for water refill we don't refill. It's a desert. Also by the way, no ice in water. Okay my friend and live in az. Oh by way this is Vegas we r in !!! Lazy waiter ! Far be it he refills my water. My friend was kind to give me hers. Then a $8 saucer with marinara comes out with a melted cheese stick in it. 5 thin slices of burnt baguette ! They did give 5 more slices as we still had sauce left. Ok app  

Now I go to order, kosher dog. Ops sorry we don't have. I order double party burger . Friend gets burger with jalapeño chees. She said delicious! My burger arrives it is all bun Barbie doll size burgers. Sent it back! :((( disappointed! 

Then waiter stood and listened to conversation throughout. 

Never return .

I decided recently to venture the celebrity burger establishments in the last month and I'll tell you, this place is giving the Keller burger location a run for it's money. 

Inside, you get the sports book feel creep in with the TVs in the restaurant and it's a good old fun American time. Loud rock and roll, playoff basketball, burgers and booze. What's to go wrong. Outside, you get Las Vegas. Beautiful patio next to the gondolas and the strip right before you. One of the best night spots in the city.

I forgot to mention, the food and service was better. We were seated promptly by Erica. She even pulled out a seat for me. At a burger spot?? A plus already. We were greeted by our server Stephen and he let us know about the "special" burger they had and I was on board. My friend got the morning after burger and we also ordered the unfried? mozzarella to start and onions rings on the side. My burger was the best burger I ever had until I tasted my friends burger! And he said the same thing! The mozzarella was the type of appetizer that you would find in a higher scale B&B restaurant which makes it the best under $10 app I've yet to find. Those damn onions rings were amazing period. Our server couldn't have made the experience more comfortable from the start to finish. He even introduced us to the busser lol! I think his name was Angel. 

The food alone deserves the high rating but I feel like the staff is perfect for this sort of restaurant. Everyone just seemed so happy there! Well done Mario and Joe!

I had a late lunch on the patio with my boyfriend today. our server was attentive and knowledgable when I asked questions about the menu. food was good and the weather was amazing. the 3 star review is based off the lack of customer service i witnessed from other employees. the hostess must have left for a bathroom break or something and was gone for 10-15 minutes. in that short time I witnessed 3 couples and and group of 4 stand by the hostess stand for over 5 minutes and get ignored by every employee that walked by. they even walked right in front of the people in clear view and no one acknowledged them. I almost wanted to get up and seat them myself. they were basically throwing business away. the food and our server were great I was just disappointed by everything else.

Crispy fries and tasty sandwiches. We ordered a burger, eggplant sandwich and a garden salad. Everything was fresh and simple.Although the beer selection was small, it was well balanced and I was able to have a delicious IPA with my meal. We will be back!
Good Service! Good atmosphere! Good recommendations! Thanks Modest! You were on point! Outside seating was awesome!

We decided to try this place for lunch since we had heard somewhat decent reviews and it was in our hotel.  I would start by saying the service leaves a lot to be desired.  We were seated promptly and our initial order taken (at least part of it), but the service went down hill from there. After taking the initial drink and food orders our waiter was nowhere to be found.  The few times he did come back he would ask one person at our table if they wanted a refill, then run off to get it before even giving any of the rest of us an opportunity to ask for anything else.  He also didn't check in on us very often.  It seemed like he was very flustered and easily distracted.  As soon as he got a new table he was off to attend to them and it seemed almost as if he forgot he had any others.

The food itself I would say was very average.  Burgers were cooked to order, and somewhat tasty, but I've definitely had much better...it was very mediocre and just didn't wow any of us.  They were also overpriced, even given that you are paying for the name.

There are definitely better burgers to be had in Vegas, and places with much better service.

The one good thing were the booze milkshakes. I had the cherry bourbon vanilla shake which was to die for! I might go back just for one of those in the future, but would probably go elsewhere for food.

They serve a delicious eggplant burger and their shakes are a must with refills. I loved the quick service, but did not enjoy how the server was not too friendly. On the other hand, the hostess was extremely nice. My boyfriend got the drive thru burger and it looked good, but messy. The early morning burger that my friend ordered looked delicious so I would recommend that one. I'd give it a second shot.

Excellent beef burger. Very fresh and we'll made. The "Bar burger" is simple and an excellent value for the strip at 11 dollars. 

The pickled cauliflower is very good so good we asked for some more.

Service was nice and attentive.

Came here with the family for lunch. My dad was super excited to try B&B Burger & Beer as it's opened by Mario Batali and has been highly recommended by his friend. It was also super convenient that this restaurant was located in the Venetian, where we were staying, so it made for a quick meal. 

The restaurant offers indoor and outdoor seating. It was very sunny so we chose to sit inside. It took a while to get seated, which was quite odd, as there were barely any occupied tables indoors. The place is very casual with booths in the middle and separate tables surrounding with metal chairs and very bright walls. Nothing super fancy. 

Food::
Chicken Wings ($9): Mario's hot sauce
Morning After Burger ($15): Sauteed mushrooms, frisee, fontina cheese, sunny side egg, truffle aioli
Drive-Thru ($10): Two patties, American cheese, pickles, lettuce, tomato, onion, ketchup, mayo, mustard
Bottom Burner ($14): Pepper jack cheese, onion rings, japaneo pesto, Mario's hot sauce, mayo
Bison Caprese ($19): Tomato, mozzarella, romaine and basil, balsamic, ciabatta bread

Thoughts::
The wings were pretty meaty but for $9 for 5 wings, it was definitely not worth it.
There was just too many things going on in the morning after burger. Of course, burger places need to differentiate itself from others but sometimes perfecting a regular burger is better than adding in unnecessary extras! The flavors melded together (and not in a good way) to the point that I couldn't tell what I was eating anymore. The sauce dripping down from the mushrooms and the aioli, and the egg caused the bun to get all soggy and vey unappetizing after a while. Also, the burger was so big, I could barely get to try everything all at once. I resorted to eating it with a fork and knife because it just fell apart after a while. The frisee was an interesting touch to the burger though. The patties in the Drive-Thru and Bison were a little overdone and made it tough to chew when we had asked for them to be medium. 

Overpriced burgers with overcomplicated burgers. Given it is Vegas, prices are reasonable and probably on the cheaper end. However, I would go somewhere else. Service was lacking as it took a while to get the waitress's attention for the bill and the burger turned into such a soggy mess after a while that I couldn't even fully enjoy it.
Max is the bomb! Best server ever!! Great service and food is very good. One of the best burgers I've had in Vegas.

We found this dining experience to be very enjoyable. The waitress and staff were very attentive to our needs.  We arrived, starved for a burger and fries and 'boy', this place delivered the goods!  We could not finish our delicious burger and fries, but we had a good time Trying! Pricey,  but good!

Royal with Cheese is the best burger I've had in Vegas - part of the secret is the mascarpone, which is what I now use when I grill burgers, it really helps it "melt in your mouth"

I didn't care much for the lobster roll, but still give this place 5 stars for the sole reason stated above

I've had Stripburger, Burger Bar, Smashburger, Baci Burger, In and Out, 5 Guys - all very good, but B&B wins

Went there last night about 10pm with my wife and another couple--wasn't busy by no means.  Initial service was fine---food came and was not impressed---the bread my wife's pastrami was on was burnt---totally black---but they hid it on the inside so initially you couldn't see it---she realized it by tasting the burnt flavor (she ate half the $14 sandwich). We notified the mgr----said she would discount our meal----bill came---no discount----notified server---they ended up giving us a 15% discount (5.25)----not even half off the burnt sandwich---she only ate half of her burnt sandwich.     My morning after burger was ok----definitely not worth $15. 

I don't mind paying $$ for decent food with decent service----this place was a miss for me and my party.

My husband liked this place a lot more than I did. We were looking for a burger joint and decided to give this one a try. My husband had the warm potato salad with the Royale Cheeseburger. He loved both. I found the warm potato salad to be meh and the burger was messy and greasy. I ordered the coleslaw with the morning after burger. The coleslaw was great - it has cilantro on it - I am one of those 'cilantro tastes like soap' people - but it didn't bother me too much. The burger was good but again a little on the greasy side; could have been the truffle oil on it. The waitstaff was great; very upfront about what contains nuts, for those who have an allergy.

Staying at the Venetian and saw the restaurant on the hotel promo channel so was excited to get a good burger. Now first Vegas food is expensive so when you are going when you pay extra because of the location you expect more as far as service and quality of service. First the place was practically empty so service and attention to customer should be spot on. However, my husband and I had the giggles group that had 3 more hours before the restaurant closed. They actually walked off the premise looking at something or someone. SMH 3 times anyway the food we ordered 2 burgers and onion rings all which was horrible. I am picket so when my even my husband who eats anything couldn't eat the onion rings I knew it was a big problem . They where thick and uncooked. Burger nothing like what  Chef Mario Batali displayed on his ad . It's a shame that all of these celebrity chefs and entertainers just slap their name in a restaurant and walk away from the quality of the food and service . Plus check your receipt they charged us for items we did not even get

Great new place in Vegas. I am a fan of both chefs and was interested and excited to give this a try. We went on its 3rd day after opening and everything ran smoothly. The food was of course excellent; I had the Royale Burger which was amazing. 

The potato salad was the best. I dislike potato salads of all kinds; they are too mushy, too mayo-ee, too onionee, etc. But this one was amazing. The potatoes were warm and crispy, the cheese sauce was top notch. 

I did not have one of the alcoholic milkshakes which gives me another great reason to go back.

The waiter was very nice and on top of what my husband and I needed! The food was so great!! We ordered the peppers, steak sandwich and pulled pork sandwich. Everything came out amazing and I cannot wait to go back!! Yes, it is expensive, but it is  pretty great food!!
Katelyn Williams was an absolute delight.  She suggested the scrumptious dogfish as a pairing for my burner burger, and was super attentive. We will be back !

Food was great! Service was terrible!!! Didn't get drinks until we asked a second time half way through our appetizers. Asked for a lemon 3 times finally brought one lemon for 2 people that asked. Never received a refill the entire meal.

DO NOT GO!!!!   You are (1) expecting a higher end Burger Sports Bar...NOT!!  (2)  Tables are preset with plates...THAT STICK TO THE TABLES...dirty (3) the setting is uncomfortable to for the sport enthusiast who wants to stay awhile..JUST LIKE A MCDONALDS (3)service was extremely lacking (4) any coupon you may use will only be complicated when you try to use (4) It just doesnt belong at the Venetian Hotel.  Ok, if you are ok with all that, the burger was pretty good...but you will feel dirty with the rest.    ~~BEWARE OF CLEANINESS~~

Unremarkable.  The burgers were dry.  The lobster roll had shells and tendons.  The warm potato salad was over dressed.  The service was terrible and without intention.  The best customer service we got was from the assistant server.  There were a lot of employees just milling around and hanging out; weird. Spoke to the manager. She didn't smile once while she talked with us. She actually appeared to be annoyed by our request to speak to her.  She explained everything away by saying the they were just a burger place.  Mario and Joe, you guys need to get a handle on this place or you wont be here very long.  With places like the Burger Bar and Gordon's BurGR, there's no room for this kind of sub-exceptional experience.

Went to this restaurant with a party of 12, this place just couldn't Handel it. Poor service, wait time for food was 50 minutes.then when the food was brought to the table 4 orders were wrong and some Cold, manager said she could do nothing to make it right, Mario your places need a lot of help, won't be back( ever )

I don't even know what to say in detail except this place was terrible and not worth the money. $50 for two burgers and two beers. Honestly I wouldn't mind paying that if the food was good but it was tasteless and my bread was cold. I only gave this a 1 star because if you sit outside you have a nice view of the Gondola ride.
Bad atmosphere and service was terrible. Should of took that as a hint when nobody was there. All 4 of us got the "real good burger" and 3 of us got sick. Such a shame for a Vegas restaurant.

They should change the name to just "Beer".  The burgers were a disappointment.  First, a $15, 6 oz. burger better be fantastic, but it wasn't.  Second, I ordered the burger with BBQ sauce (a 50 cent upcharge) and  it looked like they put it on with an eye dropper.  I couldn't even taste it.  

The service was much like what others have described.  The server was attentive enough but his attitude was such that I wished he hadn't been.

Go to Lagasse's Stadium if you are at the Venetian/Palazzo. Not the greatest burger in the world but next to this place, it is a huge step up.
Watched the Broncos beat the Patriots here, and everyone was super friendly. Good drinks and good food. Prices are very typical for the Strip. Ask for Gabrielle (from Hawaii), she rocks.

Great burger the staff is right on time ,cold beer I haven't had a bad Burger there yet and I've been there probably four or five times the burgers look like something that's too pretty to eat sometimes but they are so delicious overall I love this place as a fallback when I'm in Vegas

Awful attitude by a waitress.  Messed up my order and they had the nerve to scrape the stuff I didn't want off.  I called them out on it but they continued to lie and say it was made fresh.  Many other good restaurants in the Venetian/Palazzo so ignore this one.

To say the service is poor, is being polite. Twenty-five minutes to get a beer. At that point, we only order some onion rings. The rings were great, and the only reason they get 2 stars. Severely disappointed. Shocking coming from the B&B stable of restaurants were I have experienced nothing but the finest service and food. Avoid this place and they get their act together.

VERY disappointed.  The wings were the smallest wings I have ever seen.  They were so tiny and only had half the meat on the bone.  SAD!!!The fries were the only thing decent.  Service at the bar was marginal at best and the drink was weak.  I doubt I will be back.  WAY too many choices in Vegas....

This place is a D list burger when compared with the others on the strip. The food itself was ok. I had the lobster roll and my boyfriend had the burger which I also tried. We also had the chicken wing appetizer which where comparable to the kind you buy in the frozen food section. I would have had dessert if the server offered it but he just dropped the check without asking so we went to a cupcake bar also inside the venetian. 

The service was really terrible, with the exception of the hostesses who where very nice and welcoming. We pretty much always tip 20% tip but this guy did so little that we tipped less. 

The best part of this experience was the beer I had which I can't remember the name  of but it had grapefruit flavor and was very yummy! 

Wouldn't recommend it. Go to burger bar or Gordon Ramsay Burgr instead.

Ordered burger very well for health reasons, waiter was in a hurry and didn't want to listen, burger was very pinkish red and appy didn't come.  Waiter said I should have ordered very very well done, I ordered burnt.  The cheese was cold and solid, never melted.  Had to ask for appetizer since food would be at least 20 minutes more.  Poor service, poorly cooked meal, second not cooked enough either, waiter didn't want hear that it was still very pink.  

Not worth time or money

Probably not a good idea to order a salad with chicken at a burger joint in the first place, but it was terrible (added chicken to whatever the goat cheese salad was called). Tried a small piece of the chicken that looked like it had been sitting out for a week and immediately pushed it to the side. Now sick with some type of food poisoning. The burgers looked decent that others ordered, but service was also sub-par.

Update: Been puking all day and haven't left hotel room. Would stay far away from this place.

These burgers were apparently decent...but the kitchen forgot to make mine, so I got to watch as my satisfied friends ate theirs and laughed at me. None of the servers seemed to care about fixing this....which was ok, but I don't think I'll go back.

Won't ever go back.  Poor service and mediocre (at best) hamburgers.  It took forever to get the waitress out of a conversation with the bartender so that we could order drinks.  The food arrived promptly, but was simply a hamburger on a plate.  No garnish, pickle, nothing!  The bun was lifeless and looked like a mass produced bun from the grocery store.  Burger was only barely warm.  
I would have offered feedback at the time, but nobody was around that seemed to care.

The patio seating is great, right on the canal. The wait staff was super knowledgeable and friendly. The prices are comparable to other Vegas restaurants. I was a little disappointed that everything is served al a carte, but overall the food was tasty and the atmosphere good.

Save your money! Zero atmosphere and food is not great. Burgers are small and no flavor....go to Guy Fieri's instead for a celebrity chef burger. I had the meatball sub which is a joke! One 4" roll with two golf ball meatballs and sauce that tastes like it came from a can. Very disappointing from these two chefs especially Joe who picks apart everyone's food on MasterChef. Nope, this is a must pass....sorry to say!

Horrible service. Only 2 tables in restaurant. 5 minute greet times. Never received 1 single refill, burger was average, didn't receive ketchup, server never returned. Had to flag a busser down to request the bill. All while manager leaned against the bar the whole time. Expected a lot more from the star of Restaurant Startup.
Place is infested with cockroaches. I understand it's common in Vegas but when you can't eat your dinner cuz they are crawling over your feet, that's a problem.

This was below average service and food. I was excited to try the restaurant but so disappointed. Service was very slow, drink refills didn't happen, and that hot sauce I requested..... forgotten. But my primary interest was the food. The burger arrived luke warm (likely sitting on the counter for a while) and if hot and fresh would have been a three star burger at best, nothing special IMO. The fries were just ok as well. For this restaurant I was expecting a gourmet food experience, that was not the case. Try Prime Burger instead.

Ordered fried oyster, fried pickles, bottom burner burger

Fried oyster- delish- 5 stars - not over cooked 

Fried pickles- would not order again- needs to be more pickled. Breaking was blah- tasteless . They could have been more creative e with the dipping sauce.. It was plain old mayo- or at least that's what it tasted like 

Bottom burner burger- bread was blah.. The meat was okay. Maybe more salt and pepper? Jalapeño pesto has a very strong kick to it.. Probably overpowering the meat!  Would not order again 

Wished it was better

This place was fantastic. I was in need of a good burger, so upon taking out my nifty Yelp app, it led me to this place. Excellent service from the get-go, we sat and gazed at the menu. The beer selection was decent, and the burger I had was absolutely perfect. I had a milk stout that was pretty tasty too. I can't understand any bad reviews coming from this place. If there is, it's probably from uppity vegetarians.

The Bar Burger (aka Build Your Own Burger to other burger places) was a very good burger. The burger patty was large and cooked to perfection (medium well was perfect with just the slightest hint of pink). The bun, though, was slightly lacking, being dry compared to other burger joints in Vegas. The location of B and B was superb, with the patio located right along the canal outside the Venetian. The service was amazing, and unlike many other places had great service even after ordering just water. Overall, its a good burger and a great burger joints, but not as good as other burger places such as BLT Burger in the Mirage and Burger Bar in Mandalay Place.

The B&B group has garnered a lot of accolades ever since Chef Mario Batali and Joe Bastianich partnered up and created some of the best restaurants in the United States.  Babbo, Lupa, Esca, Casa Mono, Tarry Lodge, Del Posto, Osteria Mozza, Pizzeria Mozza, Chi Spacca, Bar Jamon, Becco, Carnevino, OTTO Enoteca Pizzeria, B&B Ristorante, and the massive Eataly.  So when I heard they opened a casual burger and beer restaurant in Vegas, I had to try it.

Being lenten season, I gave up red meat, rice, and pork.  So no burger for me, but luckily, they do serve lobster roll.

I went on my last day in Vegas for lunch with my new found friends at the seminar that I was attending.  I ordered the lobster roll and nutella shake.

Both were wonderful!  The lobster was sweet and cooked perfectly, it has a nice coat of mayo but not overpowering.  The bread was great, nice light golden brown crisp on the outside and has a nice chew on the inside.  Perfect bread to lobster ratio.  Great in every single way.

The nutella was uber rich, not in a bad way but my goodness, this shake is pure awesomeness.  It was very hearty to say the least.  It just hit the spot.  wonderful shake!

Now with the food reviewed, let's talk about the restaurant itself.  It feels "forced".  I felt that they did not have to open a type of restaurant like this, it's stuff into a corner of the Venetian.  This is not the typical restaurant they open, it's too casual, to the point where the staff seems like fresh graduates from high school.  No service at all.  One of the diner had use one of the chairs to put all our bags into it, the manager asked us if he can take the chair back because they "may" use it.  The place was half empty, this itself is not typical B&B service.  The kid servers just stand there and talk to each other like it's high school once again.

When we asked for the bill, it took 22 minutes to get our bill and another 3 minutes to run the card.

I would skip this restaurant.  It's a polar opposite from my dinner at Carnevino.  Yes, totally different restaurant but service in any restaurant should be consistent, especially when they're own by the same group.

While staying at the Venetian, my brother and I stopped by B&B to grab a beer and some apps to watch a game.

We ordered the "sweet chili soy" wings, and some onion rings. The wings were amazing, actually some of the best I've had: moist, tender, and bursting with flavor. The onion rings were good as well. 

The service is the reason why this is 4/5 instead of 5/5. We sat at the bar, and despite there only being one other group there, we were repeatedly ignored while the bartenders were chatting away with the other employees. Hopefully this is not the norm.

Ugh. This place is so sub-par. Expected more since the names of famous chefs are attached to it. Anyways, don't waste your time with this place. The burgers suck and there's not even a wide selection of beers. You can walk out into the casino and find lounges with more options. Heck, yard house has better options! Anyways, my bf's fish sandwich was not good. He had to peel off the soggy "fried" skin to finish it. My simple salad with chicken was also not good. The chicken had 0 flavor. Don't be fooled by advertisements or websites recommending this place. It's all a lie! Additionally, the hostess looked like a boring death sentence. When we arrived she was reading her book, wearing a sweatshirt and showed us to our table with absolutely no enthusiasm or warmth. Come on woman, wake up and do something!!

DON'T EAT HERE!!!!! So, we ordered 3 things, 2 were terrible! My $18 salad had brown lettuce, literally. Brown. So I sent it back, the next one tasted just terrible. So I didn't eat any of the salad, just the chicken on top. At least they only charged me for the chicken, not the salad. Sweet potato fries were cold. Sent them back, the second batch was ok. Boyfriend's burger was ok. Also extremely loud and slow. :(

Was probably the best meal I while in Vegas.  We stopped here for a late dinner and watched the gondolas and Mirage volcano going off.  I had the Royale with cheese and my fiance had the Morning After.  Both were spectacular.  Only gripe would be that the burgers do not come with fries, you need to order a side.

It was my bachelorette party and we were staying at the Palazzo. My friend and I got there early and decided to take a quick walk around and grab a bite. I read about it on UrbanDaddy in an old email and decided to try it, especially since I love burgers.

I ordered the Royale with Cheese, medium rare, alongside fries and the slaw. And you can't have a burger without beer, so I ordered a Blue Moon.

The burger was DELICIOUS. I HIGHLY recommend stopping by... oh man, so good. The fries and slaw were okay... if I could do it again, I'd order just the burger, which I did... before I flew out two days later on a Sunday.

My friends ordered the morning after burger and said it was amazing as well. 

It comes with a small sliver of pickled vegetables.

I had great expectations for this restaurant showcasing Mario Batali and Joe Basstianich. But were we extremely disappointed. 
When we stepped into the restaurant, I should have heeded my instinct and turned around and walked out. The atmosphere was fast food stark, half empty and the hostess wanted to seat us in the back where there wasn't even the benefit of watching the sports offerings at the bar. 
The menu prices were high; we ordered a couple of beers on tap, onion rings, fried oysters to share which were over fried, split a so-so overpriced burger. Then we were smacked in the face when we got our bill for $82. 
Definitely NOT worth it. Do not waste your money here. There are better places you can go for a good burger in LV!
I'd give this place 0 stars if I could.

I was at the Venetian yesterday for the Consumer Electronic Show.  I decided to try B&B Burger and Beer instead of driving somewhere to eat.  

I was surprised that the place was not busy at 12:45 PM.  I sat at the bar and ordered their Bar Burger (build your own), an order of fries and ice tea.  I mentioned my server that I don't want salt on the burger and fries.

It took 17 minutes before my lunch was served.  The burger was average.  I ordered it on a sesame seed bun with lettuce, tomato and added Provolone cheese.  The bun was not soft and chewy.  The lettuce was iceberg lettuce - no nutritional value to it.  A single slice of tomato - could not taste the tomato.  The burger was cooked medium instead of medium-well as I requested.

The fries had six to eight full length fries.  The rest were broken pieces of fries.  The fries were good and fresh.

The cost:

Bar Burger (burger, lettuce and tomato)  $10.00
Provolone Cheese (all cheeses on the menu) $2.00
Fries $2.00
Ice Tea approximately $3.00 

My total bill with tax was close to $23.00 Wow!

I would have been better off with convention food. 

A much better place to go is Bachi Burger in Las Vegas.

Let's start by saying I nor the other person in my party eat pork. We spent 5 minutes talking with the waitress how pork does not belong in a lobster roll and ordered a lobster roll with NO bacon. The lobster roll came out with bacon. We told the waitress and she took away the roll and the manager came over. They did not bring us a new roll but instead gave us a free milkshake (which we didn't even want) the bill came and we mentioned something about taking the roll off since it was made incorrectly and we were never brought a new one. They wouldn't take it off the bill because they gave us a milkshake that we didn't even want. I can't believe Mario and Bastianich put their name on this place. Obviously it's just so they can make money. They definitely wouldn't eat the slop served here. The cod sandwich was flavor less and soggy. I wish we would have ate at Mcdonalds (no joke)

Nothing special about this place. Burgers are ok at best and most definitely overpriced.  Certainly nothing that you should need a reservation.   We also had potato salad and cole slaw.  Potato salad was drowning in dressing.  Cole slaw had nuts in it.  Both again ok at best.  There are much better things you can spend your money on.  Fast food burger joints are better than this burger.

Horrible decision to grab lunch here today. Chicken wings were microscopic and burned. Tiny menu. Fries were obviously frozen and burgers are small. Nothing stood out about this place at all except for the frazzled waitress waiting on 20 tables AND tending bar too. Amazed the 2 chefs would put their name on this restaurant!! Yuk
Good burgers and GREAT onion rings!  If you're staying in or near the Venetian and have a soft spot for gourmet burgers do check this out.

Had a late night burger after gambling.  We were looking for the perfect snack, not a fancy place but not a fastfood/buffet eatery either.  The burger did not disappoint.  We ordered the burger with the jalepeno, (can't remember the name), medium rare.  It was sooooo good.  Felt as though it melted in my mouth.  Service was friendly and efficient.  We sat at the bar.

Thy don't list it on the menu, but there is horseradish in *everything*. Ordered burger with BBQ sauce - horseradish in it. Caesar salad - horseradish in it. I dislike horseradish...  would not recommend.

Very expensive, with just "ok" food. Wasn't a fan. My bun was soggy and my medium burger was definitely medium rare. The Caramelized onions were mush. The service was weird. It seemed like it was almost their first day open. Guy observing the tables told our waitress to come check on us. We asked for our bill at that time since we had been waiting for someone to come by for awhile. She then goes and discusses with the guy on the floor something. Then, they both go to the bar and send the boy at the bar to our table. We then ask him for the check. He finally got us our $65 bill for 2 people. 2 burgers, 2 fries, and 1 beer.

I throughly enjoyed my experience at B&B. A few friends and I were walking The Strip and wanted to grab lunch at a place with out door seating and we came across B&B. I ordered the Bar Burger with a pretzel bun, mushrooms and cheese, medium. It was cooked perfectly and tasted amazing. One of the best burgers I've had! We also ordered the fries, I will say I enjoyed the taste better when they weren't piping hot. 

I loved it and hope to go back next time I'm in Las Vegas!

A tad pricey for a burger joint, but well worth it.  A good burger is an art; and this place has the high quality ingredients & service to pull it off.  The "drive through" was perfect.  There was also a lamb burger on special, go for it, if it's an option!  Go for the onion rings.

Poor service and the quality of food is not fit to be in Las Vegas. They asked us if we had allergies to any food before we went into the restaurant which was suspicious because we have never heard a restaurant host ask that but that was ok not a big deal but after we ate we felt sick we couldn't finish our meal because it was so bad. A waiter asked us how we were doing and we asked why they asked us if we had any food allergies before they sat us down, and in a condescending tone, the waiter replied 'so we won't feed you what you're allergic to and you won't die'. Then we told the waiter we asked this because we do feel sick and also commented that our burger wasn't good, we didn't really care about being credited back. The waiter replied, "well unfortunately you have already eaten half of your meal, so we can't give you your money back". But we split our meal, so we only took a few bites each. Overall the food was awful it wasn't even a little good I felt like I was going to throw up  the service was awful the only good thing was the ambiance outside but the inside looked like a fast food restaurant.

I just have to give such a high rating because I have been so disappointed by other gourmet burgers that I feel like it has been years since I have had a great burger.
This was a great burger.
I didn't love the atmosphere, I thought it was a little cold and not an environment I would be tempted to hang out and enjoy a few drafts.  However, for $9, I had the drive-thru burger and devoured it.  I am lucky they don't have a location close to my home or I would be getting one of these weekly.
Everything about my burger was spot on.  And my appetizer of the un-fried mozzerella was delicious.

My first stop on this trip to Vegas... After a long day of traveling and not yet a real meal, this was just what I needed! It was casual and welcoming... The food was delicious, and to top it off, their beer selection was plentiful and interesting! My favorite part was the staff... They love their job and it shows. I will make sure I stop in again on the next trip!

Lunch with clients.  Six of us. 

Service - excellent 
Wait - None. Sat right down
Selection - Very Good ( more than just burgers )
Food - I had Cuban Sandwich.  Very Good and tasty.  Had their home made chips...slight greasy.  Our guest had assorted burgers. They really enjoyed each.
Price - affordable. 

I would recommend this establishment on your next visit to Las Vegas. 

Enjoy!!

This is the second restaurant that I have been to with Mario Batali's name on it, this is the second one in which I have been very disappointed. The Good; onion rings and and the relish on the side of the plate. The mediocre; french fries.  The you can get a better burger at IN-N- Out, Burger King, or almost any chain burger place; the burgers.  The burgers were not cooked to order as requested and were nothing special to begin with, 3 different burgers at our table and everybody was disappointed.  The bad;  The B and Bs  should be ashamed of the meatball hero, to say it was mediocre would be a compliment, on a glorified hotdog bun it was well overpriced  and under-flavored, the meatballs tasted like they came from the frozen food section of the grocery store.

If you are looking for a good 12 dollar burger, by 4 from IN-N- Out and give 3 to homeless people or  if your looking for a real gourmet burger and price isn't the problem, and you are in the same building, go up to Bouchon and get that burger, maybe the best in Vegas.
Service is slllooowwww, food was overpriced for quality, water served must have been shipped from Flint Michigan..Venetian should be embarrased.

I almost always stay at the Venetian so this new restaurant was a must try for me. It was conveniently located near the sports book room where i like to hang out at. I came in with a rather big group. The staff wasn't necessarily top notch or anything, especially since we were a big group. I decided to get the BOTTOM BURNER BURGER. It was DELICIOUS! So good that I had to order another one before I left Vegas. If you like a spicy burger you're sure to like this bottom burner! It has some jalapeno pesto sauce on it and another sauce, but the point is that they make a mean burger!! I also ate some fries and a Bloody Mary. Fries were fries, nothing too special. The blood Mary was spicy and very good.

Overall: This spot is in the Venetian and is a must try if you're anywhere near the area.
Hard to mess up on burgers and beer, my burger the bar burger was good. The beer was cold, but my wife and daughter hated theirs. The fries are small and the onion rings were not very good.

We had very high expectations when food TV stars pen their name on a burger joint; with Batali being a culinary household brand, I expected america's biggest, juiciest chargrilled burgers... I was soooooo wrong....Turns out we're on the Vegas strip, overfilled with tourists and this specific joint located at the East exit of the Venetian leading to the fancy shmancy 24 hour Walgreens, was way overhyped and overpriced for what it is;  it did however have a decent beer list.  And, too bad, as the ambiance could have been upbeat and nice.  

The restaurant was empty when we walked in at 10pm and the hostess stated that we can only sit at the bar as the entire dining room, which closes at 1am was closed.  Shame on you Batali!!!

As for the food, it showed extremely well on the plate, nice presentation and looked appetizing (as you can see by the pictures I took of my meal); but that's where the meatfest honeymoon I was hoping to be on, stopped cold in its feet!

The burger patty was super thin and small for the advertised 6oz patty and versus the huge bun housing it - and it looks nothing remotely close to the oversized burger  and Batali advertising poster pointing to the place throughout the property, elevators and hallways.  I mean come on! charge more but make it
Right! Don't offer what every Five Guys and Carls has; I came here for an upper-tier huge burger experience!!! I added a side salad and an order of kettle chips which were bland and ordinary, fillers: nothing special.

Once we sat at the bar, the Service was decent but not great.  Both bartender and wait staff didn't seem
To want to be there as their body language and small chatter between courses gave the impression they were eager to get out of the place and party, no! No! No!  

Skip this dump, the bill For my consumption was a waste of USD$32.  #RipOff #NeverAgain

Stopped in for an early dinner with my buddy.  

The food was really great for the most part.  My burger was one of the better "gourmet" burgers I've had in a while.  The onion rings were a disappointment, though.  The batter tasted like tempura, which isn't necessarily a bad thing, but there was too much of it.  There was too much batter and not enough onion so the rings tasted mostly of batter.  I'd order the burger again but not the rings.

Full bar with a nice whiskey selection and some good craft beers to choose from.  What's not to like?

The service was quite good.  Our server was attentive but not intrusive and delivered a pleasant meal.

The place had a nice atmosphere, but it seemed the place wasn't drawing the crowd it should be drawing, which can be a self fulfilling prophesy.  We almost passed in the place because the place was mostly empty during dinner time.  

Bottom line:  I wouldn't go out of my way, but this place would be a solid choice if you are staying at The Palazzo or The Venetian.

My friend and I had lunch there today and were greeted and seated right away. Although this is a burger place the sandwiches were calling out to us. I ordered the pastrami which was delicious and my friend ordered the meatball sandwich. We split an order of fries, which surprisingly taste a lot like in-and-out. My friend had the bourbon shake and I had a little taste- the presentation is beautiful with whipped cream, a bourbon soaked cherry and green and white striped straw. She really enjoyed it and would order it again. Service was decent- although I asked for ketchup and it was never delivered. I will definitely go back to try the burgers....

This place is so good. I've only been twice but both times were amazing. I hate that we live so far away because the basil margarita and lobster roll is always on my mind. Just watch out for the birds that get in your personal space if you sit on the patio!

My husband is a big fan of burgers and when we saw that Mario Batali had a burger joint on the strip, we knew we wanted to visit and we were not disappointed. 

I got the Royale with Cheese and my husband got the Very Good Burger. The concern I have with burger menus is that the flavors tend to be the same. These were very different burgers. Mine had a mild flavor, his was much more umami and bolder flavors. Both were cooked a delicious medium rare and the seasoning was spot on.

We also got the onion rings. They were delicious. My loan complaint of the day was that they were just served with ketchup, rather than some house-made sauce. 

We also got two different shakes. I got the caramel swirl and he got the cherry bourbon shake. They were both phenomenal tasting and there was snafu for us to swap flavors and have almost two full shakes. 

It's not cheap for a shake and burger, but I've never had a shake and burger as good as those were. Definitely worth the up charge, in my mind.

Came here early for lunch, the beer selection was good. Service was okay, but over time got worse even as the place remained dead. Annoying...

The burger left quite a lot to be desired. This place needs a lot of work from the decor, food, and service side.

Had an "ok" dinner here during my last night in Vegas which included some wings, a beer, and the morning after burger.

Their beer selection is more than adequate so I'm a little surprised by the select few on here that said it is lacking. A good mix of local, craft and international breweries on tap or in bottles. Typical Vegas prices around $8 a beer.

The wings had a decent buffalo sauce but since they are served lollipop style on a bed of blue cheese, they arrived a little colder than I'd like. I typical like "flappers" as opposed to legs so they weren't ideal.

The burger itself wasn't anything too special. The mushrooms were strong so that was the overbearing taste you get on this burger option. Probably needed some sort of strong sauce to cut into them a bit. Burger itself was cooked well but lacked much flavor.

Fries are shoestring which I like, no real complaints there. Decent option but not something I'd overly recommend.
Really Bad customer service Never coming back again! Food was cold. I do NOT recommend it at all!

I see a lot of bad reviews for this place however i ate here and thought the food was great. I had a burger it was very flavorful. The sweet pickles really made burger stand out. The prices were decent as well it was happy hour pricing. The only reason i gave 3 stars is cuz upon arrival we sat outside on there patio to eat because the view was beautiful and weather was nice but after 10min of sitting we began to see huge black water bugs crawling all over thee ground. I am sure this probably was because of the water in which the gondola rides were. But either way I hate bugs and was so disgusted as1 of them almost crawled on to my foot. We immediately complained and we were seated inside instead. No more bugs and i enjoyed my food. I will be back but i will NEVER sit outside in the patio area again.
Came here for our anniversary !  Excellent service great food! We even got a complimentary ice cream shake ! Totally recommend!!

Few first impressions of B&B: Overpriced and overrated. My friend and I ordered the Chicken Heroes Sandwich (Pretzel Roll, Arugula, Tomato Jam, Burrata, Balsamic Mustard) for $15. Talk about OD on bread! It made the sandwich too dry, and the dressing overpowered the meat itself. My ginger ale was soothing, but sadly overpriced for around $5. Our waiter was attentive, but kind of just hovering over us, which felt a bit uncomfortable. B&B will have to win my taste buds back, if I give it another chance.

Great burger!! Service was a little disappointing, front end does not communicate with the outdoor seating area. steve was " under the weather" but did not affect timliness of service. Love the food, questionable service.

Man I was so disappointed in this place I figured we'd the best burger in the world it was not it was just your average Burger cooked medium but it was still very dry bread with hard not soft it was alright overall our server was great though wife had a Long Island Iced Tea that tasted horrible so she took it off the bill Wi-Fi so had wings those are not crispy they were soggy this sauce is nothing special not very good Little Caesars is better

I was at a conference but early and it hadn't kicked off yet. So I wandered around looking for a good, but reasonably priced lunch option. This looked nice. I went for the fish burger and it was good. Very tasty. But kind of messy to eat and expensive. Good service.

This is the tale of two restaurants.

First - try the fried pickles - they are amazing.  The burgers are good as well.  You can choose your sauces, buns, accompaniments - etc.  Service is solid.

But then the bill comes - and you wonder if the value proposition is correct?   How do two burgers and a couple of beers each total over $90.00.  My conclusion - the value proposition is not there.  This is a pricey joint and my $ or in this case $$$ are better spent elsewhere.

This place rocks my Vegas socks.  I sat at the bar on the to-go side and was served dinner there by Patrick and it was phenomenal.

I went to carnevino the day before and was impressed but i was really blown away by the value for dollar at B&B Burger, not to mention the excellent service. 

I wasn't starving so I had the fried oysters, which were lightly coated in corn meal, I think. They were so light and crispy... An amazing preparation. I also got the chopped salad, which was similar to the one at Carne but was big enough for an entree.

Patrick made me a special gin creation, similar to an aviation but with his own touches. My only critique is that the signage to the restaurant from the casino floor is basically non-existent so.... I had to ask two people for directions to the restaurant.

This burger place is located in the beautiful Venetian hotel near the sportsbook.  My son was in the mood for a burger, so I thought why not give this place a try. I've dined at other Mario Batali restaurants and have been very  pleased.

Unfortunately,  I found the food here just ok. My burger was cooked the way I like it (medium rare), but was greasy and under seasoned. It also was cold, and I felt it sat at the counter too long. We shared the chips with blue cheese and bacon. The top 2 chips were delicious but after that, they were all a soggy mess. It was more like eating scalloped potatoes not chips! I complained to the waitress and she took them back and took them off my bill. My son was happy with his burger and said he would get again. 

The place is clean, and I like the bar with many flat screen TVs showing all the sports. The service was a bit slow, and the waitress seemed tired. The food is pricy for what you get and I think there are better burger places nearby. However,  if I'm in the area,  I may give this place another chance.

Sports , burgers and drinks, great combo. Service was fine. They changed the channel to a sports event we wanted to see. Staff seemed cool. Music playing was great! The spicy burger is awesome, fries are perfect. $10 for a burger in Vegas is a great price. It's expected in vegas. The only reason it got four stars and not five is  because they didn't have Jager for the Jager bombs.

Fantastically long list of beers available. Both draft and cans. 

The burgers are huge and super moist. Delicious pairings.  Try the fried pickles, light airy batter and perfect crisp!!!!

Well Mr. Batali & Bastianich,
   You should go back and re-vamp this restaurant.
    Quite mediocre at best. I know all the bestest, freshest incrediants are used, that's great! However, 4 different burgers all just ok~ we all expected more  the luke warm French fries didn't help either.
   Our server was pleasant, knowledgable & efficient! 
    Can't imagine a reason to revisit 
B & B Burger & Beer. You want an GREAT burger??? Go to BACHI BURGER  you won't be disappointed

Was a little nervous to come here after reading the reviews.  People either loved it or think it's overpriced and the service is bad.  The price is the price - I mean it's a strip burger in a nice hotel - so no issues here.  

I must say the service was very good.  We had people refilling our drinks regularly, the waiter was friendly and efficient and the food came out quickly.  We went at about 4:30pm on a Thursday so there wasn't a big crowd, but my experience was certainly above average.

I had the Royale with Cheese (Robiola Cheese, Caramelized Onions, Grilled Treviso, Parmigiano-Mascarpone Cream).  I wasn't a big fan of the grilled treviso, and I thought the sesame bun didn't quite stand up to the quality of the meat & other ingredients.  Would try the Drive-Thru burger next time on something other than the sesame bun.  The fries were good, but not special.  The onion rings were way above average.  

I would definitely come back.

Went to B&B Burger for lunch and I am giving it a 2 star rating because of two things. First of all, the service was okay and secondly, my chicken burger was under cooked. The hosts were awesome to greet us, but then the server took a while to approach us even with the low amount of people in the restaurant. So, after 5 mins the gentleman got our drink orders. Then, he was nice to ask if we wanted any recommendations. Our food came out fairly quickly, but my chicken was undercooked. I asked for jalepenos on my sandwich and ordered hot sauce too, but didn't get any. Another gentleman that was not my server was kind enough to bringvme some. I will say this, I did enjoy the fries very much and I loved the environment as well.

Overall, my experience at B & B was OKAY.  Their menu is very unique, so if you are looking for a burger with a twist this is the place for you. I would give it another try hoping my server is a little more attentive next time.

Came here looking for a late night bite to eat. We were told it would be a 15 minute wait so we waited in the Sportsbook which is located right next to the establishment. After we received the text that our table was ready, we noticed that there were quite a few tables open. We order our food with a waitress who frankly wasn't engaged at all. We get it, it's been a long night, but we still deserve some customer service. Anyway, to top it off, one of the sandwiches we order has a piece of paper stuck in between the fish patty and the bread. Like - for real?! When it was brought up to the waitress, she said, "That's pretty disguisting. Did you eat it?" Uh, what?! Yes, it was eaten. She then offered to take the sandwich off of the bill. That's it?! Quite disappointed with the quality of food and service we received. This was our first time in and probably our last.

Came here for dinner on a Friday night. We had a reservation, but there didn't seem to be much of a wait. 

We started with a few orders of wings which we all enjoyed. I ordered the Chop Salad (Salami, Beans, Provolone, Cucumber, Oregano Vinaigrette) and it was goooood, I ate it all down to the last piece of lettuce. Other orders included the meatball hero (my friend said it was just ok), the morning after burger (yumm according to one person who ordered it, ok according to another ), and the really good (really good lol).  Sides are separate so we ordered an order of French fries and an order of onion rings for the table. Much to our delight they accidentally brought over an extra order of each and allowed us to keep them gratis! The fries and onion rings were both awesome, we ate them all and were scraping the bottom of the plate for more.

I ate here twice during my recent stay in Vegas.  Both with a group of 5 or more.  Each time, the service was lovely and very accommodating to our rowdy corporate bunch haha.

My friends went nuts trying out different beers.  I settled on milkshake and OMG it was enough that could of fed all of us.  The taste was amazing, but then again Nutella never leaves anyone in doubt.

Each time I ate the eggplant Parmesan.  And each time it was super amazing.  I mean...I don't eat red meat so this was one of the few options.  But even if I HAD been a meat eater I would have still choose this.  The guys claimed the burgers were bomb and well prepared.  

Each time we ordered several of the sides to accompany our meals.  The fried pickles weren't quite Memphis standard, but the friend mozzarella and other items were delicious!  Good portions seemed perfect for our group.

Would definitely go here again!

Stumbled upon this place outside the Venetian, and I thought it was going to be way out of my price range (I mean, Batali and Bastianich, right?). But it was surprisingly pretty affordable (for Vegas standards, anyway). 

The Morning After burger was divine -- fried egg, truffle. Yum! 

Note that the burgers aren't your massive portions, but they're filling enough, and they don't shy away from flavor. They don't come with sides either, but do try the onion rings. They were the crispiest and lightest I've ever had.

They had a good beer selection, plenty of nice, outdoor seating (with shade), and a good mix of burgers, sandwiches and sides. Not bad. Not bad at all!

The burgers were average and, as stated by previous people, the buns were cold/stale. Not the high quality we expected. Worst of all, a bat somehow flew into the restaurant from outside and got disoriented flying low near our heads. When we asked the waiter he just laughed and said "oh he's been here since 1:00 in the afternoon", it was 7:00 pm at this point. It seemed like there was a lack of management, since no one seemed to know what to do about the bat. Definitely ruined our experience.

For a place that has beer on its name it has a very limited selection of craft beer, that's why I gave 3 stars. I was a little disappointed when I sat down at the bar and saw the menu. Even the burgers doesn't look great on the paper. they taste very good, though. I ordered it medium rare and it was right on, very tasty, finger licking good. Perhaps they should rebrand it and take the beer out of the name.

Nice spot for lunch today. Despite the heat we took a table outside, the shade and misting fans are key, and watched people take gondola rides. 

I built my own burger and for the first time ever experienced a sunny side up egg on top. Fabulous addition although my burger was a tad undercooked.  The husband had the Bottom Burner, perfect amount of spice for his taste with the added bonus of a couple of onion rings on top. Fries were amaze balls. 

Service was very friendly and quick.

This place was unexpectedly good. In fact, one-of-the-best-burgers-in-Vegas good.

The Morning After (Sautéed Mushrooms, Fontina, Sunny Side Egg, Truffle Aioli, Friseé) & Onion Rings. AWESOME. This combo alone warrants a second visit.

The Royale with cheese (Robiola cheese, Caramelized Onions, Grilled Treviso, Parmigiano-Mascarpone Cream) & Cabbage Slaw was also great. But not as good as The Morning After.

Will return!
Great burger and craft beer selection. I wish I had been hungrier so I could have tried a shake!

Outstanding!!!! I can't tell you how much I love this place!  Went for lunch with my husband and my son on Friday, WoW!  We chose a patio seat, the weather was perfect.  Nate took care of us at the table and he is so on point, never intrusive, but always on time!

So my husband had the Bottom Burger, cooked to his perfection!  My son had the The Bar Burger just the way he liked it, you build this one yourself, he absolutely Loved it!  I can't get past a good Pastrami, and Yes Yes Yes is this one One of The Best I have ever had!  

The patio offers such a wonderful ambiance I can't imagine sitting inside, although for your sports fans, there are plenty of TV's around the restaurant for your game enjoyment, as well they have an outside bar that faces the Venetian Sports Book.  So if in fact your game or sport is not on a channel in the restaurant, just hang out in the bar just outside the restaurant.  

Jeffery, the General Manager has a team that is Stellar!  You just can't go wrong here!

it's no Burger Bar (Hubert Keller still owns the crown for burgers in Vegas), but at the prices, it doesn't need to be. of my sample size of 1 burger at each location, Batali's joint beats out Gordon Ramsey's BurGR. my burger at BurGR was too dry and lacking in beefiness of flavor. 
at B&B i ordered the burger with the fried egg. it was a bit sloppy - fell apart too quickly and became a drowned out mess, but still quite tasty even after it lost its structural integrity. and the first few bites before the bun disintegrated were heaven. I would probably order the same without the mushrooms, as I suspect that those are the key culprit in the rapid deterioration of my bun (other than the burger juices and the runny egg yolk, neither of which i'm willing to eschew).
the meat is well seasoned, juicy, and cooked to exactly my requested medium-rare. BurGR failed on all 3 of those accounts, so already B&B wins on that account alone.

Another burger joint with my trainer for binge weekend.. Great burger, fresh ground black angus, house smoked bacon, house pickled veg., a few tasty sauces. Not much style for a Mario Batali restaurant. But a reasonably priced upscale burger with a clean lower fat content for a juicy burger.

So gross! Food was terrible and service was just as bad. Both my husband and I got the same thing. Forgot the name, but it had a "fried" egg on it. It came out fast, probably too fast because the egg was completely raw and runny. We asked the waiter and he said ya, it wasn't cooked. Back it went. 20 minutes later they brought it back and my husbands burger wasn't cooked right so they had to send his back in. It took forever to come back and he didn't even bother eating it at that point. The only good thing was the onion rings. The beer on draft that I ordered was a disappointment too. 

As far as the service goes..our waiter was terrible. He left in the middle of us ordering to make sure a table left him a tip, tacky. He never really apologized that our food wasn't cooked and never came to see if we needed anything or how the food was. He should have sent a manager over to apologize after having to send the food back twice. If you want a real burger go to bobby's burger palace!
Burger was good, fried oysters weren't as good. Overall good lunch.

I had such a fantastic experience here, and am only disappointed that we visited this establishment on the last day of our trip! 

After sending off our friend who had an earlier flight, my best friend and I were famished. We packed our things, checked out and placed our luggage in hotel storage and had time to kill until our 9:30pm flight. The first order of business was FOOD. We were staying at The Venetian and decided on B&B Burger which honestly turned out to be one of our best decisions ever.
