From the moment that we stepped in, the ambiance was chill with the World Cup on multiple screens, the entire staff was friendly  and pleasant, and our server Marcus won us over. You know when you are so hungry that you can't think straight? ...That was us! But Marcus patiently worked with us, was very knowledgeable and attentive while answering all of our menu questions, made recommendations and was genuinely fun and comical to boot. 

At one point, when we inquired about the taste/consistency of one of the cheese options that was part of the BYOBurger section, Marcus even recruited help to get an accurate description for us (even though we ended up going with standard cheddar!) 

He absolutely went above and beyond, and, along with our food, was the most enjoyable part of our visit to B&B! I live in NYC - born and raised - where we are generally discerning and have unlimited access to all types of food, and I can honestly say that the buffalo wings, lobster roll and craft cheeseburger we had here at B&B were all delicious! Definitely, visit here and ask for Marcus! Next time I'm in town, I will be sure to. :)

Service here was awful on Sunday afternoon... Our waiter never even spoke to us unless he had too and it took a good 5 minutes for him to even acknowledge he was sat with new guests... Other servers, seeing we hadn't been greeted bc we had no drinks, walked by like we didn't exist and they couldn't be bothered. Total bullcrap... Food wasn't anything to write home about either... I will say, the heavy-set man in the jersey that ran the food out to our table was very pleasant and enthusiastic. He deserved the tip instead of our server.... I don't think we will ever return here. It was overall disappointing.

This place should close, fire everyone, clean up, hire some people who care, and re-open! Can't believe Chefs Batali and Bastianich would rep this kind of place. The food: boring, tasteless, and expensive for the low quality. The service: poor, at best. It was slow and clunky. We had the lobster roll and Jalapeño burger. The lobster was tough and the flavor was non-existent. The burger reminded me of that found in a fast food place. The partially saving grace were some overly salty and greasy onion rings. The ambiance: cheap and dirty deli. 
Maybe it's from being in a Vegas hotel, but that should not be an excuse for these two fine chefs. Maybe they should visit some and set better expectations. Otherwise,
it can turn into yet another yogurt stand. Surely it should not be a burger joint at present.

I got the royale with cheese and this burger was the absolute best burger I have ever had. Service was quick and the server made sure my father'a burger was cooked perfectly rare. It was not over cooked in the least. My boyfriend's burger was the definition of medium rare and the potato salad we got was so delicious. Definitely going back before we leave vegas this was the best burger place I've ever experienced!
Stopped for a while to enjoy the sunshine and the gondoliers! Server recommended the Sashimi Peppers and they are really good! His wine selection is quite nice too.

Well, by most off-the street burger places, even those who tend to be as pretentious as this place, this effort falls flat - but the experiences did have potential.

One night with a client I had the Really Good Burger cooked MED with an order of fries. I mentioned to the waitress the birger was overcooked and that the fries were limp and cold, she brought me another burger - bloody rare, not MED -.  I opted for the Salt & Pepper Chips after seeing the fries. The replacement chips were way overseasoned. They were so salty they burned my taste buds. If it were not for the draft Stella...

Two nights later I was on the receiving end of a dinner out by one of my vendors. They wanted to go to B&B. Being a gracious guest, I kept quiet thinking I could just find something else to order than a burger or a fried potato side.

I ordered Crispy Cod sandwich and a lettuce wedge. The fish was greasey but it was hot, another 30 seconds of draining in the basket would have made it much better than bleeding the oil on the bottom of the sandwiches tarter sauce covered base. Again, it was OK, but for the price I would of expected something ... more. 

If everything was executed and served correctly, I could easily give B@B Burger and Beer 3 to 3.5 stars. However, after two attempts in a week I'm crossing this place off of my list of Vegas places to eat, at any price.

I was ecstatic to eat at this restaurant!  Overall I enjoyed the food. I ordered the Royale and a side of fries. The burger was good and juicy but the fries were disappointing (especially for $6).  I sampled my friend's warm potato salad and it was really good! It's different but flavors were spot on. I would say that it's pricey for the quality of everything our table received but, then again, it's Las Vegas.  The service was also a bit lacking, which was a bit of a surprise given the 2 names on the restaurant sign.  I would go back but I don't think it will be a regular stop in Vegas, especially since my friends didn't enjoy their food like I did.
OVERrated!  Service was so slow and food was very mediocre.  The bartender was rude and made terrible drinks.

Ugh. Starving but the burger was so greasy I could not eat it. Whatever was on it covered the plate, bun, hands, napkins to the point of puddles. Ironically it was the one question I had asked the waiter before because of the Aioli and was assured it was not greasy. Bad service. An experience in and of itself because I don't expect much from a burger joint. The generous one star was because the onion rings were amazing. And  that  is the least you can award on yelp.
For sandwiches & burgers, this place is top notch! One of the best chicken sandwiches I've had anywhere. Would strongly recommend.

Almost left without eating. Walked up and asked hostess for a table for two. First she had to put our name in the computer before they could seat us. Uhhh, OK. Then she asked if there was anything we were allergic to. OK, a little stranger.

We were seated. The restaurant was about a third full. Someone came and filled our water, but we still had no menus. We waited about 15 minutes and were just about to get up and leave when the guy came back and filled our water again. I asked him if he could find a waiter for us, who then finally came over. Oh, before that the manager had dropped off the menus, but told us someone would be there to take our order shortly.

Finally we ordered a couple of the "Royale" burgers and the warm potato salad. My wife was going to order a milkshake, but it was $9 for a regular, and $12 if you wanted them to put a shot of rum in it. No thanks. Of  course, the waiter didn't bother to ask if we wanted anything else to drink, so all we had was water.

The burgers came after a CONSIDERABLE wait. While we were waiting, the table behind us got up and walked out, because like us, no one came to wait on them.

The burgers were OK. Pretty average, nothing special. I ordered medium, and it was medium-rare. My wife's was well done as ordered. The warm potato salad was very good. The highlight of the meal. The burgers were definitely not worth the $15 they charged. I would say it was more of a $7 burger. Not even close to the quality of what you get at Gordon Ramsey's Burgr in Planet Hollywood.

The staff was disorganized, weird, and the manager didn't seem like she was in charge. Don't bother with this place. Head to Burgr for the best burger on the strip.

I must say this was by far the worse dinning experince that my wife and I have experinced in a good while. 

To start off, when first seated I asked the hostess to point me in the direction of the restrooms, and she explained that if I need to use the restrooms I would have to exit the restaurant and use the casino's facilities.

After waiting at our table for over 10 mins with only 6 guest in the resturant, our waitress finally took our drink orders. My wife and I would have normally ordered cocktails, but we had just left a 4 hour cocktail party and planned on slowing down for the night. We both ordered water, to my surprise the water was not even chilled or did not have ice.

The best part of the night was when our cups ran dry, and we noticed our waitress spending her time taking shots with the bartender vs serving her guest.  

I Love Burger is by far the better choice of the two. Very disappointed.

B&B has done it again... This new place is quite good.   The prices are a little in the high side but typical for the Las Vegas strip.  However the quality of the food is very high...the burger menu  is small but the make your own burger  has some fantastic selections.   The sides are good... But the onion ring are amazing, lightly breaded and lightly fried so the the onion inside tastes almost fresh still..if you want a none fried option try the warm potato salad...

We went for dinner. This is simply just a burger "joint". Don't have any expectations at all going in. The meat looks like a Bubba burger from the box. Waitstaff seemed out there -out of touch. The appetizer came bf our drinks. Appetizer-greasy fried pickles w mayo on the side. And within 2minutes (literally) the burgers came. We ordered a side of onion rings but were served old dried up French fries. Still waiting for our drinks. My Manhattan was served in a tall glass used for drinking ice water. I also ordered it neat and it came on the rocks. So the waiter drained the ice and put it back in the tall glass. I figured they didn't have the appropriate glass but when I was leaving I saw those cute vintage champagne glasses w drinks in them. Idk what happened to my drink. So the waiter then brought onion rings and told us to keep the fries. Really-they were so stale. I wonder how long they were siting there. Onion rings had a lot of batter and I had to searched for the onion and again-grease. You can have fried food without all that grease. It is possible, just not here. Change the name to Hangover Relief.

Place is the bomb! Had a couple meals in less than 6 days. I went with burger with egg twice in less than a week. My friend also enjoyed it. Sit outside by the water. It's a great place for lunch, dinner or snack.

The food was good but the service we received was terrible. The server didn't check in with us about our meals or drink refills and when it looked like we were done he slipped our check on the table like he was sneaking drugs to us. Also, half way through one of our burgers a woman came by trying to get her plate even though she was still eating, granted her boyfriend had stolen it off her plate and was taking bites from it. - 2013 (Just realized it hadn't posted??)

Our server was so unbelievably nice, but the food was just ok. We both had onions on our burgers when we asked for none, but what can ya do.  I really hate that yucky taste the burger has after taking a fresh onion off of it.

 I think that the fried oysters were really good and had an interesting flavor to them. The fries were unimpressive. I love that everything is locally grown and used, and I think that's a plus with this restaurant. The burger itself was good, but I can't wait it was worth the $20 or that I would specifically seek out this place. 

I expected more from the Bastianich and Batali names. Again, serving staff was wonderful and the food wasn't fantastic but it did the job. The presentation was also nice.

After waiting 30 minutes for a table and being told they accommodate food allergies we tried to order a burger with lettuce rather than a bun, they told us they don't do any substitutions and it would be an extra 6 dollars for a side of lettuce. We left and went to I heart burger who substituted a side salad for the bread free of charge

We stopped here for a late night burger. I thought the quality would be spot on because after all it is a Mario Batalli restaurant. I have to say it was just ok which is a little disappointing to say. 

I got the "morning after" burger and my husband ordered the "really good burger" with gorgonzola. Out of those two I would have to say his was much better. After a few bites, I ended up deconstructing my burger, took the egg off first, then the bun... and at the end I was just eating the meat with a fork. 

The burgers were really greasy but without much flavor. 

We also ordered the fries to share. They were extremely salty. My husband appreciated that because he had a sore throat so that helped him out but to me, they were almost inedible.

Had a group of 14 during a conference... big group but took over 2 hours to eat and get the check. Burgers looked decent but my pastrami sandwich was pretty weak. Burnt toast and very little meat. They did take off 15% of the bill at the end, but that didnt seem like much. Anyway, I don't recommend it.

Five stars is not enough. This is the second best burger in the U.S. 

 B&B Burger & Beer was a Mario Batali and Joe Bastianich venture. They had other jointly owned establishments in town, so this provided B&B with enhanced access to stellar ingredients. The beef was a prime example. The beef blend (50% Brisket and 50% Chuck) was ground and blended fresh daily onsite from hand-selected sides of beef from Niman Ranch. The beef was broken down, ground, and blended by the on-site butcher. Yes, these guys had a guy picking out the sides of beef for the burgers. Niman Ranch beef is 100% Angus, vegetarian diet, and no hormones/antibiotic free. The burgers came out at 6 ounces each. The Drive Thru was two 3-ounce patties, and my burger was a single 6-ounce patty. The beef was splendid. The flavor hit us in a rush of sear, beef, salt and pepper, complex mineral notes, and a little blood. The texture was firm and then creamy. The burger patty was perfectly juicy with no trace of oiliness. The beef resembled  Stracciatella cheese  in its complexity and delicate texture, but the beef brought a sledgehammer of flavor to the palate. This was one of those bites that made me smile and slow down as I savored eat bite. The Drive-Thru Burger was very similar to my Bar Burger, except that burger had twice the sear and twice the cheese. I will be getting that burger on my next visit. The beef was perfect.

B&B Burger & Beer is now on my list of top burgers in the country. It edged out the burgers at BurGR on the merit of the sear. This burger was on par with the spectacular cheeseburger at The Brindle Room in NYC. I found myself already missing the burger as took my last few bites. I am fortunate to live close enough to Las Vegas to repeat this experience.  FINE DINING ON A BUN.
Hungover in Vegas? Come here for the best burger cure! I ordered a create your own cheeseburger on ciabatta bread and I'm still thinking about it!!

Onion rings were incredibly greasy and we didn't even finish half the order. The morning after burger was okay but definitely not impressive. I ordered an appetizer but didn't get it. Drinks were good.

Had the morning after burger and onion rings here and they were amazing. Well the burger was lol Onion rings are onion rings for the most part. The burger was topped off with a fried egg that was perfectly cooked as was my medium rare burger. Fresh toppings didn't hurt the overall flavor either. I recommend sitting outside of its not too hot. You  can watch the gondola rides. I didn't get to try any beer but they have a great selection that I will definitely try on my next visit.

We got there early, split an order of their dirty chips, which we both enjoyed. Husband had the burger with the bacon in it. I had the morning after burger. Was impressed by their beer selection, was not ready for beer yet, so we passed. 

I liked the decor, it was sleek, playful and urban at the same time. 

Waitress was robotic. 

While I really enjoyed our dish while we were there, my husband bit into a hard bone fragment that was lodged in his burger. He told the waitress. She kinda just shrugged her shoulders and said she would let the kitchen know. Seriously?  

We left the restaurant and it wasn't long that I started to feel ill, which was unusual as we slept in this morning and woke up relaxed and feeling ready to take on the day.  I tried to fight it and tried to enjoy the rest of the day. Couldn't. Had to go back to the hotel room to lay down. 

It is 8:07pm right now. We ate there sometime around 11am or 1130am. I still feel nauseous. Still in bed. 

Husband filled out the comment card including his email. Nothing from them yet. 

With so many choices in Vegas, I personally, will opt for something else.

I don't typically write reviews like this, but I'm so torn about how I feel that this may help me to organize my thoughts.
Ambiance/Decor- 2/5. The decor was just alright, more like a food court or a very nice fast food restaurant rather than a celebrity chef restaurant.
Service- 4/5. Our server checked on us throughout our meal several times and was quite pleasant. She initially put in the order for the wrong burger but came out right away and apologized. The correct burger was a bit delayed, but we were prepared thanks to her quick catch and explanation.
Food- Here's where things get dicey...  I guess I'll go with 3/5
We started with the "un-fried" mozzarella. I did not really like this. It was not at all what we were expecting. It essentially was toasted bread with a tomato and mozzarella dipping sauce. The bread was burned in many places, and the sauce was mostly tomato. 
The fries... Not good. I'd have preferred fast-food fries, to be honest. Thin cut, salty, not remarkable, and not good.
 However, I really enjoyed my "Morning After" burger. The flavor of the meat was great, as was the egg on top. I also really liked the mushrooms. The only downside was that I wish there were just a tiny bit more sauce on it, as it got a bit dry as I ate it. The bread was soft and delicious as well.  
Nutella shake- pretty yummy! It was thick, creamy, and had Nutella sauce and little crumbles on top. They also gave us a shaker of the "overflow", so there was plenty to share.

One other note- there is another B&B Restaurant inside the Venetian, which made things confusing. This one is located near the sportsbook.

We ate here yesterday early lunch! We sat on patio and it was a gorgeous day! The wait staff excellent and very attentive to us. The Drive Thru Burger was to die for and the onion rings I believe are the best onion rings we ever had! My husband says that and he is hard to please. I loved this place and will def go back next time in Vegas!

We all had burgers and they were good. Sweet potato fries were great, just a larger portion would be nice. Prices were fairly reasonable. We sat on patio next to the canal and enjoyed the ambiance. Service was excellent.

This was the perfect lunch after a late night on the strip! The Drive-Thru burger was fantastic and came recommended by our server, and the Meatball Sub/Hero was amazing. The meatballs have some kick to them from a perfect blend of seasoning and it was just what I needed. They brought by some of their house-signature beer on the house (it was my birthday!), which was designed by & exclusively for their restaurant. I really enjoyed it. The burgers & sandwiches come without any side, which adds to the price quickly, but the onion rings were phenomenal.

Boozy milkshakes , tasty burgers and a crisp and clean ambience. That sums up this place! We didn't have to wait and were seated immediately. It is very reasonably priced and offers a good variety to choose from. We had the Caramel Swirl and Baileys Chocolate milkshake and the potato salad to start with. Our server suggested the salad and we're so glad we listened to him. The burgers have unique and flavourful ingredients added to them, which make them stand out from the rest. They are more than just the usual mushrooms, tomatoes and cheese kind of burgers.

We had some friends in town staying at the venetian and had lunch over at B&B burger and everything we had was not bad, but not good.  The prices were fair for being in the venetian, but the food was just fair.  I would definitely not rush back and check out other burger places on the strip.

Pastrami sandwich with bacon is/was awesome!!!  Very good value based upon the quality & what you are paying.

Service was lacking even though there was only 4 other parties inside with over 8 servers for the evening

Solid burger spot to grab a quick bite to eat. 
The service was pretty quick & my burger was cooked exactly how I wanted it(Medium). Burgers were good,loaded fries were good, & the onion rings were good as well.
Nice place to go to grab some good & filling burgers.

We sat outside because of the nice weather. Hostess was friendly. Service we terrible and the food wasn't any better. The food lacked seasoning and several items were uncooked. Definitely a place to miss.

Now that nearly every casino has at least one 'gourmet' burger stand, it has become increasingly difficult to stand-out from the crowd.  Ramsay has had tremendous success with BurGR both through his celebrity status and creative menu, but it doesn't seem Batali put the same effort into his latest outpost, the fourth(!) in the Venetian alone.  

Located near the Venetian sports book in the old Rattlecan space, the decor is pure Batali and more befitting the Venetian that the former's graffiti adorned walls.  As for the burgers, there are very few (4 or 5, as I recall) pre-designed burgers and a handful of Heroes and shakes.  I had the build your own on ciabatta with caramelized onions, Gorgonzola and garlic aioli.  The bun was nice and soft and the burger had a fresh taste but seemed lost in the over sized bun.  The beer selection was solid and the availability of Racer 5 matched well with my burger.

The staff was all smiles and seemed genuinely happy to be there, something the staff of Rattlecan was never able to muster. 

Why only 3 stars?  I just expected...more.   More burger options (Kobe, turkey, veggie, etc), more creative sides, more effort in general.  Overall, it's a welcome addition to the Venetian and I wish them well.

Food was alright.    Service left much to be desired. Ordered a burger and fries to go, simple but when I asked the bartender for ketchup he assured me it was already included. No it wasn't.. hence 1star.

Hummus and Grilled Pita $7

The Morning After $15

The Bottom Burner $14

Fries $6

My wife and I came here with a friend for a stop over lunch before my friend's wife got out of work. The decor is very hip with a lot of orange colors and a bar. My friend and my wife had the morning after burger (Sautéed Mushrooms, Fontina, Sunny Side Egg, Truffle Aioli, Friseé) and I had the bottom burner (Jalapeño Pesto, Onion Rings, Mario's Hot Sauce). My wife and my friend said their burger was really good especially with the runny egg. My burger was really really spicy but good. The only negative I would say was that the jalapeño pesto was pretty much diced jalapeños! The fries were of the small kind i.e. in-and-out style. Overall, I would try this place again in the future as they got TVs to watch your sports and milkshakes!

And by the way, I ordered hummus to throw in something healthy for my lunch. Hehe

A friend and I went out to lunch here. 

Outside seating was nice because the weather was a good 70 degrees. I ordered the drive-thru burger and added bacon to it. The price was fare for the burger and it was good. I ordered a side of fries which was good for two people. 

Service: The hostess did not come off very friendly. She looked like she didn't want to be there. In addition, when we were seated, we didn't even have our utensils/napkin. We had to ask for it after we received our food. I couldn't get the attention of a waiter. 

****there is a bird issue!! Pigeons are walking around and flying, scavenging for food. After people leave, they'll go to the tables and pick at the food until the table is cleaned. Just very unsanitary.

If you are looking for a quick meal , go elsewhere. Took us 30 minutes to receive an average burger. I am surprised Mario's name is attached to
Such a disappointing restaurant. The beer selection, despite the name, is very limited and unimpressive . It's one of the rare times that I didn't order a beer with my burger. The fries were okay , but nothing exceptional. Overall the food is very average. I would sadly prefer in and out burger to this place given the poor service .

Max on the wait staff was awesome!! Went to Ramsay's place the night beforehand.  Go here.  No question.  They can actually cook a burger to temperature!

With guys on staff like Max recommending burgers, you're in good hands.  I rated this five stars because Max was attentive and helpful, and my burger was really good( I wonder where the came up with the name?)!  The well thought out beer list was great.  The green flash on draft was nice, too.

I must say I've had many burgers in my life that are in or above this echelon (Tiny Lounge in Chicago... If you can find it without walking past, good luck.  If you've been, you know what I'm saying), but Max made my day and bumped this from a four to a five star review.  A sense of humor, knowledgeable about the menu, an absolute delight.  Give the man a raise, because I'm coming back because of him!

Ramsay's Burgr is in decline and he needs to take his name off the place.  Go to burger & beer instead.  Trust me. Best burger in Vegas.

This place is tough to find, but once you do, you'll have a hard time understanding how you missed it! Came here for lunch. Burgers are yummy and service was friendly. I would definitely come here again. It's a bit on the pricey side for what you get, but what isn't. If it's a nice day, ask for a table outside. You can sit and listen to the gondoliers singing to their passengers as they ride by.

Great build your own burger cooked to perfection! Over priced like most of the Strip sadly - add $2 for slice of cheese  add 0.50 for mayo add $1.00 for lettuce tomato and onion which I did not eat. In total 15.00 for a 6 oz. burger!!!

3.5 Stars. B&B  Burger is located opposite the Race & Spots Book at The Venetian. The restaurant is very average looking and the interior design repels you as you walk past vs drawing you inside. We were craving a decent late night burger and decided to give this place a try. Our Custom burgers were around $15, fries $6, beers and cider were $8 ea. 

Pro: Our hamburgers tasted great! It definitely satisfied our burger craving. 

Con: Restaurant has bad ambiance. Didn't like the draft cider. Staff could use more people skills.

Food was good. Had the Bottom Burner. Cooked to order, nice amount of heat to it. The fries came out hot, tasty, but become inedible when once cooled. Onion rings were better option.

Beer selection was OK, have had most on menu, so, didn't wow from that aspect.

Where points were lost was service. Our waitress didn't really know the menu, so, she could not answer questions and really could not explain the concept of the restaurant/menu as part of her opening schpeil. Had difficulty taking the order, and when she entered the order, must have entered the wrong table number, because our food started to go to a different table. Runners then came with our food and said "you changed tables?".

Also: there was a constant battle going between different parts of the restaurant and staff re: music volume. One minute at deafening levels, next, down. Rinse repeat.

I had the royale with cheese (great name!) & husband had eggplant sandwich.  He loves eggplant & said sammy was really good.  I ordered my burger medium rare & it was perfect.  Great taste & quality.  It's a really good size too, not a ridiculous monster burger, just right before a night of fun.  We split the warm potato salad, which was delicious & a nice change from something fried.  It was so good we're going to try to recreate it.  We sat on the patio, got to hear the gondoliers sing a little & the weather was beautiful.  I've tried a few other burger places in Vegas & this is the best so far.  I'm not sure why it's not more crowded, but good for us.

Max, our server, is the best server you can possibly have. Always ask for him!

The fried pickles are amazing, unfried mozzarella is a must have and the chicken wings are nice and crispy. For our entrees we shared a lobster roll sandwich and a chopped salad. Max suggested the lobster roll, it was superb you can tell how fresh it is. The owners Mario and Joe definitely use the freshest ingredients. The onion rings and french fries are a great side to get. All the staff is friendly and personable. We shared a Nutella shake that was divine and a great way to end our excellent meal. I definitely recommend this place and especially our server, Max. He's the BOMB!  Thank you Max and B&B for a wonderful experience.

ate twice in my four days in vegas earlier this week and my oh my!!!! i am what you call a Onion Ring Critic. i love and hate onion rings. i absolutely LOVE onion rings waaaayyyyy more than fries BUT they always suck! their onion rings here are Soo effing good! in fact, THEE best rings i have ever had. an awesome batter and fresh sweet onions that are not quite raw and now quite fully fried!!! i had the drive thru burger the first time i visited and the really good burger the second time. BOTH on point!!cooked perfect, service was perfect and did i mention the BEST onion rings i have ever had????

Really good sauce. Ordered the un fried mozzarella and was pleased. Tasted like homemade sauce. Hubby ordered the bottom burger, very tasty. Only thing thing could have been better was the customer service. Waited 10 minutes to be seated. Hostess was no where to be found. Another customer walked up to us and said we were better off seating ourselves otherwise we'll be standing here all day. Apparently he sat himself as well. Waitress took FOREVER to give us our check. So good food, just crappy service.

The manager Vinny is EXTREMELY rude. She rolled her eyes at us when we were asking her questions, was extremely standoffish towards us and unhelpful. We called ahead to make sure we could split a check between a big party, which they said was ok, and then they suddenly said we could not at the restaurant. They were unhelpful and downright rude. The hostess was rude, as well. When I asked where my party was she just said "outside" and kind of brushed me off. Extremely unhappy with the service. Will not be back
Not as pricey as the sweet view could be. The burgers were kick a*! Beer selection wasn't as great as most places with beer in the name but the food made up for it!

Disclaimer: did not have burger  - had snacks. 

Overall: I'd love to come back and try their food but their milkshake was amazing and the beer selection much better than elsewhere on the strip. 

+1: Great location and service. We were promptly seated and order taken care of
+1: Great milkshake! I did feel like i was going to explode after finishing only half of it. Super rich and delicious. Definitely worth sharing. 
-1: A bit annoying that they don't have a bathroom inside. You have to walk into the casino and across the floor to even wash hands.
For a premium burger place with premium prices....not worth it. Atmosphere is like a cafeteria, service is unremarkable, food is good but not for the price

I really wanted to love this place and wished the other yelpers just had super high expectation of the place, which resulted in the low rating. However, I was quite disappointed with my meal.

We ordered 3 appetizers 3 shakes 3 mains. Waited for awhile and everything came all at once :( had to rush and ate everything at the same time. The price was ok, given it is located on the strip. Nice presentation. Loved all the flavors of our food. However, our food were all somewhat cold, oily and soggy. 

It looks like a nice place to grab a beer though.

Food was great, service not so much. I ordered onion rings, the waiter forgot them and when I asked he said they were coming and I asked him again about ten mins later, he cursed and said they were coming out. By this time I didn't want them anymore. When we asked if he could split up the bill he said "I might be able to".

We wanted a little snack while watching football outside in the sports book so we ordered to go. The bartender was quick to take our order and quick to produce the food. We ordered the hotdog and onion rings. Both were good, the bun was a bit much and so it was hard to eat but the flavored were good. The onion rings were some of the better I've had. I'd stop in for a quick snack if we're ever here again.

This place just maintains a standard of delicious that is impressive. Burgers are amazing, the sides and appetizers (fries, onion rings, and wings), just as delicious. Had lunch, and dinner there this past weekend. Meat sweats and IPAs, living the dream.

Absolutely terrible service. Even after we talked to the manager, our waiter never refilled our drinks and had a complete attitude. The food was great but I wouldn't go back. Treating customers like you're doing them a favor is no way to run a business. And, by the way, they burned my bread for the lobster roll!

Menu selection was decent. I was expecting a phenomenal burger as they advertise black angus prime ground chuck. Burger was decent, nothing mind blowing, but good for a quick bite. Outside patio seating was great.

We came in for a hearty dinner before going out on the strip. We were staying in the Venetian so it was pretty convenient for us. 

The service was ok, the burgers were mediocre, and the items were pricey. I ordered a Royale with Cheese medium well. It came out more rare than my friends who ordered different burgers medium rare. I pointed this out to the waitress and asked if they could throw it back on the grill for a few minutes. She seemed slightly annoyed that I was asking her and said that they would likely need to make the burger since there was already a bite taken out of it. I'm not sure how else you would find out that the burger wasn't cooked enough. When she came back, however, she was extremely apologetic and said they would re-make the burger right away. When it came back out it was cooked a perfect medium well. The flavor of the burger and the melty cheese was great. 

FYI, you have to pay extra for a side of fries. I split some with my fiancé and the side was enough for 2 to share. It should also be noted that if you are a vegetarian there aren't many options for you. Our friend ordered the eggplant parmesan and said it was great, but they don't have veggie burgers. 

I ordered a boozy shake for dessert, but wasn't impressed with the $12 price tag or the taste. I got the Caramel Swirl which was alright, but way too sweet so I only drank half of it. I prefer the boozy shakes at BLT across the street at Mirage. 

If I did come back, it would probably be after several drinks. I also noticed they have a to-go stand, so I'd probably just order from there.

What happened, Mario Batali?

Food: My burger was wrapped in brown paper like it was from a fast food joint - you can taste like a classic burger without looking like crap. My friend also ordered chicken wings that didn't quite taste right.

Service: Our waitress was attentive, but the rest of the wait staff was sooo poorly trained! It's as if B&B decided to only hire kids with zero work experience.

Great place for a burger in Vegas. I like to create my own burger (depending on where I go) but for here, I created my own burger on a brioche bun, cheddar cheese, caramelized onions, bacon, and thousand island dressing. Can't wait to return for my next vacation!

Sat at the bar and had a fairly good experience. Service was great and bartender even educated me on some of the drafts which they had a good number on tap. I can see that they fail when it gets busy though since they're understaffed. TV 's in your face to watch all the games. I saw the USMNT quarters for copa America and game 6 of the NBA finals together. Great seat! 

Ate a Bottom burner and onion rings. Burger was awesome! Spicy and crispy. Onion rings lived up to the hype. Good batter and flaky. 

This place is right across from the Venetian sports book so great place to grab a bite if you're hungry from placing bets. Good luck!

We had the fried pickles as a appetizer, split the bottom burner and an order of onion rings. While everything tasted good, the pickles were by far the best thing. Fried in what tasted like a tempura batter, the pickles did not have that strong dill taste I get in most fried pickles. We didn't care for the sauce it came with (I'm sure it was an aioli, but it tasted like plain mayo) so we ordered a side of hot sauce and added it to the mayo, which made it yummy. The onion rings seemed to be fried with the same tempura batter, and they looked way better than their french fries. I heard someone at the table next to us (who ordered both fries and onion rings) raving about the rings but did not mention the fries. The burger was cooked a perfect med-rare, taste was good but not great. Draft beers were very tasty.
We sat outside where the view is incredible. Recommend.

Stopped by for a quick burger with my family. I was disappointed at the lack of kobe beef burgers because I've always wanted to try one, but I bit the bullet.

The menu offers a few burger options as well as the option to make your own burger by choosing the toppings you want; however, some of the toppings found on the pre-made burger options can't be chosen for the make your own.

I ordered a medium rare burger on a potato bun with balsamic mustard, sautéed mushrooms and pickled peppers. The patty and bun were excellent, everything else was standard fare. We also ordered fries and a Nutella milkshake for the table. The fries were forgettable, but I'm a sucker for Nutella, so I loved the shake. All-in-all a delicious burger experience, but a bit pricey for the product.

Only the second day in business and already a fan..!!  My wife and I were waited on by  "Steven" who was very attentive and professional.  We had a burger that was OK and a Lobster Roll.  You must try the potato salad as it is first deep fried and then baked to perfection wit a nice sauce.  I even got the chance to see Mario Batali as he was walking out.  The menu is pretty simple but I hope they can continue the excellent customer service for years to come.

We thought we would be ok with a burger place. Well apparently not. We were seated immediately inside and we asked for an outside seat as the sun was out and we thought it would be a nice way for us to enjoy Vegas while we ate. 

We were told the would be a 5 minute wait to be seated outside. Sure, not a problem we say as we sip our water. 

About 10 minutes later we were advised that we could be seated outside and to head out. We were told to check in with the woman out there. So we went up and said we were told our table was ready. She, I kid you not, looked us up and down really nastily and then said there was a 5 minute wait. We advised that we already waited inside for our table. She repeated again that it was going to be at least a 5 minute wait. 

We look around and there's 4 tables that are free, clean and set for service. 

Asking her where we should wait she waved at the couches in the sun. 

Less than impressed much? I know! 

She then trots back 10 minutes later and says we have a table. Then says it's in the sun if that's ok. We say no its not. We want part shade. After waiting that long in the sun I needed a cool spot. Which ended up being another 5 minute wait. 

The food itself was ok, be warned however that my best friend got food poisoning from this meal, she had a burger (who knew you could stuff that up?). She's been up all night vomiting and had to go to the doctor today. 

All in all, not worth visiting. Our waiter wasn't too bad but the whole visit was soured by the I'm too good for you hostess. Oh. And the food poisoning.

For a while I was debating whether I should be giving this place 2 stars or 3. I originally had the intention of giving it a 3.5. All the stars for this place go to our server, Anthony who was very friendly, attentive, and helpful.

I came here for a late dinner with my sister and brother in law. We've been to other Mario Batali and Joe Bastianich restaurants and were very impressed so we had some pretty high expectations in B&B Burger & Beer. Unfortunately, my expectations were shot down.

First off, the decor is pretty casual. It's supposed to be a burger joint so it's simple. I personally think the location is a little too hidden. It's in the sports book area in The Venetian (as Mike C. has pointed out) a little past Noodle Asia. There was no line, and the two girls up front who were hostesses were friendly and helped get us seated right away.

I ordered the morning burger (minus the egg) along with a side of fries, my sister had a spicy burger of some sort, my brother in law ordered the pastrami, and we shared a side order of buffalo wings. Almost everything came highly recommended by Anthony, so our hungry stomachs waited excitedly for the food.

Coming from SoCal, I'm not sure if maybe I've just been spoiled senseless by the amount of gourmet burgers in the area (The Counter, Slaters 50/50, and Umami to name a few) but all three of us were very disappointed. 

The buffalo wings tasted hard and almost frozen. The sesame on my burger bun tasted too hard for the bread and to sum it up, the best word to describe it would probably be "forgettable." The pastrami was at best average, and my sister's burger was so overly spicy, she was barely able to eat it. 

The reason why I ended up giving this place 2 stars is because even though Anthony was attentive enough to note to the cook in the back that many customers during the day had complained it was overly spicy, management still did not do anything to make it better. He suggested we just write on the comment card at the end of the meal that we thought the burger was too spicy. There was no offer to make up for it and no attempt to please the customer.

I think B&B has some great potential, but considering it has just opened a little over a week ago, it's absolutely vital to be listening to its customers to make the experience more memorable and better, considering all the other competition for food choices on the Strip.

This is a really fun place to go to if you ever end up at the Venetian or Palazzo in Las Vegas. I ate here with a group of friends and colleagues and we enjoyed a variety of burgers, shakes, and high gravity beers.

I would highly recommend getting the Sunrise burger and the Nutella milk shake if you're looking for some suggestions!

It takes a lot for me to give one star, but it was just an over priced, flavorless meal. My husbands family came to visit and they were staying at the Venetian. We decided to meet up for dinner and we came here. 

We were a party of 7 ppl, we all order hamburgers and fries. They messed up on three of the orders. My hamburger was so dry and it didn't have any flavor. My husband didn't liked his meal either (if you knew my husband you would know that is hard to disappoint him when it comes to food). I really wanted to have a enjoyable meal but it wasn't. I asked for extra ketchup and ranch to add some flavor to my food. The waitress was an airhead, we had to keep asking for things we needed in order to get them. We didn't want to make a big deal, we didn't return our food. We just had a couple bites and left it there, we learned our lesson and we are not coming back. 

The bill was a little over $200 for hamburgers, fries, a couple appetizer and drinks (sodas). I felt like it was not worth the money.

Find another burger on the strip. My $20 hamburger was thin & tiny (6oz) and fries (served cold) were nothing special.

Service was bad--they messed up multiple components of our order from burger toppings to temperature it was cooked at. Forgot sides and served wrong sides. All of this while the restaurant was empty (now we know why).

This is an awesome location to grab yourself a seat and enjoy some food and beer while watching the sports book TVs (we were at the ToGo portion). The sashimi peppers and fried pickles were reasonably priced and absolutely delicious. The service was quick and friendly, and we really enjoyed being able to sit down and watch the game without throwing down a $50 minimum per head to just relax. I also had the pulled pork BBQ sandwich.... It wasn't as awesome as the appetizers were, but certainly hit the spot!

I am a big fan of anything Mario Batali does. I mean venetian should be renamed Batali considering the handful of restaurants he has opened in the hotel.  After the pool we decided to grab a bite at B&B, I made reservations and the staff was friendly.  They asked about any table allergies before we were seated and were so good about explaining which dishes had nuts in them before we ordered.  The service was great.  The food was OK. LA has so many burger places that its hard to outdo the places I have tried. B&B was no Plan Check. The most memorable thing about it was the onion rings.
Very expensive burger be sure to ask for a table not in the back near the waiters station even when there are no other customers no coke just Pepsi soft drinks by the bottle Hey it's Vegas
Wow, excellent service, relaxed atmosphere with class.  Bottom Burger is a must do!   View of gondola rides adds an incredible ambiance.   Can't wait to come back.

I was nonchalantly greeted at the entrance by two 18 year old girls one of them asking if anybody in my party had any food allergies. I told her one person was allergic to apples and pears. She smirked as if I had made a dumb joke. So I repeated and confirmed it was no joke. Her reply was a straight faced "okay follow me". So she guided us to a table and only says "your server will be right with you" puts the menus down and starts to walk away. We didn't like the table because it was in the middle of the room. The place was empty so we stopped here and asked if we can get a booth instead. She looked around and said " I don't know". Kids! Am I right? So we took the liberty to pick up the menus and sit at one of the empty booths. She only replied "Okay" and walk away.

They have a Waiters that only takes orders and Servers that serve the food and refill your drinks. We only saw that waiter at our table three times. To take our order, once to ask if our order came out well, and to deliver the check. We kept fighting to get the server's attention for refills. At the end I was full and I had neck pain from trying to get their attention.

The food is well prepared and it all tastes very good. The place is clean but not much in terms of modern or chic décor. It reminds be of a Red Robbin. 

Good for a great lunch but for being Vegas and celebrity Chef restaurant, the service in general just not up to par.

I should start out by saying I'm from California...specifically the LA and Bay areas and we are spoiled by gourmet burger places.  There was very little that was gourmet about this place.  We expected more seeing that it is owned by two world renowned chefs.  We had the sunrise burger which was just a burger with a sunnyside egg on top and the royale with cheese which didn't have enough grilled onions for what it advertised.  We also ordered the fries, which were soggy and obviously not fresh.  I'd rather have jack n the box fries, at least they're crispy.  The only thing that was different was the ONE little floret of pickled cauliflower as opposed to a pickled cucumber.  Really, you couldn't splurge on a couple more pieces?  My husband and I also split a cherry bourbon shake, which was good, but not spectacular...$9 for the non-alcoholic version.  Our waiter was nice and attentive, but didn't make up for the airport restaurant feel of the place and over priced mediocre food.  Our total bill was $50 for two burgers, one order of fries and a shake..ouch!  I know, it's Vegas but you can find a much better value for two for $50.  Next time we'll stick with Grand Lux.

Sat at the bar. Service was great. Food came out fast. I ordered a burger with bacon pepperjack cheese jalapeño sauce sauteed mushroom red onion lettuce n tomato. The burger was good. Considering it was my first meal at 6pm! So I can't say it was excellent as u was super hungry. Well I also ordered side of fries as it does not come with the burger. The fries is thin cut  pretty good. Better then the standard fries from mcds n such. Anyays also had a beer. The bill came out to 34! Yes burger fries n 1 beer. 34. Pretty expensive I say. Anyways I could of went to a cheaper alternative but was starving haha. Wont be going back.

Way overpriced for mediocre food.  Had two burgers, an order wings, one cocktail and one beer.  Total with tax and tip came out to $72.00!  

Service was ok and it was a nice setting.  Seriously though, if you are going to charge $16 for a burger at least throw some fries, chips or salad on the plate.  

Also note to management- when waters were refilled the girl touched the pitcher to rim of the glass every time.  If you think about that, I put my mouth to that rim as does everyone else ~ ew!

Very disappointed in Batali.  Was looking forward to a great experience.  Instead, we got terrible service, tasteless fried pickles (which, by the way, they advertise as fresh and housemade), fries that were not fresh, and onion rings that were beyond greasy (literally, sitting in a puddle of grease, I kid you not).  Burgers were fine, but nothing overly special.  Took forever to get our drinks, waitress was MIA most of the time, and when one of the burgers came out with wrong toppings, we got a deer in the headlights from our waitress.  This place is a waste of your hard earned cash.

Decide to try B&B burger doesn't even come close to chef Ramsay burger place burger at B&B was dry bacon was over cooked and hard fries taste like In an out fries I would recommend hands down chef Ramsay burger place or In an Out not worth the money!!! This place doesn't deserve any stars!

I decided to make a quick stop at B&B last night for a bite to eat. It wasn't anything too astounding with the given prices ($16+ burgers, $8+ beers). 
I liked the potato bun the burger came on...that was probably the only thing that stood out to me. 
The Patty was flavorless and the fries were mediocre. (Just not a big fan of the shoestring cut.)

The only reason I'm giving this place as many stars is because  the bartender, Tristan, was very friendly and as attentive as she could've been being the only bartender on a Saturday night. She did a stellar job and deserves to be recognized for her hard work.  The rest of the staff were very rude and obnoxious, leaving me to feel unwelcome.

I am dubious of Las Vegas and all its glory; I find the glitzy veneer and sensory overload to be too much for the curmudgeon in me. I'm especially dubious of restaurants associated with celebrities and, likewise, celebrity chefs. So imagine my dismay when our team went to Batali's B&BB&B after the tradeshow.. it screams antithetical screams of GOURMET BURGERS! FANCY FRIES! And TWELVE-DOLLAR MILKSHAKE! Well... I'm ashamed to admit it but the food was really good here. Not a single complaint amongst the four of us, even the guy who got the $9 milkshake.

The Morning After was a fried egg burger with truffle aioli and frisse. (Aren't these the ingredients of a $50 plate?) The burger was juicy, the fried egg fried to perfection - the warm yolk mixing with the aioli, the cheese an excellent counterpoint to the frisse, and the bun keeping it all together into a lovely sandwich.

I still can't believe I'm writing a glowing review of a douche-magnet of a restaurant with Mario Batali's name.

Terrible, worst meal I've ever had in my life and the service sucked ! Our server totally forgot about us and when she finally checked on us she saw my gf's empty cup and didn't even bother to ask her if she wanted a refill. $70 for two people? It should have been much more enjoyable if the food sucks at least try to be a good server to make it a little worth it. Never going back here again the burgers tasted like water, the wings were gross, and the fries were decent I much rather have McDonalds before I ever even remotely think about giving this place a second chance, no way. Actually if I could give this place -5 stars I would love to.

My friends (two locals and three visitors) and I came here to grab a burger before departing Vegas. When we arrived the hostess seemed less than thrilled to seat us and had a poor demeanor when we requested to sit by the water (there was an abundance of seating by the water). After being seated, we were given water and our waitress disappeared. We sat waiting to place our order for approximately ten minutes. Our waitress also had a lack luster attitude when we placed our order and was not too enthusiastic to take our order. We have been waiting for over 20 minutes to get our food and I doubt it will be arriving anytime soon. As we sit back and watch the staff, there appears to be a lack of enthusiasm with all the staff. We won't be coming back. The service is awful and I doubt the food is worth the wait. #servicesucks #wheresthemanager

Drive thru burger - 5 stars! Flavor was fabulous. Switched the bun to a potato bun. Cooked just as I requested. 

Onion rings - 5 stars! Fabulous flavor. Just a hint of salt in the batter. Cooked perfectly. 

Service - 5 stars! Assisted so nicely with drink selection. Attentive and not bothersome. 

Ambiance - 3.5 stars but that just doesn't even matter to me due to all of the other fabulous parts of this meal. It was very clean. 

If you want a great burger & drinks, you will be happy coming to B&B Burger & Beer.

sunday night in vegas.  yep, one of those nights.  

party of 11, they sat us altogether and it was not a hassle.  we made reservations, and b/c it's vegas, i'd recommend making a reservation no matter where you go.  

#1 these burgers were FANTASTIC.  honestly, i was MEH about the idea of burgers when a friend had made the reservations.  there is so much good food in vegas, why hit a burger joint in the venetian?  but i was happily surprised.  meat is juicy, fresh, and cooked exactly the way you order it.  the burgers are creative ,and not any more expensive than any other dedicated burger place - about $11-12 (except for in-n-out).  

i had the Bottom Burner, and it's called that b/c the expectation is that your bum is going to bleed and burn when this comes out the other end.  sounds yummy, right?  well, it was.  delicious burger, topped with a jalepeno pesto (basically jalepenos chopped up into tiny bits and smeared on there) topped with pepper jack cheese and a giant onion ring.  it was so tasty!

among our group, we basically got one of each burger, and everyone was super happy.  the appetizers were ok - they offer fried pickles and these are definitely worth trying.  fried oysters were also good.  

great drinks, large beer selection.  the Nutella milkshake is a heart attack in a glass but so worth it.  definitely share b/c it is a lot of milkshake.
Food is good, not great.  Kind of noisy but still a good place for lunch.  If I am going to have a burger in Vegas, it is hard to beat Holstein's at The Cosmo.

Burgers were yummi, i had the bottom burner i think thats what it was called, the spiciest one! It was delish! The fried pickled were a tad bit too much, kind of heavy, but still good. Prices were very affordable, we would definitely eat here again!!

Decided to stop in to satisfy my burger craving while walking the strip. Was excited to try B&B as I am a big fan of Batali & Bastianich.

Food - was mediocre 

Interior design - lack luster

Service - slow took 30 plus minutes for 2 burgers and fries.

Expected more from these 2 culinary powerhouses.

Reasonably priced and tasty! Shishito peppers, Bottom Burner burger, and Morning After burger were all delicious. 

Our waiter was MIA at the beginning, but another server checked in on us and took care of us (it was an honest mistake on their part, no harm done). After we ordered, our food came out very quickly, and she was very attentive and pleasant.

We didn't try it, but they do have a build-your-own burger option that looks like a good option for kids.

I missed this lobster roll at B&B...tears of joy!

I've said it before and I'll say it again, the lobster roll here is AMAZING. That buttery New England bun is stuffed with flavorful and meaty chunks of lobster with small crispy pieces of bacon that gives it a nice crunch. Having this lobster roll again was excellent and passed overdue for the amount of visits I've had to Vegas over the last couple of years. Mario Batali and Joe Bastianich knocked it out of the park with this one. Its $21 and well worth it for the amount of lobster meat stuffed in the roll. I've paid equal amounts for other lobster rolls where some were good, some not so good. This one takes the crown and I haven't found one to top it.

If you haven't had the lobster roll here then you're missing out. Don't miss out on the burgers either, pretty good stuff...especially The Royale with cheese and The Bottom Burner.

Dinner 4/2/2016

Disappointed to say the least. Ordered the antipasti platter which was beautiful to look at, but the contents were not worth the price. 

The fried shrimp fritto misto is made for those who enjoy a side of veggies with their deep fried batter. If you love oil and flour, you're gonna be thrilled! A skinny dried up piece of asparagus inside a huge cast of batter is not what I signed up for. 

Maybe the burgers are delicious? I didn't try one

Heard great things about this place and was not disappointed!! The burgers are fresh and taste amazing! Onion rings may be the best I have ever had.  For eating on the strip, with that amazing view from the patio, great bang for your buck!

Another burger place off my checklist! Overall, service was 3 stars, and food was 3 stars as well. My boyfriend and I tried for the first time tonight, Sunday @ 11pm. So I'll start with the good. There was no wait at all and several tables were open. Now onto the alright lol. I ordered the Morning After Burger and it was a pretty good however the truffle flavor in the aoli was kind of nonexistent and also the egg yolk was slightly overcooked. I will say though, this has been the best meat flavor in a burger on the strip I've tasted however I still am in love with the texture and thickness of Gordon Ramsey's BurGR. The size was nice and had good height as well. My boyfriend ordered the Really Good Burger and well, it was just an okay burger. The meat and toppings seemed to be a lot smaller than my burger! The bacon was a pretty measily portion however it had a cool sour taste to it that was different in a good way. Fries were nothing memorable. Now onto the eh. First thing I didn't really like was that there was something off with the hostess. Everything she was saying was friendly but she had a mad facial expression and was speaking reeeally loudly, almost yelling! Us and the older couple behind us looked at eachother and were kind of confused lmao Also all of the waiters and waitresses seemed really rushed and running all over the place even though it wasn't crowded at all. I even saw the hostess running back to the tables to clear plates..mm no bussers? But overall, it was alright, nothing amazing but I did like the meat flavor in the burger. Also looking at the beer menu, they had a pretty good selection of good quality beers.

Not at all what I expected.  My lobster roll was on what appeared to be a tiny hot dog bun.  

Greasy soggy fries.  The ketchup was tangy. The high point of the meal.

The burger not worth the money.  

Service sucked.  I really wanted to like this place, really .  But for the name sakes this place would be empty.

I think they need to hire me to get this place in shape because I expect it to close without some help from above.  Come on wake up and straighten this place out.  The location is spot on and the food and service should be also.

Over priced I want to cry.

Food is great. Beer selection is great. Service could use some work. Waiting 45 minutes for a burger and fries is a tad insane. 
If you can, sit outside for a great view of the canal and the cute gondoliers.

4.5 stars for food. 
2.5 stars for service.
5 stars for atmosphere and music. 
Ok, I will settle on 4 stars average. After trying Otto, I could not wait to seek out another B&B restaurant! I figured I've had almost every other "celebrity chef burger" why not try this one?
I randomly made a reservation since I had never been here. Happy I did, because it was super packed, and safe to say under staffed. They asked if we minded sitting on the patio, and the sun was down so we went for it. 
They have huge shades with misters and classic rock at the appropriate level. 
We were not getting much service at first. I actually went to the bar, and got my beer before my boyfriend received his from our server. I was totally disappointed in the bar service. No total quoted, no eye contact, just- "here's your beer, thanks for the $20" I was brought change but still nothing was ever said to me. 
I did like the beer, Brooklyn Lager though. 
We ordered fried pickles, the burner burger, and the drive thru burger. 
Off the top, I felt the similarity of Otto with the high quality ingredients. The meat was fresh and cooked to perfection. We also ordered a side of potato salad that had a creamy, sweet mustard style sauce. It was really unique and enjoyable. 
We ordered a cherry shake to-go and it was worth the $9 price tag. 
Overall, I could see the disorganization of the staff, people waiting, and lack of service. Even though we personally had a great server and were checked on by management, everyone did not seem so lucky. I will go here again hoping service improves. If it doesn't I will still enjoy a burger, or maybe the lobster roll next time!

The world of $10-15 burgers has a new contender as B&B Burgers & Beer is now open. It's in the Venetian next to the poker room (the old Rattle Can Location). 

The burgers were good, I had the Drive Thru Burger it was their take on an In & Out burger. The burger was cooked to a perfect Med Rare, and the toppings were fresh, but it seemed like it didn't live up to the $9 price point. It was good, just not $9 good. 

I also had the Pickles: Fried and Not (fried pickles and pickeled veggies), the onion rings, and S&P Chips. The Chips were great, the onion rings were pretty good, I wasn't a fan of the fried pickles, they used bread and butter pickles not dill which was a disappointment to me.

All in all it was good, but not OMG great, it will blend into the stream of the never ending Burger Joints on the strip. I'm honestly a little bummed they closed Rattlecan and replaced it with this place. It'll have to ride the celebrity name on the door or it will end up getting lost.

The service was pretty solid, but nothing really stood out from the meal. It was an OK burger in a pretty generic place, at Strip Pricing. I'm not really in any hurry to go back for another visit.

I sat at the bar for my meal. I initially inquired about the antipasti plate and the bartender not only answered my question but also went so far as to recommend that I wait to order anything else because of the amount of food I would receive. I heeded his advice.

When the plate arrived, I was very pleased with the quality and quantity of what I got. Three different meats, cheese, olives, pickles, pickled veggies and bread (I was told to ask for more bread if I needed it.) Generous portions and delicious but I can really eat so I ordered a burger as well.

I decided on the "Really Good" burger and I have to say, whoever named it needs a lesson in naming dishes. The burger wasn't "really good." The burger was UNBELIEVABLY FREAKIN' GOOD. I love a good burger and eat a lot of them. This was easily one of the top 5 burgers I've ever eaten. Toasted potato bun, juicy patty, Gorgonzola cheese, bacon, red onion and Chianti mustard. Do your mouth a favor and try it. You can thank me later.

"A+" for service and food. Doesn't get much better than that!
Expensive for a burger place. Food was good but nothing spectacular. Would not go back next time in Vegas.
Our burger was good. Pretzel roll was soft.  Service was good. Food came out quick. Milkshake was thick & yummy. French fries were fresh cut, thin & just warm. Not my preference.
Very dissapointed in this place.  Ironic that both owners are so critical of others on TV but they serve this dry burger crap.  Think Chilis burgers, and not even close to shake shak or in n out.

Stoped in for what was a genuinely enjoyable lunch on the patio, near the front pools with the Gondola rides at the Venetian.

Started with deep fried pickles which were sliced into nickle sizes pieces, different from the quartered pickles that you usually would see.
Pulled pork was really good, although admittedly the one flaw was the cilantro in the coleslaw that was on top. I really don't like cilantro, but it was still a good sandwich.
Lunch with 4 beers, an app, 2 sandwiches, and aside of fries came out to just over $90 after tax and tip. Not a cheap lunch, but the atmosphere and quality of the food make it a worthy stop.

This is my second time here and I love their food. I've had their shishito peppers which were so delicious. Unfried mozzarella which was a new twist to how I've usually had it (fried). And their eggplant parmigiano which unfortunately I was not a huge fan of. I am having the hummus and peta bread which is new on their menu and it's okay. I enjoyed it. But by far the best thing to me is their Nutella shake!!! Oh my gosh it is to die for! Thank you Nauje for letting me know you are my new best friend.

Fast service, plenty of choices, a nice place to seat and have a beer and a burger. Price wasn't too bad and we had plenty to eat and didn't feel like they were rushing us even though it was starting to get crowded.

My visit to B&B can at best be described as forgettable. Given the name on the door this is a big disappointment. The food was meh with the fries being just moderately above meh. On the beer side I was hoping for a destination with interesting choices but with very few exceptions the tabs were empty or major brand beers (Budweiser, Stella, blue moon, Dos Equis). One saving grace was that service was pleasant and efficient allowing me to leave expediently.

My son and I paid B&B a visit. We both had "The Really Good" burger and it was fantastic! The onion rings were cooked to perfection. It's pricey but well worth it. The service was good with a great view of the canal and Vegas. Highly recommended if you want a good burger.
It's 7:15 and still waiting for our order that we put in at 6:55..the place is not even busy..it doesn't take twenty minutes to make a burger..

We got a burger, french fries and onion rings.  The burger was OK but not as good as the ones we got at the other celebrity chef burger places in Las Vegas though.  The onion rings were good:  sort of tempura batter thing they were doing with them.  The oil was dripping off of them, though.  The french fries were good but seasoning was uninspiring.
Really slow service, despite lots of servers standing around. Burgers were ok, but better at the Public House

So let's just lay it out and list the good and the bad. 
The good : waiter was nice but not very attentive. The burger was actually cooked the the requested temp. If u eat a lot of burgers you know how hard this is to achieve. 

The bad: the food! Other then being cooked properly the burger had no flavor. No seasoning or char at all, would almost seem like it was steamed. My wife got the steak sandwich and said it was not good. In addition both the fries and chips were greasy and soggy. I was really disappointed and angry because I asked the wife to give up the always amazing Trattoria Reggiano to eat here.  Lesson learned the hard way sadly.

We started drinking early so I had to get a lil something before, so we got some snacks from here. We had some oysters, bacon potatoes chips, fried pickles and fries.

It was pretty good, the burgers looked more like sliders and very expensive. The beer selection was great. If you sit outside you get a great view of the canal and gondoliers.

The snack were good but over priced not really interested in eating here again though. There all tons of burger places I rather have.
Burgers were only fair ! Easy tiger was way too hot (spicy to drink) service was good.

I actually really enjoyed B&B. It looks sorta small from the front, but the tables wind around the back and it actually can seat quite a few people.  They have a huge bar and they have seats outside on an indoor patio (of sorts) that faces the sports book, if you want eat and watch all the action.  However, if you want a bit more quiet, they have TVs every 5 feet (literally) inside too.  We were there during the NFC Championship and I could see it (and hear it) from every angle!

Food wise I thought it really hit the mark if you like drive in burgers off the grill.  I had "The Drive Thru", which is 2 Griddled Patties, Sesame Seed Bun, American Cheese, B&B Pickles and it was terrific.  Plus we got sides of fries and onion rings.  Burgers aren't badly priced EXCEPT they don't come with sides, so once you add that it is a bit pricey (but it is a restaurant by a famous chef in a casino - what do you expect!). I really like the food and atmosphere.  I would recommend it.
Best burger I ever had. And I love burgers , the load fries taste like a baked potato.  I would come back.

Excellent burgers, delicious appetizers, good service, great beer selection, and the single best chocolate shake I've ever had in my life, made with real high quality chocolate.

Prices aren't bad either.

FANTASTIC place.

After having lunch here, I've decided to pass on ANY 'celebrity chef' restaurants in the future. We have had bad experiences at several now.
Things started well, seated fast, & ordered beer. Then, things went downhill. Our beers were poured, & waiting on the bar, but our server was too busy chatting with another customer to pay attention. After about 8-10 minutes, my husband asked someone at the bar if they could bring our beers before they got too warm. They apologized, & brought them right away. At this point we still hadn't ordered. The manager came over, took our order& offered us an appetizer on the house. I thought that was a nice thing to do. We chose onion rings. BIG mistake! They were cold, & grease literally ran out of them when bitten into! Gross! I had the bison caprese. The burger was ok, a little dry, nothing special. The tomato slice was as thick as the burger. Hard to eat because the tomato was so big. My husband had a burger with gorganzola. Let me tell you now, he LOVES blue, gorganzola, stilton... any stinky, moldy cheese. He hated this burger! The cheese was too much & burnt. There are several better choices. I think we'll stick with all of the other good burger places in Vegas when we return.

I came in last week for a late lunch with my girlfriends, the weather was perfect! So we sat outside.. It was a little busy but the hostess did let us know in advance that the waiters were behind; Yessenia or Jesica was her name..  Waited 10 minutes for the hostess to finally clean a table once sat down they seemed overwhelmed wanting to take our order right away that was fine. He brought out drinks and disappeared for what seemed to be 20  minutes. We had to flag down the hostess for refills which she did bring us. Then the food came out the burger perfect and the onion rings Mmmmm Perfect!! The hostess brought more Pepsi and Ketchup. We only saw the server when he dropped the check when I would have ordered a Bue Moon I did not tip him, but we did tipped the hostess for the customer service. My overall experience was a 3 could of been a 5 But I will be back I recommend the great food! ;P

Their burgers are good.  Not quite as good as Ramsay's BurGR, but still one of the better burgers in town.  And don't get the fries, get the warm potato salad, you won't be sorry.  The service isn't always great.  I've eaten in there about five times and it's hit and miss.  The meatball sandwich was very disappointing, given two Italian Masters own the place.  And the pickled veggie garnish they put on the plate is off-putting and disgusting.  The beer selection is very good.

I Really wanted to like this!  Love Mario and Joe...  

I had the Royale burger.  The burger was cooked well and the cheese was delicious, but It should have had a sturdier bun because of the cheese and the grease.  It totally fell apart.  My fiance had the lobster roll -- and I know, I know, he should have known better than to order seafood in a hamburger joint, but hey -- if Mario and Joe have their names on it, it MUST still be good, right?  NOPE.  The roll was so little.  Like the size of a hot dog bun at cousin Joey's BBQ.  And because of the size of the bun,  not much lobster could fit in there.  WAY over priced.  Seriously the whole dinner was over priced.  We spent $138 on 2 sandwiches, an order of fries, and 3 well drinks.

On top of it all, after dinner we went outside in front of the Venetian to watch the gondolas.  And what did we see?  An outdoor patio for B & B Burgers and Beer.  I was so mad!!!  We didn't know it was there, otherwise we would have asked for patio dining!  The hostess didn't even offer it to us!!!!  Instead we were forced to sit inside in an overly casual atmosphere with an almost childish decor -- at 10pm.  If we had been able to sit outside under the soft patio lighting, watching the gondolas in a peaceful, romantic atmosphere, I assure you my review would not have been so harsh.
Yo this spot is a Koo place burgers are tasty really clean Koo waiters service was really good I will be back!

Service was good. The food was shockingly disappointing! I enjoyed the smashed fried potatoes, but the burgers were as ordinary as the pre-made frozen burgers and Costco and had less interesting flavor than when I grill them myself at home. For a place with the face of 2 big name chefs we left feeling ripped off and still hungry. Not worth the hype!

I have encountered a new monument on my journey in life.

When I return home to DC, and someone asks me, "hey, J Dog (that's what people call me), what's the best burger you've ever had?"

My response will not be of words, such temporary things. Rather, I shall point westward.

West, over the lands of our forefathers,
West, through rivers and mountains and plains.
West, past where the arid air grows hotter,
West, where the canyons and crags have names.

And they will see, in their mind's eye, a vision of a most majestic place. B&B Burger and Beef. And they shall weep. And I shall weep. Our tears of perfectly salted beef. And together we shall journey west.

Some co-workers and I dined at B&B last week for lunch and had a great experience. As far as service goes, our server Marcus was very attentive. I ordered a Dark & Stormy cocktail where a lime wedge is a key ingredient, and for some reason there were none in-house that day. Marcus made a special trip to the casino area to locate some limes and make my drink complete! We also had a joiner well after most of us had ordered and all of our orders still came out at the same time which was nice. Most of us ordered burgers and salads and we were all pleased with the taste and presentation. I highly suggest the Morning After burger! Top notch service, ambience, and food quality.
Had a beer but can't comment on the burger. Pricey for what you get.

Too expensive and not really that good.   I had one of their specialty burgers and it was like a cocktail that was poorly made.  I wouldn't eat here again when staying in Vegas, go to  a mainstream hotel and get your burger there.
Came in an sat at the bar. Had a drink and some fries. Typically would not write a review on fries, but they were so good i have to. All handout. WOW so yummy

I thought the burgers were good... They are fancy and elaborate. I tend to like my burgers more plain. My friend thought his was one of the best he's ever had. I think it's all personal preference. Overall a good place to grab a beer and grub without leaving the hotel.

The food was good but the service...not so much. It took about 10 minutes to get our diet cokes and even longer for a refill of water. It didn't seem like we had a designated server for 3 people asked us if we had our order taken. No one came to check how it was going after food was delivered. Looking around the restaurant, it seemed like there were quite a few unhappy tables. As mentioned, the food was good. We had the chicken hero and bar burger with American cheese. Would recommend with the caveat of sub par service.

Food is mediocre. Not bad burgers but nothing at all memorable or making me want to come back. Service is super slow. 10 minutes before we can order. Then 10 minutes waiting for a soda. 20 minutes for 2 burgers and a side salad. Salad smothered with dressing after asking for dressing on the side. Now we both finished eating 10 minutes ago and still no sign of our check. Get me outta here. Eye roll.

Arrived Saturday afternoon and the place wasn't busy..  The hostess was very friendly and welcomed me.I asked to be seated at the bar. As soon as I sat down at the bar, I was greeted and my drink order was placed.  The bartender took my order and quoted me a food delivery time of less than 10 minutes.  I ordered the Drive-Through burger which consisted of 2 patties, lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, and onions.  The food was delivered quickly. Unfortunately, the burger tasted quite salty.  It was an average burger which even the bartender told me. He said that this is their basic burger. I wish however, I would have been informed on other menu options since some of the other people sitting at the bar had much better looking burgers/sandwich's.  The prices here were more reasonable than some of the more gourmet burger joints and that's probably why the burger didn't taste as good.  

I would consider trying this place again and ordering something different from the menu.

I chose this spot because of location (water & strip view) & because I've wanted to try a Mario Batali restaurant but didn't want to spend a lot of money on this occasion.  
I was excited by my burger topping options & built my own: pretzel bun, caramelized onions, bacon, & fried egg.  I also got the garden salad.  
The salad was delicious but I was dying for fresh veggies so not a stretch.  
The burger - meh.  The pretzel bun tasted like one I had in the Palazzo hotel during a convention.  It's probably the same distributor.  It came with no condiments which I asked for twice.  
No sides come with the burger.  
I love food & live in a town with stunning food (Portland, OR), so when you say Mario Batali, I think I'm in for a treat. His parents own Salumi in Seattle which I went to often when I lived there.  This isn't a treat & I'm certain now he just licensed his name.  Too bad.

I have to say this place was pretty dead when we came in. Typical burger joint. Lol.
It was a larger group and the group ordered. I only had an order of fried oysters. I usually eat these raw but they had nothing else I wanted on the menu.
