The oysters were battered in a corn meal of some sort and it was lightly fried. Which made the oysters and excellent eat. Everyone else had pepper poppers and burgers. They all said it was ok.

My review is based on my fried oysters. It was good. Small portion because it was an appetizer. But perfect for me.

Ambience is like a sports bar. Staff is super friendly and accommodating.
Asked for a royale med rare. Got it well done and cool to the touch. Mentioned it and they shrugged. It's ok. Just not great.

You would think a burger joint on the strip, not to mention a $10 burger (total bill $34) would exceed or at least meet your expectations - not the case here. I had the "Drive Thru" and it sucked! I had it really plain and their ketchup just tasted funky. It had 2 patties which were paper thin. HOW do you fuck up a burger?? Lol. I should have gone to In n Out and saved $20 while having a good burger.
Wow these burgers were amazing. You have to try the smash potatoes. The staff was amazing. The hostess Darian was awesome.

This place made my entire party sick, and we all ordered different things.  I ordered the onion rings and they had so much batter on them I thought I was eating oily bread.  I also don't believe the oil was hot enough when they put them in the fryer because the batter was excessively oily.  Also, our food was not hot when it came out and the service was incredibly slow.

Don't eat here.  There are plenty of better restaurants 100 feet away in restaurant row.

My friends and I got settled into our hotel @ the venetian and we starving when we arrived. We thought a burger was a good choice and this place is in a super convenient location. So, we went to B&B

HANDS DOWN WORST SERVICE I HAVE EVER GOTTEN IN MY WHOLE LIFE
I never usually complain about something like this but, it was BAD at this place.
It took us 5 mins for a host to seat us when there was no line up. 20 mins to us get waters. Another 20 mins to get menus and another 20mins for them to take our order! The only reason we actually got service is because we had to flag down someone to help us...
It was rediculous. There was a different person bringing us stuff everytime. Plus, the food was pretty over priced for what it was and just mediocre. Never coming back to B&B again!

Showed up rather late in the evening and they were not very busy, maybe 5 tables were taken. Clean restaurant and attentive and knowledgeable waiter. I had the Bottom Burner burger and tried the waiters recommendation and had a Meantime beer. The beer was fantastic and I've yet to find it here in Texas. The burger was cooked perfectly to order and I thoroughly enjoyed all of the different flavors, from the pepper jack cheese to the jalapeno pesto and Mario's hot sauce and the Onion rings in the burger. We also ordered a side of delicious Onion rings. The price I thought was perfect for what you get in any location. Batali & Bastianich hit a home run with this menu. I'll attempt the shakes on my next trip to the Venetian/Palazzo.

The view was amazing. The weather this day just right but the service left much to be desired. Took more than 30 minutes after being seated to get our drinks on this afternoon. There were many empty tables and our waiter was standing around talking. Once we received our food we were not given much attention. Great burger. Poor service.

This could potentially worst meal I've had ever. 

Service was so bad and the place wasn't even busy. 

Food took forever. Burger came cold. 
10 minute to hunt down a server and then out came another burger. Way too salty to the point I couldn't finish without water. 
Guess what. No server no water. 
From there, no server for 30 minutes. I never got mad or anything, asked hostess 5 times to help us flag down the server. Nope. Nothing. 

I could go on for a long time. But I'll keep it at this, Batali should be ashamed to have his name linked to this overpriced dump.

I came here for lunch, service was okay, food is overpriced and my burger didn't come out as I ordered it. I had the really good burger, flavors were good but the burger was underdone and had onions even though I asked for no onions. Burgers don't come with fries and a side of fries cost $6. I was expecting awesome fries but they seemed to be the end of a batch because they were small pieces and soggy.

Sorry Burger & Beer we would never come back to your establishment- music extremely loud, pastrami sandwich came out with burned bread, and very expensive for what you get.  Much better options available on the Vegas strip.

Disappointing meal experience. Our service wasn't very good. There was an error made on one of our sandwiches and instead of bringing us the forgotten item, the server asked my mother in law if she's fine without it now. All four of our burgers were ordered medium-well and two of them were very pink in the middle and two of them had just a bit of pink! Onion rings were too greasy and salty and the fries were nothing special. I ordered the good burger which had good flavor with the cheese & mustard but the burger itself was poor quality so I  wasn't impressed.

Just spent New Years in Las Vegas with my wife an two kids we made reservations at B&B for New Years Eve so we could be center strip. We also were excited because of the two names that make up B&B. Service was okay the restaurant was pretty empty probably because it was 11PM on New Years. We started with Shishito Peppers which were amazing and a wedge salad which was very small but tasted good. All four of us ordered burgers and once we got them one of my sons said his hamburger smelt like fish and my other son said his tasted like fish they both ate there burgers even though I told them not to because they were starving my hamburger was missing one of the sauces no big deal but my burger was very small and did not taste very good so I only ate half of it. My burger was gummy and rubbery my wives burger was okay she said nothing special. So we asked if they could just take one burger off our bill the one that I did not eat the whole thing the manager said no that it was not their policy so after going back and forth with her and explaining everything to her described above she finally took it off. I should have not paid for that food at all it was $90 for something we could have got at McDonalds. I don't thing that the chefs that endorse this place would allow this level of food or service. May be just may be it was because it was really late at night on New Years??? But after how the manager treated us and the level of this food I will not go here again or recommend it to anyone.

Royale burger is big, greasy, cheesey, oniony and perfect in almost every way after a couple of long nights in Vegas (or probably before a couple of long nights in Vegas for that matter too!). 

Better than average beer selection and plenty of seating make this a cool spot.  

I had the fries and they were only ok.  Everyone on here seems to like the onion rings so I will try those next time.

The place is quite large and can accomodate large groups.  They also have an outside terrace where you can see the street level.  The terrace works when the sun is about to set. Typical Burger place.  The burger was prepared nicely, had a good flavor to it and the nachos were good.  The beers are nice and cold and the wait staff were quick.  I did find them very business like and maybe overwhelmed at the volume they had to take care of. Its a good place for a fast meal.

The burgers and pastrami sandwiches are fine, beer available, of course.  Nothing special considering the celebrity and location.  Sit on the patio so you can hear the singing of the gondolas and look out onto the strip.

Loved it!

Me and the wife came in at 6 pm on a friday. No problem seating. 

Ordered the Morning After. Not sure who the genius was to add a Sunnyside up egg to a burger but it is out of control good..... 

Ingredients are second to none. I have spent more money on weaker burgers. I think the price is right for what you get in quality. 

Only one minor issue but I didnt ding them because it is a personal issue. I dont like shoe string fries I like steak fries. 

If they would ask my opinion on what to improve I would suggest the steak fry option and to have speciality ketchup like... curry ketchup... or A1 ketchup etc... 

Again no true complaints we had a great meal, oh and the server Stephanie from the Chino Hills area of California was great.

Being a fan of Mario Batali and his other eateries I wanted to try out his burger joint he has with partner Joe B. It's a well lit place across from the sports book in the Venetian. Seated right away and served drinks within a few minutes we needed some time to order. Mario's playlist is playing with his favorite music like his other restaurants and he has descent taste. Plenty of TVs for watching the games and an extensive beer selection.
-We had the Nutella Milkshake right away. It was so good, anything with Nutella is right?
- The Royal With Cheese.. Damn that's a Tasty burger! Such a messy delight. Robiola cheese, caramelized onions and a parmigiano-mascarpone creme. So good
-the onion rings were good. Not heavily battered like some places. The pickles are the same and are also served with unfried pickled veggies. 
Service was excellent. Our server was checking on regularly and filling our water glasses.

Good food awful bar service.  I would never go back. Both the bartender and manager on duty acted like they wanted to be anywhere other than working.  Ask to change channel to watch a football game and the bartender got upset and said no that the channels were preset.  The manager sprayed club soda from the gun on our party and didn't even offer an apology let alone a free drink.  Too many other good places in Vegas to eat and drink then to get crap service here.

Today, my family and I came here for a late lunch / snack and a place to watch UMD sports on the big screen. For beers, I'd recommend the Stella Artois - Cidre on tap. For sandwiches / burgers, I'd recommend the Crispy Cod, which consists of crispy cod, iceberg lettuce, and jalapeño tartar on a sesame bun. It was crispy and light, not too filling. I'd also recommend The Royale with Cheese, which consisted of prime black angus beef patty, Robiola Cheese, Caramelized Onions, Grilled Treviso, Parmigiano-Mascarpone Cream, pickles, and red cabbage on a sesame bun. It was delicious, mouthwatering, and juicy.
Awful. ..awful. ..AWFUL service.   1st server was just going through the motions.   Next day, bartender just assumed the $1.40 change from a 10 was his tip.

We came in for a late lunch several Fridays ago.  The patio has a beautiful view of the gondolas/water, however, we chose to sit inside.  The service was fun, easy and seamless, which is always completely appreciated.  I loved my salad.  I loved my fries.  I loved my cheeseburger.  I loved my drink(s)...did I mention they had a full bar?  LOL Everything was yummy and we all left happy.  I'm putting this on my hamburger rotation the next time I'm in town.  xoxo

I cannot really explain how slow the service is. We were seated and waited about 10 mins till we went to the bar to get service. We then waited another 30 or so for food. Our drinks were never refilled. The whole time  we watched about 5 hostesses sit around and and do nothing. Not worth $13 for a burgers.

After a week in Vegas spending way too much on food that didn't deliver I was hoping for the best and expecting the least. I was very happy with our visit to B & B. We got right in for a table at around 8:00 pm and quickly had a server at out table. We started with the oyster which were fresh and plump. We followed those with the shishito peppers and romesco. This was a first for me and we LOVED them. I would go back weekly just for these and at $5 they were a bargain. We followed with the drive thru burgers which were  delicious and a relative bargain at $9.  We added a cone of fries and it was just great. I wish we had felt like a shake because they looked great. Also be sure and try the house beer which was clean and delicious. When staying at the Venetian be sure to make this your place for a burger.

This new restaurant at the Venetian has a hidden but adorable patio. If it's not too hot out, sit outside with a great view of the "river" and gondoliers, and the mirage volcano across the street. Very romantic little spot!

Bartender Modest was super friendly and gave great advice about the extensive beer menu.

When you're in Vegas and need a good burger that won't break the bank, here's your place!

We started with the fried oysters - perfectly crisped, no hint of grease, and served with a very nice remoulade.

Our burgers were cooked exactly as we asked for - medium rare.  The meat and toppings were high quality and fresh.  My hubby scarfed down The Drive-Thru burger while I made up my own burger topped with caramelized onions and truffle aoli.  We also thoroughly enjoyed the onion rings.

My hubby had a card to for a free beer, so we had a few suds.  The restaurant has some good craft beers available.

The waitress was OK.  She seemed really tired as though she was at the end of her shift and just wanted to go home & nap.  I can't ding her for that, since I've been there, done that.  She wasn't rude, just unattentive.  The busboy was very friendly and ended up taking care of our table as though he was waitstaff.  He actually made up for her lack of paying attention.  

There is indoor and outdoor seating.  It's a very casual, laid back spot with basic, classic burger joint decor.

When you're in the mood for a very good burger, sides, and beer at an affordable price, hit up this spot.

This is a new place in the Venetian that is owned Mario Batali and Joe Bastianich. The concept is simple as is the decor. It's focused on burgers and beers although there are other options on the menu. 

I had the bottom burner and let me tell you, it lived up to its name. Delicious, cooked perfectly, and the fries were well done. The selection of beers were ok considering I'm from Portland have had so many great micro brews. These were pretty much main stream offerings. 

The biggest knock was on the service. Our waiter made several mistakes, would walk away when someone was talking to him, and really just didn't follow through or follow up. I would expect better from these owners. 

Bottom line: food good. Service below average. If given a choice, though, sit outside.

I absolutely hate the layout of the restaurant.  Unless you have more than 2 in your party, you are going to get a tiny, poorly placed table to try to eat at.  The food was very good, except burger being a little over cooked, but it was tough to enjoy at our table.

This place was average. If you're on the run and need to get a burger this place is pretty good for that, but it did seem to take longer than expected to get the meal. This shisito peppers were really good.

I want to like this place, but it's not even three stars, really. As overpriced as I expected, for being on the strip ($15 burgers, $6 sides, etc.). The Bottom Burner (how's that for a watered down, faux-cool name?) is only barely spicy despite the menu description, which disappointed me. Otherwise it was ok. Same can be said about the cole slaw. One positive is that it is very convenient to the Venetian poker room, and you can easily get take out here and bring it to your table while playing. That's actually why I went here. Otherwise, no reason to bother.

The real problem here is that you just aren't getting what you pay for. Come on Batali and Bastianich, you can do better. Or at least that's what you like to think about yourselves on TV... right?

My first experience coming to this restaurant was good. I have no complaints. We sat outside where we had a view of the gondola and the strip. 

My second experience coming here was a disaster. My husband's order was completely wrong. The waiter took it back without a problem, but it took nearly 25mins for him to finally receive his burger after which I had already finished my meal. When they brought back his burger, it was incorrect once again! My husband didn't want to wait any longer at this point and ate it anyway. How could anyone get a burger done wrong-twice?! Is it really that difficult? In between waiting for the burger I asked an employee for extra napkins and he said sure. 10 mins later I see the employee walking out of the restaurant without ever bringing my napkins and completely ignored me. When I asked the waiter she just slammed the napkins on the table without saying a word and walked away. Umm..yeah, Don't be a waitress if your going to have an attitude, lady! 

My husband then asked to speak to a supervisor and she didn't want to comp us for the burger because all they could do was take out a lousy $3 off the bill. Seriously?! These employees are a joke!! 

After realizing we were going to get nowhere with these idiots we emailed who we had thought was the corporate office, we then get a call from another employee at B&B named Suda (general manager). We tried explaining to her our horrible experience and all she kept saying was "I have very loyal employees". So...what are you trying to say we're lying?! Of course my husband got frustrated knowing he wasn't going to get anywhere with her either he began to raise his voice a little bit and the bitch actually hung up on us!! Could this women be any more ghetto and unprofessional? She obviously doesn't have a clue on how to make her customers happy and satisfied. Apparently she puts her "loyal employees" first. We felt like we were dealing with McDonalds employees. Certainly not a restaurant owned by Joe B. Just pathetic.    

Do yourself a favor and visit Gordon Ramsey's Burgr instead. Their service and burgers are top notch!

After waking the strip and having a little too much to drink we needed a little bite and stopped here on the fly because of the outdoor seating with a great view of the strip and facing the gondolas.  Only ordered tater tots and fried pickles.  The fried pickles were pretty average, but the tots were so good we tried to come back the next day for lunch but it was 10:30 and they don't open until 11am so we moved on.  Good service, excellent outdoor patio.  Wanted to try more on the menu, maybe next trip.

BEST burger I've ever eaten to this day!! And the service was phenomenal. From the hostesses to our awesome waiter Max, it was the best meal I've had with a beautiful view next to the Venitian canals.

Fast friendly service and mediocre hamburgers.  I would have expected more from these chefs but the burgers just tasted like burgers you could get anywhere like Red Robin.  Not really worth your Vegas calories unless you're starving and are close by.

Customer service was amazing. Our waiter was from Australia, I believe. He was great regarding menu knowledge. He reminded us of a local discount. 5 stars for him!

However, the food was just eh. The fries were tiny, not bad taste, just not happy with them. Very ordinary. The alcohol onion rings were different. The alcohol taste just over powered the onion ring itself, so all i got was just BAM alcohol. 
The burgers were good, but the bottom bun on all our burgers was soggy. It broke apart half way through. Nothing special.

I went here with a friend after a gondola ride. We weren't asked if we wanted to sit inside or outside, maybe it wasn't an option at 6:30 pm on a Sunday night. The service was good, I can't complain, glasses were always kept full. I had the Royale with Cheese burger.  It's a pretty messy burger, wear a bib.  The Carmelized onions are amazing.  I asked for the burger well done, it was cooked perfectly and not charred on the outside. The prices are okay but sides are extra.  Fries don't come with it.  They have some interesting looking appetizers I would have liked to have tried. The menu isn't huge but they have a make your own burger option. It's not the best burger place but if you're at the Venetian and are looking for a good burger and a beer (huge list, btw) this is a good place to go. Prices aren't unreasonable. Would I come here again? Yes. 
Will I? No, because I didn't know my ex works here and I am not a psycho like he has convinced everyone I am and I have no reason to bother him at work. Although I am sure he went all drama queen and called his fiancée when he's the one who tossed a fit when he saw me. Believe it or not I don't keep tabs on him to know where he works and we don't have mutual friends who would tell me. So as long as your lying, stealing, cheating, manipulative, abusive ex fiancé doesn't work here then I would say, eat at B&B burger.
Lousy food, cold onion rings small oysters, slow service for $16 burgers. I think NOT

I came here twice for dinner with our group while we were at a trade show for the week at the Venetian.  This was one of two reasonably priced restaurants at the Venetian that we found.  (there may be more, we just didn't pass any on our walks through the hotel/casino.)  

The first time I was here, I had the eggplant sandwich. From my memory, I believe this was the only vegetarian item on the menu other than the side salads.  It was so good, with crispy fried eggplant and a touch of heat. The others got burgers and the meatball sub.  I wish they had a veggie burger because some of the burgers combinations looked delicious. The server asked if we wanted fries or onion rings with the burgers...note, these are not included and are an extra charge.  I tried the salt and pepper potato chips the first night and thought they were quite good. 

The second night I was here, I had the cod sandwich.  It seems everything here has heat to it, as the cod had a jalapeño spread on it.  I'm not complaining because I love spicy, but that might be a problem for others.  The bun was nice and buttery, and quite good.  However, I thought the eggplant was better.  

Overall, I was pleased with B&B Burger and Beer.  The food was good, and didn't kill your wallet and the service was quick and efficient! d

This place is nice, reasonably priced and great for groups. The service was very good, the food was just ok, but I added a star for the ambiance and service. We had stopped at In & Out Burger earlier that day and all agreed that the burgers here were not as good. The fried oysters were very good, as were the rest of the sides and apps we ordered, but if you're going to have a restaurant with Burger in the name you should probably try to excel in that area. I would return if I was in a large group, but other than that, I think I could find a better burger elsewhere.

Burgers were pretty good. Though bun to meat ratio was a tad too much. The meat was juicy as a good burger should be. Onion rings were very delicious as they were different from other onion rings where when you take a bite, the onion piece slides out. 

However, my biggest qualm was the service. Probably the worst service I've had in a long time. I had to wave someone at the host desk even the host saw me waiting in front. She was too busy or whatnot to not ask me if I want to dine there. I had to yell out if I could get a table to get her attention. When we finally got seated after 15 minutes, there were plenty of empty tables to spare? We waited awhile for our server to order. Then one of the servers walked by our table and told us she made a mistake with another table and had an extra Morning After burger. She asked us if we wanted it, we hesitated because that would mean our other burger and sides would come later. She pressured us and we gave in because we were nice. However, she did not offer to comp us any portion on the bill and we paid full price for the burger. Horrible service, we will probably not return and rather go to Gordon Ramsey's burger restaurant instead.

Let's just call it - there is a burger renassance happening in Las Vegas. Every casino has a celebrity chef and every celebrity chef now has a burger bar. 

Of the 3 burgers we had - on our little trip B&B was the first - and the best. 
First and foremost the service was friendly and attentive. The burger and wings were nice and just how they should be.

First time we went on this trip the service was great and the food was great too.  We were seated quickly, got our drinks and food quickly.  Loved the Drive Thru Burger.  The Royal Burger was good, but not as good as the Drive Thru Burger.  Don't waste calories or money on the fries.  Just order another burger.  The Nutella Shake was good but not excellent.

My husband liked our burgers so much that we went back the next day.  It was truly a Jekyll and Hyde type experience.  Everything that was good the day before was awful the next day.  The service was horrible.  We waited 20 minutes to get our drinks and put in our order.  Then about 20 minutes later our waiter comes and tells us that all hell is breaking loose in the kitchen and that it is going down in flames.  They are losing orders and that he had no idea when we were getting our food.  Finally, 1 hour after we arrived, we receive our burgers.  They were just ok...it was like we were in an alternate universe.  Just yesterday they were fantastic and today they were just ok.  So disappointing.  

We won't be going back.  If they could guarantee that the food and service would be as good as the first time we would go back but since the second time was so awful it just isn't worth it.

Great burgers, $10-$15 dollars. 
Decent beers. 
Really slow service.  Not a fast place to drop in and grab a bite.

Have you ever been to a Big Boy? Then the food here will seem familiar. Sort of middle of the road. Nothing to dislike, yet nothing to write home about. Burgers, fries, onion rings--all just OK. The servers seemed confused, at best. Unconcerned, at worst. Save your time and your money, and try and track down a nearby Big Boy for a better experience.

The burger is not worth looking for it.
Medium quality for a chef burger.
Mario Batali u have disappointed me

Holy cow best berger I've ever had! We had a little misshap in the beginning but the staff was quick to accommodate and rectify the situation. I am very pleased with my experience and Christian our waiter was awesome! Definitely going back.
We loved this place! Great service and view.  They even have misters above the outdoor tables.  The food was excellent and extremely well priced.  Highly recommend a stop in.

The appetizers were the best part of the meal. We started with the fried pickles and the unfried mozzarella. Both were great. The unfried mozzarella is not what you'd expect but it's TOTALLY awesome. I got the drive thru burger. That was okay. The patties were so thin so they were a little well done for my taste. All sides are extra. I got the slaw. My cousin got the fries and those were good. 

Overall, worth a visit for a quick bite.

Mario, Joe--no desserts--what's a matta you?  

I was going to a show at the Venetian Theatre last night and I decided to give B&B Burger a go.  The place was almost empty.  I opted to sit at the bar where I could watch the basketball game while eating.

Omar, the barkeep, brought menus to me promptly and got my iced tea.  I ordered a morning after burger and an order of fries.  My iced tea was kept refilled during dinner and it was a pleasant place to sit and enjoy the food while watching the game.

In a short time, a runner brought my burger and fries.  It was cooked just the way I asked--rare.  The meat was red and I was pleased.  The morning after burger consists of a good sized burger with sautéed mushrooms, fontina cheese, a sunny side up egg, truffle aioli, and frisée.  The serving of fries was a standard size and they were good.  

Because of the sunny side up egg, I opted to eat the burger as if it were an open faced sandwich.  The last thing I wanted was dripping yolk on my clothes before a show.  The burger was juicy and the egg and fontina cheese added nicely to the flavor.

At the end of the meal, I asked about dessert.  Omar told me they had shakes.  Originally they did have desserts when the place opened, but they just didn't sell so they dropped them.  I opted to have a refill of my iced tea and I knew I could find somewhere else for my after dinner sugar fix.  Omar asked if I wanted the iced tea placed in a to go glass.  Nice touch and thoughtful service.

The restaurant is in a bit of an out of the way corner.  I think the target market are the poker players from the poker room next door and the race and sports bettors from across the hallway.

This was a good burger.  Strip prices, mind you, but not any more expensive than most of the burger places on the Strip.  A-OK!
Katelyn is the best. Gave me an awesome vegetarian recommendation and my husband a great beer. She was funny and prompt. We will be back !

These burgers are to die for and the beer selection is vast. Doesn't get much better than that. Our waiter Stephen was very attentive. Only thing that could be better is the french fries, I'm more of a fan of super crispy.

Delicious, perfectly seasoned morning after burger! Would definitely go back as this was the best burger I had while I was in Vegas! Note: this place is casual...not McDonald's casual, but Applebee's/chili's casual. Servers were friendly and efficient.
Delicious hamburger! Huge portion and lots of fries. My husband had the chicken sandwich and it was fantastic as well

Passed this place and took a look at the menu - I was hooked. Went in for a late dinner. Sat inside by open window with views of canal & strip.  I was seated quickly but waited a bit longer than I would have liked to place my order. They have Stella Cidre there - a favorite!  My burger came quickly but was the wrong side of medium. I ate it though it was quite pink. Very tasty!  Would like to go back and try a different combo. Onion rings were also very good.  To full for one of those tempting shakes!  No ill effects from the medium rare burger!

Super overpriced for mediocre burger! Very slow service and the place was virtually empty. Had to finally walk inside and ask for our check because we were left outside with no service at all. Fries needed salt but no salt on table and waiter abandoned us. View from patio was nice but otherwise eat elsewhere.

Amazing burgers but terrible service. 

Walking up to the stand, the hostess was preoccupied doing some paper work. We stood there as she waved us off and told us to wait a minute to let her finish her task. After she was done, we asked if we could possibly get a table close to a television because we wanted to watch the game. Mind you, there's PLENTY of TVs in the restaurants. She told us that there was a huge group coming in and they already reserved a huge portion of the restaurant specifically where all their TVs were located. She offered the bar so we took it. 

Later, I looked over to see the big group seated in a corner of the restaurant. And random people sitting by the tables by the television I was hoping to get seated at. For some reason, I guess the hostess just didn't want to accommodate our request? Oh well. 

Food-wise, I am satisfied! I ordered the Bar Burger and topped it off with an extra egg and garlic aioli. It was messy with strong flavors, just how I like my burgers. It may like a tiny burger but the meat patty is thick and quite filling! 

BurGR is one of my favorite restaurants on the Strip and I can personally say that I enjoyed my burger here at B&B probably as much if not more than the Farm Burger (my usual) over there. If only the service was better, I would be a regular here!

Honestly save your $100 for two. Very underwhelming... from decor to burger to lackluster staff. Everything is forgettable. At least Ramsey burgr has cool decor and uniforms. I ordered an IPA (12$ draft, the most expensive in their menu) and they were out. I ordered a second IPA and they were out. I settled for a third. My wife had a Moscow mule (in a tall draft beer glass with regular ice and a lemon slice ). Weird. Okay we order two burgers and onion rings. Burgers were mediocre at best. Onion rings were good but needed a sauce or something. Bill was $80. Plus tip. So spent just under $100 for a couple drinks and some grub?  UNDERWHELMING INDEED. WILL NEVER BE BACK EVER FOR ANY REASON. If I want to spend $100 on burgers Bachi Burger All day. Worth every penny. Otherwise seriously In and Out for 6$ way way way better. Sorry MARIO this one needs help. I will point out the reviews told me all of this before I came however I disregarded and learned the expensive way.

Service to start off was pretty unfriendly. I would expect higher standards from a place located in such an upscale hotel not to mention the prices. Bar staff wasn't very knowledgable on craft beer which should be a big no-no for a place specializing in craft beers. I was told that I asked for too many changed to a burger. I thought a burger bar was supposed to allow you to get what you want???? This place was good when it was rattlecans. Bar maid came across that I was a bother. I ordered medium rare and got something far from it. After I was done eating I had about half a beer left. Bar maid brought me the check assuming I was leaving, never asked if I wanted anything else. This place has some work to do. The fancy chef name on the sign won't keep people rolling in forever. Get some better people that actually want to be there and make sure they are well versed on your product offering before you put them in front of customers that you are expecting to pay 40 bucks for a burger, fries and a beer.
Talk about unfriendly, or even to the point of rude service! Places like this make Vegas look bad!
Way over rated.  Not worth the price.  You would have a better dining experience at in and out.  Save your money and get a double double with fries (animal style).   Trust me!

One of the eateries I was most excited to try in Vegas was this Mario Batali joint. Burgers *and* beer? How could that be anything but awesome.

Sadly it was not awesome. 

I ordered the Drive-Thru (2 Griddled Patties, Sesame Seed Bun, American Cheese, B&B Pickles) with a side order of fries. The burger sure looked good but it was obvious from the first bite that something was amiss.

The meat was shockingly tough and chewy, and simply wasn't juicy at all, while the bun was way, way too dense and the condiments were distractingly plentiful. Honestly this was one of the worst hamburgers I can remember eating.

The fries were delicious, at least, and I was very happy with my beer (Firestone Double Barrel Ale).

My wife and I had lunch at B&B today and were very disappointed with our service. Our first experience was great, we had no complaints. 

The order on burger was incorrect. Mayonnaise was added and I do not eat it whatsoever. The waitress replaced the burger but it took nearly 30 mins to receive it, while my wife had already finished her meal by then. When I finally received my burger, it was incorrect once again. They added avocado. I didn't want to wait longer than I already have, so I ate it anyway. 

Meanwhile my wife had asked for extra napkins and it was never brought over to us. When we had asked the waitress for it,she slammed them on the table without saying a word. 

When we received our bill, I asked if they were going to charge me for the burger my waitress said they never comp burgers. The waitress than said she would speak to the supervisor, Krissy. Krissy did not comp the burger and took off $3 from the burger. 

I strongly believe this service would not be acceptable to Joe B's standards. The staff was very unprofessional and they seemed very "lazy". 

As we were leaving, we noticed the manager was starring at us from a distance talking amongst other employees as if she were talking bad about us. Not once tying to come over to apologize for the I convince. 

We visit the Venetian quite often and will probably not recommend this restaurant or come back. We will however, give Joe B's other restaurants a shot. I'm giving two stars because the burger was good.

The main thing I remember is that I was at the Venetian and I couldn't find any place without a line besides this one because it was during lunch time during a conference so I ended up coming here and spending $37 for lunch and I was still hungry.

In other words, it's expensive and the portions aren't too big. It is also sort of slow. I had time to go to the bathroom, play a bunch of rounds of puzzles and dragons on my phone and sit idly for 5 minutes before the chicken wings came. Then after I finished those, I babysat my water for another good 7 or 8 minutes before the lobster roll came. After which I sat there with my wallet out for another 5 minutes before I got the check. Then I bounced within 5 seconds. If only the service were as swift as me.

Anyways, the food tastes good, but probably is only worth half the price. I suppose it's an upcharge for some chef that owns this that I don't know, but I don't know, so that meant nothing to me. I was just hungry.

$9 chicken wings were really good with the sauce and tenderness but probably only $5 worth of meat in this
$21 lobster roll tastes on the higher end of average and supposedly has a lot of meat in terms of weight, but whatever, I was still hungry. 

Add on tax and tip and thats $37! If I am in a similar situation in the future, I think I'll put $50 on black and then come here if I win, or take my chances waiting in the line at the noodle place.
Not that impressed. Burger was okay. Overpriced but nothing to write home about. Fries were average at best. Probably wouldn't go back.

It's hard to rate this burger joint with an unbiased mind because my favorite burger place of all time is also on the Vegas strip: Gordon Ramsey's BURGR at Planet Hollywood.

But that burger aside, this place was OK. Lots of great signature burgers to chose from with various unique toppings and condiments. Despite the choices, I went with the "build your own" option: burger, pretzel bun, avocado, bacon, lettuce, garlic aioli. You can't go wrong with that combination, but on this occasion it lacked some flavor; I ended up having to ask for more aioli. The pretzel bun was also not pretzel consistency; it really was more like a regular bun. It was good overall, but not amazing.

The fries were thin the way I like, but one of our two orders were overcooked and seemed like the stragglers at the end of a batch. Also, I absolutely hate when restaurants don't automatically give you fries (or a side) with your burger make you order them separate. This is especially ridiculous when the burgers are priced at $15 and higher.

The beer selection is great. I went with a Moscow mule and it was really good, served complete in a copper mug. My friend thought it was "too gingery" but I don't think he knew that's what ginger beer tastes like. Drinks were also unnecessarily pricey.

Our waiter was great: friendly, patient, helpful, gave suggestions, attentive.

Great burgers. I had the bar burger with BBQ sauce cooked medium. I shared onion rings with my daughter. They were cooked perfect. They had a tempura batter with the perfect bite. There are tons of beers, but very expensive.  It was $8 for a Stella draft. I would defiantly recommend this place if you're in the Venetian.
Amazing burger and even great fries. Norverto, Omar & Jeff behind the bar were super attentive and very pleasant. Definitely would recommend!!!

This was an interesting experience. The whole fam is in Vegas so we wanted something tasty, yet kid friendly so this seemed like a good place. 

We had a reservation and were seated immediately. We had three different people check on us, and I still don't quite know who our server actually was. One gal took our order and came back like 3 times to ask questions about it. It wasn't that hard being we all ordered burgers! 

All the food came out at once along with 3 people to deliver it. She forgot my daughter's burger so she had to put in the order again.  Burger. Cheese. Mayo. Tomato. Not difficult. It came with no mayo. 

We ordered a salad. Got our salad. She comes out with another salad and says "did you get your salad?" I also ordered a second beer and did not get the beer I asked for :(

The food was really good. Burgers fries and onion rings were all very tasty. But the service just wasn't up to par. Paying $170 for 7 people at a burger joint I expect much, much better service. 

I guess we should have tried Gordon Ramsay :/

Bummer. My $10 "Drive Thru" double patty griddled burger was dry and overcooked. I asked for extra pickles and was served 2 tiny pickle chips along side the burger.  Hubby got the wings. Rubbery. Not crispy. Sad food. 
Need an In N Out instead!

I think this restaurant was more hype. I thought it would be amazing since it was a famed chefs restaurant but it was just A-Okay. I did like the set up of the restaurant but I thought it was a bit overpriced for what it was. I had 3 servers and one was awesome. Very polite and a super cool guy. There was another guy that was chill and outgoing but a lot of swearing. I didnt mind at all but im sure there were people that did as it was getting crowded. I ordered the wings and it was made friendly to eat but portion wasn't much.

Being a Joe & Mario fan, you have to figure they're doing something really good here. To be fair, I came for the burger. The place was really quiet, and so after thinking about it, and not seeing much food go to tables, we decided to get our burger fix somewhere else. Plenty of great burger places in Vegas, so we opted out. The place has a very minimalist feel to it also. Not that it's bad, but I feel if they decided to close, the place could be a taco joint, by adding colorful artwork, and call it a day. Having been to other J & M restaurants, this place looks like a fast food burger joint on a budget. Odd for being in the Venetian hotel.

The bartender said we should try the fried pickles, so we decided to stay, at least to have the pickles. No need to go on about fried pickles. They were good, but we really wanted a burger. Lot's of other reviews here were so so on the burger, so maybe we made the right decision. 

I will come back to try the burger, but the 2 stars reviews here are not very reassuring.

Batali and Bastianich would be appalled if they actually ate here.  Arrived at 5:45 on a Saturday evening and place was nearly empty. Took almost 10 minutes before a server stopped by to take our drink order although several were hanging around the restaurant with no patrons.  Ordered fried pickles - greasy, flavorless mess.  Here's a tip for a burger restaurant - season your beef.  Really, just a bit of salt will help.  For the price tag, you can get much better quality elsewhere.

Should have gone somewhere else. The burger was ok - I've had better at other places. The beer selection wasn't that great. The fries were decent. I asked for ranch dressing to dip my fries in - they brought me out a tiny amount and I was charged 50 cents for it. The service was slow. The kicker is - the price. I could have gone to five guys and spent less money and had a better time. Not worth it when there are so many good restaurants in the area...

Location should be perfect! However the food is bland. Martini was not made as ordered. Sandwich was not made as ordered. 

I am a huge fan of Mario Battali. Love his other restaurants. No idea what happened here. Service was good.

This was fine as a burger and beer restaurant, but don't expect a lot more than that.   A ton of beers on tap, but the burgers were good burgers nothing standout.  The onion rings were referred to as the best someone had ever had though.   Folks said their salads were good - and they added chicken (which was a ton of chicken) and avacado.  Very few allergy friendly items (lettuce wrap basically) but the server was very knowledgeable about the menu item ingredients when asked.

On the way out of Las Vegas my friends and I stopped at B&B for lunch. Located in the Venetian/Palazzo hotel, B&B is a new American Burger joint that will fulfill your craving for a good ole burger. I order the morning after which was delicious, the egg on top was perfectly cooked runny but not messy. Although delicious, I did think it was over priced for a burger, I have yet to find a burger that I am willing to pay more than $10. My standard of a good and affordable burger is In N Out. I gave this place a three not because the food wasn't good, trust me it is delicious---it wasn't amazing and the it was pricey for just an average burger. I'd comeback but won't necessarily go out of my way for it.

My first and most disappointing meal in Vegas.  Poor service, poor décor (thankfully they had the soccer p[laying on the TV).  Ordered the Royal with Cheese, Pulled Pork with onion rings, all were very greasy.  Very disappointing considering the standards the Joe holds others to.....

The burgers were OK. Not a big hype place I would say in my opinion even though its Mario Batali's joint. I had burgers in better places. We started off with the Garden Salad, which you cant't share. We ordered the Drive Thru and the Bottom Burner and a set of fries. Burgers were ok. The fries were too salty and eh. I wanted a side of ranch dressing too which they charge you .50 cents for that. Only good thing I would say is they have an outdoor sitting which overlooks the Strip. But overall the food was "decent" nothing hype about it.

Went for lunch..sat outside nice hot day..few people..food okay..mid way thru meal..asked waitor to refill water for party..nothing...had to complain due to lack of attention..and this was a slow day..wont venture here again

Wife and I went for lunch, maybe only two or three other couples inside, no one outside due to a 103 temp and the misters were turned off.  We ordered the loaded fries for an appetizer and they were very cold, absolutely none of the cheese was melted and the bacon was a sprinkled on cold topping... that probably explains why it was sent out to us in under 5 minutes! For the main course my wife had a burger, the burger was very tasty but the potato bun it was served on was stale! I had the cob salad, there was so much oregano dressing on it that it was not edible after two or three bites even after trying to wring it out with a napkin!!! I would not recommend this place...it will ruin your day!

I had one of those burgers that was not on the menu, one called The Molto Burger, cooked medium-rare for $19, oh my God it was incredibly delicious. Juicy, moist, yummy, each bite melts in your mouth. Also had the onion rings, they're absolutely delicious, glad we came here for lunch. Sat on the outside patio overlooking the gondolas and the strip.

This has to be one of the worst burger joints in all of Las Vegas. I invited my friend for lunch, and to take in some of the NCAA March madness at The Venetian. I asked him to meet me at B & B Burger at an outside table so we could watch the games. When ordering our food, I asked the waiter what the best side item was too have with our burgers. Granted they were all $7 or $9 for fries, onion rings, warm potato salads, etc. 

He recommended the onion rings with our selected burgers (the standard for me which was$9 and the Morning After which was $15 for my friend). Our waiter was happy to recommend the onion rings so we went with his suggestion. 

While we waited for our food, we requested water 3 times. We got our meal, but still did not get our water or napkin setup. I tried one of the onion rings and then another while trying to track our waiter down for what would be expected, napkins, silverware and a glass of water, on our table already. I turned to my friend and asked him if he tried the onion rings because they were decent. He said yes, and I asked him how many he had. He told me one. Low and behold, there were only 2 left in the basket! So that would make a total of  5 onion rings (see above on how much we paid for the "basket"of onion rings). 

We asked our waiter, since he "highly" recommended the onion rings, if this was some sort of kitchen error. His reply was no - it wasn't a mistake, it only comes with 5 onion rings. We were disgusted. I felt like pouring the water we didn't yet have over his head...which might have spilled onto our dried out burgers to make them moist. Overall, poor service, very poor waiter recommendation, and below average food for the price - 2 burgers and 5 onion rings $35 not including the tip. Lucky I don't know the other B's name in B & B Burger, but for Pete's sake Mario Batali, why don't you just brand a line of toilet plungers than throw your name on restaurants you have no interest in or where you control the quality. Too bad, I was hoping to find that elusive burger in Vegas.

ps. I don't condone spilling any type of liquid on service folk, mostly in fear of behind the kitchen door retaliation. Although, the service was below average, we still maintained the 18% tip decorum.

We stopped in for a snack one afternoon after wandering through the shops at the Venetian. I was hoping for some little sliders so we could sample the burgers but they only had full size burgers and a very limited menu. We opted instead to split the Lobster Roll and it did not disappoint!! The bun was Buttery and it was chocked full of hunks of Lobster!! I would definitely order this again!! Hubby got a Bailey's Chocolate Milkshake and said it was so good, he would have ordered another one if we had stayed longer! I got a Blood Orange Cosmo and it was delicious! The only thing that could have been better was the service. We sat at the bar and evidently the Manager was taking care of things while the Bartender was on break. She said little to nothing to us. Took our orders, filled them and we never saw her again. The Bartender returned and we flagged him down to ask a few questions about where to order King Crab in the city. He was nice enough but not really engaging. We will definitely go back to try the Burgers.

5 stars only because it wasn't what I expected to get.  This joint looks like a food court joint next to the Venetian sport book and poker room.  We sat down just to try it.  The burgers were incredible.  Not as good a Bachi Burger, but way better than expected.  Medium rare is medium rare, not medium.

What the hell did I just spend $100 on?  Four average burgers and three beers that's what. Oh Mario, how you disappoint.   Service was very good, beer selections was above average. But the burgers? Meh. If I want to waste my money I'll go back into the casino.

At the Venetian and wanted something quick to go, I decided on getting a gourmet burger from a restaurant owned by chefs Mario Batali and Joe Bastianich -  "B&B" for Burger and Beer or Batali and Bastianich - I guess it can go either way.

While waiting at the bar for my "Drive Thru" takeout cheeseburger, the waitress was kind enough to offer me a fountain drink as my order was taking longer than expected, 

The burger was big and moist oozing with cheese and prepared just right. The staff was friendly and service was great! I would recommend B&B in Vegas if you are looking for a decent burger in a casual dining environment.
Good beer selection and good burgers. We did the 'build your own' burger and they were cooked well and the flavor combinations really stood out.

Avoid- poor food and service. what an embarrassment for Mario Batali to put his name on a place like this. 

Of course it's overpriced like most of the casino restaurants in Vegas.  I ordered two burgers medium well and both had to be sent back because they were cooked under. Burgers lacked seasoning and tasted bland. I make better burgers in my Weber kettle grill at home. 

It's overly apparent that this place is just to mooch and bloodsuck customers by using the Batali name. 

3 burgers and two drinks were 65.00. I felt ripped off. Look elsewhere!!

When you're on the strip, you expect to overpay, but overpay for quality. This was overpay for average. Appetizers (crunchy sausage/fried pickles/fried mushrooms) were great. Service was good. The burgers - which should be the stars were ok-not stellar; we were a group of 6, and were all underwhelmed.

Surprised at the low reviews.

Its expensive, but, unlike a lot of other burger joints in Vegas, it delivers.

Its rumored they use the same meat as the more expensive B&B around the corner, but grind it up into burgers and sell it for half the price.

I followed the staff recommendations and had a excellent burger, onion rings and milk shake.

Only downpoints was it was not well attended and the service was not only slow but uneducated about the small menu as well. The cost was above average as well.

I will consider going back, but will not make a special trip.

Had high hopes for B&B especially given the Bastianich and Batali names behind it however it turned out to be just okay both for service and for food. Cafeteria decor and loud music doesn't help either. Service was good but not great especially having to hunt down server to address some issues (missing part of salad, refill ice tea, etc.) and execution issues (too small of bowl for ice cream, bringing only one set of silverware for shared desert, etc.).  The chop salad was good except for the initial missing salami. The bacon cheeseburger wasn't very juicy and overly salty with paper thin bacon that was even hard to detect. Tattertots however were very good. Cherry gelato also very good.  Probably other better choices for burgers in the vicinity.

Stopped by B&B Burgers and Beer for lunch yesterday and I have to say, our lunch was delicious!  I ordered the "Morning After" burger and my husband ordered the "Drive Thru" and added bacon.  Our lunch was served hot, and everything was very fresh.  We also ordered a side of fries, and they were the BEST part about our lunch!  Imagine In n Out fries, but even better!  They were so good, and definitely big enough to share.  Everything about B&B was great!  They have bunches of tv with every sport showing.  Definitely a fun place!  The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is the service is pretty slow.  Our server was really nice, and provided great customer service, but it took a while for our food to come out.  We were there about 1:30 or so, but they weren't that busy, so you know.  Overall, great lunch and we'll visit B&B again.

The worst service without question. My order was wrong, very wrong but by the time I could even get someone to send it back everyone at the table was done. This was so bad especially in a town that is known for its food.

Just a quick update after we left the manager saw me (we were staying at the hotel) and had already seen that I left a bad review. He stopped me and offered to take part of the charge off if I fix my review and make it great. So, now they are trying to buy good reviews??

I would love to tell you what the food was like at this place, but we never got that far. The wait staff was so rude that after 2 attempts with 2 different waiters my husband and I left.  The young man that initially came to our table was curt; he basically dropped the menu on the table and then turned and walked away.  After about 10 minutes or so he returned and asked were we ready. I gave him my sandwich order and he immediately turned to my husband and said "you?". My husband attempted to do a "make your own burger" and after the first ingredient out of his mouth the waiter informed him he had to tell him what kind of bun he wanted first. Really?  After stumbling through the process with no effort on the waiter's part to assist him, the waiter turned and walked away.  No asking if there was anything else we'd like; no sides? No drinks?  When he came back our way I flagged him and indicated he hadn't asked us those questions to which his reply was "when I asked what you wanted I expected you to give me your order in its entirety".  Again, REALLY??  I informed him I wasn't pleased with his attitude and he offered us another server, to which I immediately agreed. Long story short, after his animated conversation with another server and her approach to our table with no "I'm sorry there was a problem" or "how can I help you today", but rather pretty much more of the same attitude we'd gotten from the young man I said "It is obvious that our waiter has upset us and equally obvious we've upset him so I think we're just going to take our leave". She said "okay" and turned around and walked away. Period.  Just not the way I expect to be treated as a customer in any establishment. I work hard for my money and I don't need to part with it on establishments that don't care if I'm their customer or not.  I don't need anyone to fawn over me, but I do expect a little respect and politeness.

Mario, are you truly aware this is your reputation on the line? Very disappointed.
The hot dog and the burger was good. The fries were thin, oily and not crispy. To be burger and beer they have some beers only.

Just near the Poker Room in the Venetian, you'll find B&B Burger. As a big fan of B&B Ristorante, as well as a burger and craft beer fan, I had to check this place out prior catching a plane out of Las Vegas.

Craft beer selection is robust, with both drafts and bottles. And the pricing is acceptable, unlike some other pubs and establishments (I'm looking at you Todd English P.U.B.). 

The burger selection is well presented and I was able to order a "build your own" burger to my liking. Big points for Pretzel buns! And the "Good burger" earned it's title. Great flavor. Both burgers being loaded and slightly messy.

Staff was friendly and accommodating. Great views outside of the Gondola's and the strip.

While not the best burger place I've ever dined at, for a more median-priced option at the Venetian, I would definitely return. Also a great place to just drop into to grab a beer on the go.

Stopped in here for lunch with some friends and it had me at the name. I ordered the "Bottom burner" which was great. I always lean towards the spicier burgers when I see them on a menu and I usually think it could use a little bit more heat. The "Bottom burner" on the other hand was making me look for something to drink in the best way possible, nice and spicy!  My friends and I also ordered a side of french fries and onion rings which were more than enough to split between the three of us and they  were also pretty tasty. Too bad there isn't one closer to my home town

It was well past lunchtime, and my gal and I were very hungry from shopping on the strip. Earlier in the day I was commenting about joe, one of the founders of this joint, and how I'm sure it would be good. So on our way back to our hotel we made our way in. Seated promptly in a shady and misty spot on the patio was perfect. Marcus brought us water and let us peruse the menus. Upon his return he recommended to me the "special" burger and claimed it to be the best burger they had. I thought, why not? And let me tell you it wasn't only a good burger, it was the best freaking burger I've ever had. It was incredible! Cooked to perfection. Juicy, not greasy. I just couldn't believe my mouth. 18 dollars, so what!!! Marcus defiantly made my day with his suggestion. My girlfriend also thoroughly enjoyed her burger too. Marcus was awesome, food was delicious. And we were in and out in a reasonably quick amount of time. Go to B and B if you want to be blown away. So glad we did! Thanks Marcus

I can't believe this restaurant only has 3 stars. This was our favorite dining experience from our Vegas trip. 

We stumbled upon this place while walking the strip late one night. They had plenty of available outdoor seating so we decided to give it a try and I'm so glad we did!

We had a beautiful view of the strip and cannel. The service was excellent and the food was even better. We ordered the Caesar salad, fried pickles and a burger. The Caesar salad had a spicy zing to it that set it apart from other salads. The fried pickles were light and airy and our burger was delicious! We felt that the price was very reasonable. Don't let the overall rating scare you away, it's definitely a good spot to check out!

Whoa. Skip the burger and get the Lobstah Roll. Frekkin amazing. Ok if you do get a burger there's one with a sunny side up egg on top...the morning after burger or something? Get that one! 

I was impressed by the bar b/c they had several bottles of amaro on display, specifically Fernet-Branca.  Get some chilled!

I have been wanting to try out a B&B Hospitality Group restaurant for quite sometime, since I am a huge fan of Joe Bastianich. I got my chance to eat today at B&B Burger & Beer. Since my friend and I were catching a show at Palazzo, we decided to venture over to the Venetian for a quick bite prior to the show. We arrived sat and ate at the bar.

My friend and I decided to split a burger because we wanted to tryout a couple of appetizers from the menu, without getting too full to genuinely enjoy them. We ordered the following: The Drive-Thru burger, hot wings, and Dirty Chips with bacon n blue cheese. To drink we both had a glass of Flor Prosecco. 

The burger was juicy, of decent size and consisted of 2 beef patties, American cheese, lettuce, tomato, pickles, mayo on a sesame seed bun.

The hot wings were succulent, bold and spicy. Great kick and the perfect amount of heat. Served with a side of creamy, chunky blue cheese dressing for dipping.

The Dirty Chips were crisp, mighty tasty and were topped with bacon bits and pieces of blue cheese chunks. Delish!!

I wanted to try one of Bastianich's wines, but I was not in the mood for a red wine. A chilled white wine was more of what I was craving, since it was a hot summer day. Unfortunately, the female bartender was of no help when I asked for a recommendation, as she kept mentioning red wines, when I was asking for white wines!! It was as if she was not paying attention to what I was asking her. That was very annoying!! I don't think she knew much about wines at all. 

We settled for Flor Prosecco, since it is chilled. A different bartender by the name Norberto took over and brought us our drinks. I am glad because he made up for what the female bartender lacked in service, knowledge and friendliness.

I plan on returning to B&B Burger&Beer. I want to try their Lobster roll, onion rings and one of their yummy sounding milkshakes. I also plan on finally trying out a glass of Bastianich wine. Thanks Mario Batali & Joe Bastianich (especially Joe...be still my beating heart) for the great gastronomic experience!! Until next time!

Good burgers designed by Batali and Bastiani (B&B)

I had "The Royale with Cheese" because it was a house specialty, and it appreciated the reference to Pulp Fiction. It was a good burger with many different cheeses. 

The fries were thin cut and good. 

There was a good carefully selected beer list with a nice focus on ales. 

In a city where food quality varies, this was a safe bet for a quick bite.

Can only give this place 3 stars. Bartender suggested the 'Really Good Burger'. Yes it was juicy, but an overpowering of blue cheese (I do love gorgonzola, but too much), onions, bacon, and mustard made it so you couldn't really taste the beef. $16 for the burger and $6 for the fries on the side! Add a light beer and it was a $35 meal. burger was pretty good, but horrible value at that price, even for Vegas.

Great burgers and the outdoor seating is not to be beat! Reasonable prices for the Vegas strip and everything was very good! Service was wonderful the server was very kind and attentive. Highly recommended for a low key casual dining experience!

Location: the place is situated inside the Venetian hotel. Nothing fancy. A few benches and tables sit are distributed inside a dark, single room restaurant with several TVs sitting on every wall. No glamour, not even for a burger place. Tables weren't balanced properly and when leaning on one side of the table the beer would spill.

Food: This where surely the worst burger I have eaten in Las Vegas. The meat  patties were greasy and the fries were burned. The onions seemed to have been peeled only sloppily as I found some brown peels inside my burger. The cheese wasn't worth mentioning.

Service: mediocre and a bit shy. Food was served promptly though. 

Drinks: the place is called burgers & beers but the place sported a list of beers that could be found in any other corner shop or provincial diner.

Verdict: skip this place

As a Pulp Fiction fan, I had to get the Royal with Cheese.  It was good and had lots of flavor, with carmelized onions and gooey cheeses.  The burgers in general, were good, but not amazing.  Fries were undercooked and looked like limp noodles.  The corn dogs and shishito peppers were really good. 

Being a Mario Batali restaurant, I had pretty high expectations that simply weren't met.  He seems like a guy with very high quality standards, but it didn't show through on this particular night.

The waitress built up the special of the day - a burger where the beef was ground on site, etc. It turned out to be a pretty poor burger. The meat was tasteless - so they smothered it in a sauce that dripped everywhere. For $18 or $19 you'd probably expect the burger to come with fries - and you would be wrong. Redeeming factors that earned B&B a second star: Shiner on tap and the speed in which we were served.

Let's start off with this, I had wine spilled on my white shirt by the waiter 15 minutes into sitting down. Despite my new multi colored shirt, the food was good.  Service was for the most part pretty good.  The Manager did apologies and offered dry cleaning to me, so i give them an additional star for that.
$15 Burger.  Taste was good but with Fries it's an additional $7.  $22 Burger too expensive for only 6oz meat.  Non memorable experience.  Like eating a $22 burger at a pancake house.

After a good day of gaming, we decided go to the strip for something special. We decided to take in B&B Burger. Right off I love the decor. Orange and yellow are my favorite colors. The hostesses asked about any allergies. I have a latex allergy. The waiter cleared the allergy with the kitchen, the. We ordered. I had the Morning after Burger with the egg. It was superb. Juicy, tasty, and the egg was farm fresh. My husband had the spicy burger and said it was delicious and yes spicy. The homemade chips were very good as well. We ordered a milkshake to share. They brought us out two of them. I think they split it for us, as there was only one charged on the bill. That was nice. The shake was very rich and cream. A great finis. While leaving we noticed the take out window. This should do well as it is in the sports book,poker room area. Way to go Mario and Joe. Now bring Eataly to Vegas!

Had a great lunch sitting on the patio at the Venetian. Wasn't in the mood for a burger so opted for a sandwich. Had the pastrami with a side of tater tots. Both said on the menu that they were house made and you sure could taste it. Both were very delicious, one of the best pastrami sandwiches  I've ever had! Service was great too!

We came here for dinner on our second night in Vegas. (My flight was so delayed that I didn't get to experience dinner the first night, but that's a different story!) Note that dinner in Vegas really means sometime after midnight, because after you get out of a show, walk the strip, go to a party, all indoors in a well-lit environment with clocks, you lose all sense of time until you're completely starving. I was the first one to proclaim starving-ness, and this was a good choice.

I had the flame burger, which no longer appears to be on the menu. It was a beef patty, jalapeno pesto, pepper jack, topped with an onion ring and hot sauce. I'm not a wimp when it comes to spicy food, but this was actually pretty spicy! I drank so much water that the busboy kept coming back to refill just my glass. I was too grateful to be embarrassed. The burger was large and was well cooked. It was a perfect medium and the bun was fluffy and light but nicely toasted. I also had a side of fries, which were the highlight of the meal- they were thin, crispy, salty, and well-cooked.

My companions also ordered sandwiches- one got a burger (it had a fried egg on it) and the other got a lobster roll. Everyone devoured their food in companionable silence, so it's safe to assume we all liked it!

I found the prices to be on the high side for the food ($15-16 for a burger, plus $7 for fries), but I think it's still considered a lower end restaurant on the strip. Vegas is not exactly a budget destination.

Decent burger but not anything to go out of your way to try. The combinations of toppings are an interesting mix - I ended up with The Royale. It was good but the meat itself wasn't really seasoned and didn't have that good grill flavor. It was just kind of there to provide grease and hold the toppings. 

Service was decent but a little up and down. It was busy but there were 3 bartenders and they seemed to be busier taking table orders than waiting on people at the actual bar.

(3.5 stars) I was crazy excited to finally try a Mario Batali restaurant. (I actually think this is his only causal restaurant.) Although I very much enjoyed my burger (the bottom burner), the restaurant did have a few issues. For example, why is alternate/hard rock music constantly playing in the background and why is it so loud? 

From reading the description, the bottom burner had my name all over it: jalapeño pesto, pepper jack cheese, onion rings, and hot sauce. How could I not love it? (Although it doesn't list it, the default is to put mayo on the burger so make sure to mention leaving it off if you don't want any.) The burger had a lot heat to it that really snuck up on me after a few bites, which was great. It was well-cooked and a bit on the greasy side but very different and worth getting. 

It's a little upsetting the burgers don't come with sides but we got some fries and onion rings anyway cause how could you not? I enjoyed the onion rings a lot as they were on the thinner and crispier side. Also, they were nice enough to prepare a special batch to accommodate a food allergy of ours. The French fries were initially super disappointing: lukewarm and salty. We asked for a fresher batch and they were much better, although still only average fries sadly. 

It's not a cheap burger place by any means and the sides are a tad disappointing but the service was friendly and accommodative, and if the bottom burner sounds like something that interests you, stop and get it for sure.

Wife and I are Big Batali and Bastianich fans. We recently went to Ramsay's "Burgr" and were less than impressed by the exaggerated pomp and pretentiousness  So we decided to try a New Year's day snack at B&B. Wings were very good; nice spice tempered by a creamy blue cheese base. Jalapeno pesto burger was top notch. I loved the texture and complexity of the jalapeno pesto. Patty was cooked to a perfect juicy medium rare. Bun was soft and fresh.  Bravo.  Pastrami sandwich was solid. Fries were simple, tasty and ketchup right on. Great service from waitress Julianne (I hope I spelled it correctly - sorry if i didn't). Hostesses were pleasant and not pretentious.  Worth the drive from Henderson for a nice burger lunch when not in the mood for In 'n Out or Five Guys.  Nice job Mario and Joe.  We'll be back.

I had a Cod Hero and my friend had a Burger.  Both prepared perfectly.  I had the Lettuce Wedge which came with a very tasty light oil dressing.  The potato side was also excellent.  First day open and the staff was ready, well trained, friendly and attentive.  And in the middle of our meal, in walks Mario Batali.  Outstanding meal and a highly recommended restaurant.  Located inside Venetian Las Vegas near the Sports Book, just off the main casino floor.

Wait staff is overwhelmed, food took forever to get served.  My drinks weren't refilled, it completely cancelled out the food.  Don't bother, eat somewhere else.  The restaurant needs more waitstaff and they need to work together.  Absolutely not worth it, go to Burgr instead, great food and service there!
Good service but sub par burger and milk shake. Nothing really special, I was expecting much more taking in consideration the chef and co-owner, probably they have not eaten their own burgers.

This is a nice burger joint, a little on the pricy side, located inside the Venetian. They had restaurant quality burgers, in a fast food style setting. I tried the Royale with cheese burger, it was delicious! It was perfectly cooked how I ordered and the onions were sweet and caramelized. I also tried the tater tots,I would have to say these were very greasy and I could not finish them. The onion rings though were large and cooked to perfection, I would recommend those instead.. If you are coming here for lunch with no alcohol, you will spend close to $30 for a burger with a side and a drink.

This is a go to favorite for us when we are in Vegas. You have to try the fried pickles...Amazing!! The chicken sandwich & burgers are always spot on as well. Always had great service from the waitstaff.

Date: 04/19 around 5pm

In town with my wife for the week celebrating our 15th anniversary, so we are staying at the Venetian for the first time because of the celebrity chefs represented here.  We wanted to try some on-property locations on our first night.  We were immediately seated as there were many empty tables available.  Our server (Shane) said that he would have someone else helping for training.  Service was average.

The menu is a bit limited in my opinion, but there is a create-your-own option (Bar Burger) that has a lot of customizations.  My wife had the Drive-Thru Burger with a side of fries.  I ordered a Bar Burger on pretzel bun with provolone, caramelized onions, and garlic aioli, with a side of onion rings.  My wife's burger was very salty, and the "fresh cut" fries were so salty that they were nearly inedible.  my wife likened her burger to "a Steak & Shake burger."  My burger was tasty, but the onions were on the bottom and made the bottom part of the bun disintegrate so that I had to eat half with a fork.  The one thing that probably needed salt the most (onion rings) had none and there was none on the table.  The garlic aioli was easily the highlight of my meal.

There was a table of four near us that was being very loud and disturbing.  They ran one couple out of the restaurant, and we had to hurry through our meal because it was very annoying.  The waiters continued to serve these people more alcohol.  We told the hostess on the way out that she might want to consider not seating people back there until the obnoxious patrons left.

Seriously disappointed in this experience, as we've been looking forward to this trip and the opportunity to try the restaurants here for weeks.  We expected better from a celebrity chef restaurant with $16 burgers.  Unfortunately we will not be back on this trip or any other.

I got the Royale with cheese and it was one of the best burgers I've ever had. The onion rings were great because they weren't greasy at all. Also had the Carmel swirl milkshake and it was delicious as well.

Hard to believe a burger place with just a handful of people at 6:30 on a friday! We started with fried pickles and i swear about 12 to an order for about $6. Burgers seemed and tasted pretty basic for the price. The best part of the meal for myself was the cabbage slaw. We ordered the bottom burner and the morning after. Both tasted just Ok! Nothing really special stood out except the price! All in all two burgers, order or fries. Slaw and those pickles with water to drink was $50. I really think they missed the mark on what could be a great place!

This is a really great "burger" place. The burger meat is amazing and everything is remarkably fresh and well seasoned. The "really good burger" is amazing. I also had the cabbage slaw and that was super tasty. We were able to sit outside and even though it was over 100-degrees it was very comfortable under the shades and the misters.

Loved it. Great burger. Excellent French fries. Sitting outside next to the canals for a great view. Service was fast. The spinach salad was very good after they let me swap out the spinach for romaine. Will be back.

I had such high expectations for this place because I'm a Batali and Bastianich fan & a combination of our waiter telling us everything was amazing we each ordered 4 different dishes. Everything was just ok, it definitely was not amazing. We ordered the "morning after burger(lacking flavor), spicy burger(way too spicy), pastrami sandwich(not soft and like sandwich market meat) & buffalo wings( not flavorful). I have to say our waiter was very tentative but the food for this place should of tasted better considering the brand behind the name. They def have some improvement to do. Even after telling them how spicy the burger was they should of tried to make it better and they didn't care except to have me fill out a comment card.

After my first bad experience, I thought I would give this place another try. My waiter, Stephen, was delightful. I even told him about my previous bad experience. He vowed to make it better. Unfortunately, there is only so much he can do about the quality and flavor of the food. I ordered a burger with a lettuce bun and my husband ordered a burger on a pretzel bun. They came out warm and fresh. Sadly, the meat was thin and uninteresting. The fries were abysmal. Skinny, dry and lukewarm. It's sad because I really want to love this place. The burger isn't bad, but it just isn't memorable. The fries need to go.

This place is horrible. The burgers are average but priced at New York prices at $13-$16 each with no side. The service was very slow and non friendly. I also found a hair in my food after I was done eating. It was as if the chef saw it and hid it under my food. The manager didn't even come over to apologize. The best part about my whole experience is I had to ask the manager myself to take the food I found my hair in off the bill. STEER CLEAR!

Absolutely love this place! My hubby and I are here and have been back 3times since our stay and we have only been here for 2days! Lol our server Shane was really friendly and didn't hover (we LOVE that!!!!) Our food was fresh and tasted great! We have been to so many place and this is by far our favorite!!
Essen war so naja. Fries waren gut.

We came here for the Batali name but I suspect he has little involvement in the quality of food at this place.

The seating situation is odd. Their wooden booths are incredibly uncomfortable.

I ordered the drive in burger. Normally toppings come on the side but they had them on the burger. Oddly my burger came wrapped in paper like at a fast food joint. The burger is very low quality. 

Fries are shoestring fries. Honestly, In n Out makes better food but it is of similar quality.

Service was ok but slow. Waitress was nice but for how the food tasted, it did take forever to get here. 

Overall, I'm surprised this place is allowed to operate in the Venetian. Without the Batali name, it wouldn't be here.

Not sure what more you could ask for from a higher end burger joint

I guess Mario could have served your burger on roller skates, holding sparklers, and in a t shirt that had holes cut out in the nipples for better reviews 

Fried oysters - solid

Wings - small but good sauce 

Morning after burger - excellent 

Wife had the Nutella Shake and it was spectacular
