It was not busy when we were there for an early Friday lunch but every employee went out of their way to be friendly and provide good service. My drink was never empty, no empty plate sat on our table, and our server checked on us at least 5x

We would def go back.

Menu is limited but the scenery is just gorgeous. I'm not sure how they got lucky in picking that venue but eating outside will give you a sight during the night. This is dependent of the weather of course.
Known for burgers of course, it's one of many restaurants that these chefs have. May come again with friends but be weary that it can get crowded a bit.

Now that was a good quality, cheap eat for the Vegas strip! I loved the fish sandwich and fries (be sure to get a side of the truffle sauce to dip!). My hubby built his own burger and enjoyed as well. Great beer selection, and excellent people watching if you sit outside on the patio. I wish we would have realized this was such a good spot sooner in our trip, or we would have been there more than once. The service was speedy and friendly- great recommendations!
Really disappointing!  The hamburger meat was like a frozen Patty....not fresh.  Absolutely nothing to write he about....especially for the price!

We returned to B&B so I could sample the drive thru.  I am glad I did, as this burger was so good it warrants an extra star for B&B.  The drive thru is a double patty, double American cheese burger.  It has mayo, ketchup, mustard, pickles, leaf lettuce and tomato.  It's served on a sesame seed bun, then wrapped in butcher paper.  I was blown away by how good this burger is.  The thin patties are my preference.  I guess they remind me of all the diners and onion burger joints in Oklahoma from my childhood.  The thin patties at B&B were done to perfection.  Literally, I have no idea how they cooked these this well.  The thing about thin patties is you don't want to cook them too much that aren't juicy, but you need to cook them long enough that they get the delicious crispy ends.  Well, B&B managed to leave this burger pink in the middle, thus ensuring maximum juiciness, while getting the crispy edges that make thin patties so good.  Very impressive.  

Wrapping the whole thing in butcher paper allows the cheese to properly melt, and sort of crams all the flavors together.  I have found my burger at B&B for future visits.  The fact that this thing is only $9 is amazing, especially when you consider the price of comparably sized burgers at enormous fast food chains is only about $3 less.  Get to B&B and try this burger, unless you hate things that are delicious.
Favorite burger place so far, amazing service,helpful waiters, great beer, just loved it.

I am a little disappointed with B&B Burger & Beer considering how much I like its brother restaurant, B&B.  

This signature Batali orange restaurant is nothing to write home about.  I had the Morning After which is a mushroom burger with an egg.  I like Fukuburger's egg burger much better and it cost a lot less.  However, I would probably have to bring my own camp chair if I want to sit at the food truck.  Here, I can sit in a cold, silver, metal chair and listen to Alanis Morisette.  I gotta say my waiter looked fit so that is pleasing.  It wasn't pleasing when he kept asking me how the food was when my mouth was full of burger.  I guess he knew it wasn't that great.  I guess it is okay to eat here if you don't mind strip prices and you really need a burger and you are nearby.  I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here though.  This is no Burger Bar.

Great place for quick bite to eat with a variety of Beer.  The menu is limited, so consider the menu to be a typical bar selection, but unique in the selections and very tasty food.  Burgers were cooked exactly to temperature requested, and service was spot on.  Make sure you have napkins on hand, as the burgers are juicy and messy, a delicious combination.  Cheers!

Expected more from you Mario Batali. I can no longer trust your endorsing of burger joints. 

Boring, over salted, over priced with a Niger king that serves beer atmosphere.

Mario you claim it's all about the beer and the burgers but the beer selection was pathetic, everything I can get at Walmart (no offense Walmart). Beef wasn't amazing not the accoutrements.

My husband and I enjoyed the food here. The burger was juicy. I like that they have an option that you can choose the bread for your burger. Pretzel bun and I'm solved. A bit pricey but it knowing you are in Vegas I think it is decent. Servers are nice.

All in all one good gourmet burger.  Had the royale with cheese medium well.  Perfect.  Milk shake is good.  Beer good selection.   Would of gave 5 but for the price I'm paying for a burger I expect fries or onion rings to be included.  Nope those sides are extra.  Burger and fries come out to $20.  Not crazy but any restaurant has burger and fries from $12-15.  Service was great and even the manager was hands on with helping with our order.

I ordered the chicken cobb sandwich, overall good, special sauce was a little salty but does enhance the flavor of the sandwich; bread overwhelming. My hubby had the jalapeño burger n fries. He enjoyed his burger n the jalapeño combo, the fries tasted as if they were reheated. The service was good and attentive.

Burger was great! Onion rings were really good.  Had an Italian beer (manebrea, Amber)--- AMAZING.  However salads, not so much.  First one I had, I found after first bite, there were hot peppers in it which I didn't see on the menu description.  I'm sensitive to spice and my hubby who then Tried it (can deal with spices) said ya it's an after burn. There was also a lot of dressing!.  I returned it and got the cranberry salad.... more spinach than cranberries and walnuts.  There was ALOT of dressing.  I was not pleased.  So overall, don't get a salad there. They're a burger place not salad.

Mario--quality control--my burger obviously wasn't cooked fresh. It was cold at my first bite. Had the Royale--I was so disappointed. I sent it back--waiter said they would cook me another. He brought me back my partially eaten burger heated up. 2 burgers fries and a beer 50 bucks. I don't mind paying the money but food was at best 2 out of 5---a friend told us not to go I didn't believe could be that bad--it was
Good burgers. Good beer selection. Nothing fancy and that's what I was looking for this afternoon.

The food was OK, the service was not really good - I expected more from the two famous Bs. 
We ordered spinach salad with feta, marinated onions, cranberries and candied walnuts. The salad was good, but too overdressed. I asked for no onions as the salad was for my daughter, but the onions were not removed, I had to pick them out as no one was about to have the salad replaced. I had a cob salad - my chicken was well seasoned, but too dry. Blue cheese dressing that I had on the side was thick like butter and could not be mixed. I was hoping for some fresh pepper or any pepper, for that matter, but the waiter was MIA so I made do w/out it. My son had a burger which he liked & my husband had eggplant parmigiana which he also liked. We ordered fries as none of the sandwiches come with them. Fires were tiny (short), greasy and soft - a bid disappointment for six bucks a pop. To drink we had beer and bottled water. The waiter filled our water glasses and immediately brought the second bottle w/out us asking for it. He kept filling our glasses even though I said we had enough. The heroic gesture on the waiter's part was that he brought my husband a small taste of beer before he ordered a pint. I would have given two stars, but one star up on the account of good burger and eggplant.

Not a bad burger place enjoyed it while I was in town great outside seating only order one order of fries for four people more than enough fries and pretty good burgers definitely would go back when I'm in town

I thought this place was fantastic. I strolled right in and sat at the bar. The bartender was very attentive and got me a Kilt Lifter. I ordered the Bottom Burner and it arrived looking like a work of art. I don't think I've ever seen a burger that just looked so good. It tasted fantastic as well. It's a spicy burger, but not overpowering. Fantastic. Love this place.

From the Italian powerhouses Mario Batali and Joe Bastianich  comes... a burger joint???

How does it stack up?  Accepting that Hubert Keller's Burger Bar with it's selection of top grade beef and well prepared, gourmet toppings is the supreme high end burger and Bachi Burger at the other extreme for delicious creativity, B&B Burger fits right in the middle.  (Sorry, clowns and kings don't even count as food in this burger arena).

Breaking it down, the burgers are firm and juicy, with a good blend of different cuts of beef, aggressively seasoned, cooked to temperature with a good outer sear.  Small selection of well made toppings (sautéed mushrooms, fried egg, avocado, caramelized onion), decent selection of cheeses, great sauces (jalapeno pesto, balsamic mustard, Chianti mustard, garlic aioli, truffle aioli).

Order as a "build your own" or from preconceived selections that feature "The Drive-Thru" (take on In-n-Out's burger, griddled patties with processed American cheese on a sesame bun in a paper wrapper)  slumming it on the Strip or a great "Morning After" (sautéed mushrooms, Fontana, egg, truffle aioli and frisee) AKA Midwest heart attack.  Both are good eats, classic, comforting.

A selection of Heroes for the non burger eaters.  The crispy cod is very good.  Deep fried, crisp, moist cod with a refreshing slaw and spicy jalapeno tartar.

OK sides.  Chips crisp and flavorful, onion rings, sweet with a crisp coating, fried pickles good acid but excessive coating makes them oily.

Service not perfect but Strip friendly.  Well chosen selection of craft beers.  Vegas resort pricing.

The average tab, just ONE green check.  Hey, you're in the Venetian.

This place gets a 10 just for the view outside! We were walking around for 30 mins looking for  good place to eat. I remember seeing an infomercial from the Hotel on this place and figured we give this place a try.

The wait was only about 10 mins and we sat right next to the Gondola rides. It was a pleasant day and this was the perfect setting.

My wife had the Cosmo and I had a Moscow Mule for $14.00. She ordered the Lobster roll for $21.00 and said it was the best one she's ever had. Plenty of Lobster chunks and not too much filler. The roll was perfectly toasted.

I had the steak sandwich for $15.00 and it was very reasonable. Plenty of shaved steak and the bread was different for a steak and cheese. Sort of a french roll but very good.

All in all it was $70.00 plus tip for lunch. We recommend this place at least just once.

Quick Tip: Don't eat inside - the best part is the outside scenery.
Loved the onion rings and drive they burger! Tasty tasty. Fresh pickles and lots of cheese. If you're in the mood for a great burger this is your place.

This new high class burger joint phenomena composed of slapping a celebrity chef name to the front of the establishment exists because it is a pure profit machine.

-You don't need expensive ingredients beyond the small amount of high quality meat.
-You don't need to hire any chefs with accolades
-It attracts business because people want to say they experienced a creation by "...." without spending $150/person.

...and what you get is a good burger at 600% markup and fries at 1000% markup.

I had The Morning After:
Sautéed mushrooms, fontina, sunny side egg, truffle aioli, frisée $15

The meat itself was high quality and it came out a perfect medium rare as requested...I didn't really taste the fontina nor the truffle aioli since the egg ran all over the place. Also the meat to bun ratio sucked.

End of day, I'd take the taste and value of the $6.99 Mushroom Truffle Swiss over at Smashburger rather than buy another one of these $15 jobs.

The fries were $6 and were better than McDonald's...but about the same size portion.

2 burgers and one shared french fry came to over $40 with tip.

Lesson learned: Burger joints in casinos are tourist traps. 

Avoid.

Service was good and good was tasty. We started with the BBQ wings to share and two burgers for entrees. We shared a side of fries- they were plenty for two. Would recommend! Right on the strip with outside seating

While on vacation, my boyfriend and I stopped here for lunch. There was no wait which was nice and you could sit right outside or inside the casino. Overall, the food was tasty. I had the meatball hoogie and it was really delicious. The meatballs are homemade and it tasted like it. My boyfriend ordered a "make your own burger" which was also really tasty. The meals don't come with fries so you have to order them separately. Both our meals with one order of fries was about $40. We didn't order drinks because it was so hot and we just wanted cold water ! 

The service was sufficient and the area was clean. Only problem was the pigeons that sit there and have lunch with you. They wait for you to drop your food or look away so watch your food !! Lol

Me and a group of buddies went last night and ate at the bar.  we all ordered different burgers and they were fine but nothing extraordinary.  Do not get the chicken sandwich as it is poor quality chicken.  The onion rings are great and the fries are very small and greasy.  The bartender totally hated her job and it showed.  Her attitude left a lot to be desired as did her service.  Otherwise a fairly unmemorable burger joint.

Horrible wait once you're seated- food is okay- and prices are atrocious. I will never set foot in this place again and suggest you do yourself and friends a favor and don't get stuck sitting for over two hours to eat and pay. That's not including wait to get in which there was none and I know why now!! ASK FOR A MANAGER AND THEY ARE " UPSTAIRS AND CANR HELP YOU" Best advice- DONT GO HERE!! Wish I could give this a zero star rating!

I judge my burger places by fries and beers. The fries are pretty good. I had a turkey burger which was great and my hubs had a salmon burger. If you are coming here for a wide selection of beers on tap this place is not for you. Our server was very friendly.
Great burgers, bun is freshly made. The meat is thick & made to order, fries are separate charge.

Best burger I've ever had and I'm from Chicago so I'd like to think I know what makes for a good burger. My friends and I were looking for a filling and tasty burger after having had a few drinks shortly after landing in Vegas and this place did not disappoint. I had the Morning After burger like many other reviewers had. It was delicious with everything tasting great together and the burger was perfectly cooked. 

Service was quick and attentive. The decor was your standard burger joint with clean tables and chairs. I would definitely go back here on my next visit to Vegas.

I was here in January during CES and it was wonderful. The local beer was tasty, the spiked milkshake was to die for and the burgers were fantastic. Our server was very genuine with his service making it an excellent experience. I'm only giving it 4 starts because I got some serious nausea from either the egg on my burger or the fried oysters. However, I'd still eat here again after that...that is how good this place is.

I don't give 5 stars often. B&B has a number of bad reviews, not sure if for this location or if they just improved based on comments but my experience was very, very good indeed! It is "just a beer - and burger / sandwich bar, so I would not go for dinner , this is for a quick in, wang bang thank you mam burger and beer, no sides no ....
Burger cooked to perfection , bun soft and tasty, yes ! Beer - decent selection, I like IPAs , they have 4 or 5 on tab plus a number of other kinds. Service nice, friendly and efficient! I will be back !!!!

Really good burger guys!

We were doing the gondola trip at the venetian and has 45 minutes before our booked slot. Explained this and they promised we would definitely be do e in time - which we were. 

I went for the royale burger. Medium rare to perfection, dripping with clean juices from the meat onions and cheese. Great crispy fries too. Really impressed. Not the cheapest but hey for a burger this good and an outside table with a great view who cares!

This was my 2nd "B&B Boy" venture, and again, this disappointed.   (first was CarneVino) Went here before a show at the Venetian, and had reservation, and didn't need them.  The place was more than 1/2 empty.   It took about 10 minutes for the waiter to come over, bring menus.  On their drink menu, they had Fever Tree Ginger Ale, so I asked if they had Fever Tree Tonic or Bitter Lemon.  Waiter looked confused, and I stated, you sell ginger ale, do you have tonic, and he said I don't think so.  He didn't check - so rather than get him anymore confused I went with a signature drink, which was very good - Blood Orange Cosmo.  Appetizers were shishito peppers and fried, not so fried pickles, which were the highlight of our meal.  I ordered the Royal with Cheese, and the melted cheese and grilled onions disintegrated the bread, and not mid way thru the meal, the first bite.  It goo'd and ooze all over my hand.   I don't mind a GOOD burger to be a mess, but not that.   Had to ask for salt, because even with all the cheese & onion, it still lacked salt.    We stayed at the Mirage, and always eat at BLT Burger - we totally REGRETTED not eating there, and walking over to the show.    I have a cast iron stomach, but I was in desperate need of tums during the 2nd act of the show.   I'd go back for the cosmo, peppers & pickles - but don't want to pay $50 for just that.  I gave it 1 star, because it's not called pickles & peppers, it's burgers, and they couldn't deliver.

A few weeks back I stayed at The Venetian and heard this new place opened up downstairs. We decided to give their casino bar a shot and were impressed by the beer selection. Levi (at the bar) gave us a good rundown of what they carried and suggested some tasty brews which to taste and I loved them. We decided to come back in the morning for breakfast and I ordered the "hangover burger" which was friggin' delicious! Just what I needed on a Vegas Sunday morning. I highly recommend eating outside for the view. Next time I'm in Vegas I will definitely come back for more.

Was so looking forward to this Mario Batali and Joe Bastianich restaurant but there computers went down when I arrived. We sat around waiting for the computers to come back on for 39 minutes. I have served the public for 26 years and my patrons would not be inconvenienced due to computer problems. Go old school. Poor service and this made the food taste mediocre.

And this guy has a TV show telling other people what he thinks of their food and business? Lousy fries, wilted and thin. Steak fries for a place like this are the only way to go. So my date had plain burger which was decent. But you wonder why they don't use organic meats. I opted for a lobster roll and by far the worst of its kind. $21.00, I don think so. The lobster roll was to small and they put bacon in it when I told them not to. Who puts bacon in a lobster roll anyway. Not nearly enough lobster meat.If you're ever on Cape Cod ya go to the seafood joint in Popponessett  and for $26.00 you get a lobster roll like no other. Even enough for two unless you're a big fat F&*K

Sad to say, go somewhere else for a meal. Ordered the bottom burner. Jalapeño pesto is over powering without good flavor. On top of that, two, overly greasy onion rings (no onion flavor all oil) is also on the burger, awful. The burger also included a dollop of "buffalo wing sauce" with a smidge of blue cheese. Just a greasy flavorless spicy wreck and I like spicy.  Photo included. Looks like it could be good but wasn't in any way. To top it off...no ketchup to be added to at least make this palatable. I hated it and I like everything. Worst thing I've eaten in Las Vegas and I've come every year for the last six years. Toughest part, my meal cost $18 and I ordered water.

This restaurant sits over near the Venetian Sportsbook and also has a sister location in the Palazzo that serves a higher end menu of steaks, Italian and seafood.  This location caters to Burgers and beer (and any other drink you desire). 

I went with a custom built burger that had a potato bun, bacon, caramelized onions, BBQ and the typical other fare.  It was cooked medium and was excellent.   The fries were huge and are enough for 2 unless your a pig (or really hungry).  Lol. 

The pulled pork sandwich was good but not great.  The wife says it needed more BBQ and maybe a bun that held up better.  She had to eat the whole thing with a fork with isn't bad, just not what was expected.  Overall a good sandwich though.  

The prices are a bit high but being in the Venetian it's to be expected (and normal).  I'm tilting between 4 and 5 stars but I'm gonna roll with 4 until we can try it again and maybe grab one of the deserts too.  I was too full this go around.  

Enjoy!

Items Selected:
Pastrami Sandwich - Rye Bread, Swiss Cheese, Sauerkraut, Line Cook Ale Mustard
Eggplant Parmigiano - Ciabatta, Fried Eggplant, Marinara, Fresh Mozzarella, Provolone, Basil Pesto
Crispy Cod - Sesame Seed Bun, Iceberg Slaw, Jalapeno Tartar
French Fries
Nutella Shake - Vanilla Gelato, Nutella, Candied Hazelnuts
Bourbon Cherry - Vanilla Gelato, Bourbon, Amarena Cherry

Briefly known as Rattlecan and subsequently rebranded to another Celebrity Chef spot in late 2013 when Mario Batali and partner Joe Bastianich launched B&B Burgers & Beer, there is little doubt that the odd corner near the Venetian Poker Room and Sports Book remains a marketing challenge no matter how big the name on the signage, ongoing construction in the vicinity and outdoor temperatures topping 105°F making the idea of a visit even more of a chore.

Best accessed from the outside patio, a pleasant view of the Gondolas with some seclusion from Strip traffic a bonus compared to other eateries jutting out onto Las Vegas Boulevard, B&B Burgers & Beer is not to be confused with B&B Ristorante located along Restaurant Row connecting The Venetian to The Palazzo, price points far lower with a stripped down orange decor and a vibe far more casual.

Still marching to the beat of Chef Batali's drum, the music intentionally a touch too loud as muted screens displayed The 2016 Olympic Games, it was just past 2pm that way was made to the hostess podium, reservations quickly confirmed with a smile and the young lady beckoning "right this way." 

Faulted by some for the steel barstools, other qualms raised about a lack of desserts plus a menu that seems resistant to change, it was at a booth large enough for eight that seating was selected during the Restaurant's off-hour, a brief look at the menu showing prices for most sandwiches to range $12-20 with Appetizers hovering in the upper-single digits along with four types of Shakes.

Higher priced than some places, though not any different from a spot like Holsteins or Gordon Ramsay Burgr, it was with an eye on Sandwiches moreso than seared Beef that the visit was focused upon, a total of three far more than one should attempt to eat in one sitting, a single selection actually a substantial lunch for one when paired with an appetizer, salad or side.

Described at length by the Server and Chef, Batali's dedication to product sourcing evidenced by House-cured Pastrami, Line-caught Cod, Imported Cheeses, and Organic Produce on Fresh Baked Breads, the tasting began with a handful of crispy fries with a coarse-salt adding an extra bit of crunch, a follow-up bite of the Eggplant Parmigiano showing the lightly grilled rounds perfectly complimented by melty Mozzarella, Tomato Sauce and aromatic Pesto atop Carnevino's signature Ciabatta, still one of Las Vegas' best breads whether topped as it is here or liberally slathered with Lardo.

Having heard that the Lobster Roll would soon be making an exit and instead turning to the Fish Sandwich for a seafood fix, suffice it to say that the fresh Atlantic Cod finds a new level beneath Jalapeno Tartar nestled into a Bun rich with Sesame Seeds, the fatty cuts of Black and Green Peppercorn Pastrami subjectively better than that remembered from World-Famous Langer's in Los Angeles on Rye Bread with a light touch of house-ground Mustard and particularly pungent Swiss Cheese.

Drinking bottled water with most of the meal, but surely not planning to leave without a Shake, fans of Nutella will be happy to know that the Italian Hazelnut Spread is so thick amidst Vanilla Gelato that a spoon is a far better tool than a straw for its consumption, the boozed up Amarena Cherry a slightly more sipable option, though no less creamy in its constitution with several whole cherries to be discovered at the bottom.

****Doing what Batali & Bastianch have done at Carnevino or New York's Casa Mono, taking something outside their traditional scope of "Italian" food and nonetheless crafting a unique experience featuring memorable food, B&B Burgers & Beer warrants no less acclaim than its Strip-based bretheren, though return visits may indeed be limited by a menu that has not changed much in over thirty months and a disappointing lack of desserts.

The burgers are spot on. Tasted like an over sized habit or in n out burger. 
We had the double I forget what it's called. The pickles were even good on the burger, and I hate pickles on my burgers. 

Fries were good, as well as onion rings.
The only minor thing, the ranch didn't have a good taste. 


Seating inside and on the outside also where you can order togo. 
Server was very nice.
We were seated, given a glass of water, no menues. After 15 minutes of no one coming to our table, we got up and left. I could understand if the place was busy, but there were plenty of empty tables.
Don't waist your time. Ok food but horrible atmosphere. Like dinning in a cheep cafeteria. Not comfy.

I've been wanting to go here since they first opened. Nutella milkshake, helloooo? Why would I not want to go here? So, my friend and I went here. It's located by sports book inside the Venetian. This is different from B&B Ristorante in front of Delmonico.

I knew exactly what I wanted to try before I even went. My friend and I have been talking about having a wine date night so, we got a bottle of Pinot Grigio instead of getting beer with our burgers. I got a morning after burger, fries with truffle aioli on the side and Nutella milkshake.

Morning After Burger:
Frisee, truffle aioli, sauteed mushrooms, fontina topped with a sunny side egg. I got mine medium-rare as usual. They serve 50/50 which makes the thick patty soooo flavorful you can eat it by itself. I had to eat this with a knife and fork - it was thick and messy but oh so good. 4.5/5

Fries:
Hot and crisp. They were fine on their own and maybe a bit of ketchup. 4/5

Truffle Aioli:
I got an extra side of truffle aioli for my fries. I've never had truffle aioli I didn't like - well, I have now. I couldn't taste truffle at all. It was just like dipping fries into plain mayo. I was rather disappointed. 2/5

Nutella Milkshake:
Vanilla gelato, Nutella, whippe cream and candied hazelnuts. This was my main motivation for coming here. There's another Nutella milkshake version at Burger Bar but they use chocolate ice cream so, there's a difference in flavor and consistency. I like both. The candied hazelnuts was a nice touch. You get a crunch on your milkshake. The shake isn't too thick. So, sucking on it wasn't a problem. 4/5

The service was fantastic. Our server gave my friend suggestions, answered all our questions and always with a smile on her face. She told us all the items on their menu are made locally daily (like the pastrami) and the beef for the burgers are also ground fresh daily. Our wine and water glasses were never empty.

They have sandwiches that all sound good. Pastrami, steak, crispy cod, lobster roll, eggplant parm, meatball, etc. I'll have to try those next time.
The beers and the service were fine, the burgers and atmosphere were average at best. If you're rating B&B against drive-thru fast food it's a ten but against the sit down chains, it's average.

Stopped in for dinner before a concert . Seated quickly and food came out very fast . I ordered the Royale Burger was not what I was expecting not a lot of seasoning and pretty dry . Ordered side of there potatoes chips , they were fresh but bland nothing stood out about them . Great place to catch a game though or hang out at the bar . The place is very clean and most of the staff was nice . No restrooms in the place so have to walk out to casino. Wouldn't make a special trip back here just to eat . Since I am a local there are other places that serve better food at cheaper prices . I will say I love the Venetian it's one of my Favorite places on the strip .

Service started out great but ended BAD. Once our food was delivered we never saw our server again. He didn't ask if everything was ok, if we needed anything, etc. We had to flag down another server to get us some extra ketchup, water.  We had burgers and fries. Burgers were cooked perfectly, juicy and delicious. Ordered them medium and they were cooked--shocker! MEDIUM!  Burger was really excellent. Fries were just good fries.  Food 4 star. Service 1 star.

Great burger place.  Had a great variety of burgers to chose from along with the beer list(hence the name).  I really liked how clean the burger was.  I hate burgers that are sloppy and messy and this was FAR from that.  I also like how the burger bun slightly toasted.

Highly recommended

Burger was OK. It was a little dry. The did not have the beer I wanted and messed up my order by putting onions on it. Place was dead on a Wednesday night so there really was no excuse for the poor service. I would skip it unless you are starving.

This is not your neighborhood burger joint. This is creation of two culinary giants Joe Bastianich and Mario Batali, using premium cuts of meats from New York's Pat LaFrieda. To to great gourmet blend patty add premium mushroom, cheese and specially made buns, you got yourself a great Burger. You can enjoy your burger of choice of gourmet sandwich with hand cut fries, onion rings and wash it down with craft beer, or shakes. I love this place and it is part of my weekend casual lunch. This is open late and great to take your dates or family.

*3 and 1/2 stars*

B&B Burger and Beer could be a 4-star restaurant, but the cleanliness factor drops the rating down a bit.  There were lots of food crumbs under our table, specks of who knows what on my silverware, my seat was wet after being wiped down that I had to ask for a napkin to wipe it dry, and there was a used toothpick on one of the bar high tops where we were sitting at while waiting for our table.   

While cleanliness was a let-down, the food, however, was pretty good.  I had the Your Way Bar Burger and basically built a bacon cheeseburger which I really liked, and for my side, I had some onion rings which I enjoyed as well.  The ranch dressing I requested on the side, though, not so good.  The onion rings were better by themselves.  For my drink, I had the Caramel Swirl Shake, which came with a tin container with an extra serving.  That was pretty good too.  

I requested to sit outside on the patio when I made my reservation.  It was too cold to seat people out there though, they said, so we were instead seated at a table for two inside.  Bummer - the view looks nice out from their patio!  

Service was fine, but maybe too fast if that's even possible?!  Our check was placed on the table and my dining companion didn't even realize it :p  They were busy but there were definitely some empty tables, so if there was a rush to get us out I don't get it.  

Food was good and service was okay, but just need to improve on cleanliness.  Overall, an okay place!

Going against the grain of the Yelp star rating, we trusted more that the names on the restaurant sign would assure us that we would have a good experience. Overall, everything was just OK and we expected a bit more. The burgers were good, the beer selection is above average, the service was less than what we hoped.

We started off on the wrong foot when our party of 6 arrived on time for our 5:30 reservation via Open Table and were seated in a large booth. With the way the sun was coming in through the room, I was literally blinded and couldn't see a foot in front of me. I didn't feel like wearing sun glasses throughout the meal so we requested another booth. Our server gave us the neighboring booth (although 90% of the other tables were open) that had yet to be bused from the previous party. She then told us to stand and wait at the hostess area. We stood there waiting with our table in plain sight with not a single soul including the hostess, our server, or any sort of management attempting to clean the table for ten minutes. The bus person appeared out of nowhere and finished the two minute job. The lack of teamwork and lack of any sense of urgency with patrons standing and waiting for an extended period of time didn't score any extra points.

Appetizers ordered were the fried pickles and the pork parts. The pork belly in the appetizer was probably the best thing we had in our meal. We had to rush though because our burgers were brought no more than 5 minutes after we received the appetizers. Burgers ordered were the Royale with Cheese, The Drive Thru, and I had The Really Good. I don't mind the strong flavor of Gorgonzola, but this blue cheese combined with the chianti mustard gave the burger a really strong, powerful bite that overwhelmed the beef. It's good if you like those strong flavors, but I think I should have chose a hoppier beer aside from my Brooklyn Brown Ale to tone down the flavor. I think an IPA might have paired better.

Everyone else finished their burgers with no major complaints and everyone passed on dessert, which are just milkshakes, except my brother who ordered a bourbon cherry shake. Total price for the meal was $160 before tip. I can name about three or four other places on the Strip that I'd stop for a burger before I came back here.

Plain orange walls and a bare concrete floor with the kind of tables and chairs one might find in an upscale crackhouse. Zero dollars or desire went into making this space the least bit classy. The Buffalo wings were as small as they get. The kind of cheap,meatless trash supermarkets sell frozen for next to nothing. The fried oysters were just big globs of flavorless breading. The Bottom Burner burger was edible but nowhere near as good as a Five Guys burger. Chef Batali should be ashamed to have his name on this. At least my server wasnt some braindead slacker. Dont come here. Ever.

The burgers were great!  The service was subpar.

This place has only been open one month so there are obvious wrinkles to iron out and that is totally understandable.  My boyfriend and I "built" our burgers and they came out great.  They were perfect size, not to big, not to small.  Cooked to temp.  The meat tasted very good and you can tell it was not previously frozen (and it is Angus ++++).  I had the pretzel bread bun and I could have eaten it plain without a hamburger on it, it was that good.  Obviously, my boyfriend enjoyed his because by the time I had finished my first bite his entire burger was nearly gone!
We sat at the bar as we often do when we eat out and the service was "okay".  Just minor things because the staff is still unsure on how to work with the kitchen (modifications, returns, firing time).  It is likely this will improve over time.
The decor in my opinion is not pleasurable, the color is very "Batali" if you know Mario.  It is very "Mario" orange.  
We also ordered the onion rings and they were very, very salty.  Under the impression that they were salted after coming out of the frier we asked to return them and get then without salt (this was an example when the bartender was obviously unsure about how the kitchen would react).  The rings came back out after a few minutes and they were alittle better, it seems the batter is just salty.  If you are not crazy about salty foods as we are, I don't suggest the onion rings.
Overall, I liked it, I will be back.

Good lunch place.  Burgers were good and done as ordered.  Get the potato chips, really crispy and thin.  Had Shiner beer on draft so that's a big plus.  Bison burger was good per my wife.  Just a good solid lunch place for good food and service.  Nothing outstanding.  Bar is big with many TVs and a good place to relax.  Right outside the Venetian sports book.

For a place with "Burger" in the name, I set my expectations rather high for the burgers.   Boy was I disappointed, I had the "all good burger" what a misnomer.  The two stars are for the wait staff alone - otherwise this joint gets zero stars in my book.

Really not very good. 

Initial service by the front desk was poor; I felt she had a bit of an attitude. I don't think it helped when I asked for a different table, as the first was dirty and a plate was actually stuck to the table. 

Food was very mediocre. Onion rings were tough as the onions outer skin was left on. Food was quite greasy. Bacon in the burger was as tough as old leather. 

There are plenty of other places to eat nearby, I wouldn't go near this place again.

Not a bad burger but not great either. Id rather have some In and Out down the road. 

The service was fine and friendly. Server was very helpful in describing the cooking temps and styles of burgers. 

The ambience was a la classic burger dinner of the 50s. Fairly clean. Not a heavily trafficked area any time I saw it or when I ate there which speaks volumes. 

Food was good. Satisfying burger and fries. Unfortunately the basic burger had to be cooked at medium well. Deposits that the server was right that it'd still taste good. It was $10. I just could bring myself to go for the $20 burgers. The amount of food was decent. 

Okay review for an okay place. I would likely try other places. Like I said, In and Out is cheaper and more delicious.
Juicy burgers tasty crispy fries and great outside patio. Service was great and staff was friendly and helpful.

Always a great experience at B&B. Took my wife here a couple of days ago, it was her first time, she absolutely loved the place. The food is amazing and the view outside is breathtaking. Thank you for the great experience

I had this crazy fantasy that Mario Batali himself was in the back grinding up Carnevino's riserva, ribeye and porterhouse cuts to be made into patties.  Not exactly the case but the guys behind one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas definitely know beef.  So a visit here was inevitable despite the mixed reviews.

Before B&B burger opened, Batali himself said "The food will be easier to accept if you've never heard of me."  Everyone comes to expect so much with his name on the front.  

My verdict: a damn good burger!  We ordered what most reviewers got and also what the servers recommended.  The "Morning After" was everything I want in a good burger.  The patty was a very juicy medium rare.  The egg on top looked and tasted so perfect upon my first bite which then turned into a beautiful mess of yolk everywhere.  The bun itself was excellent with a kind of croissant quality to it.  I was only able to notice it after eating part of the bun separately though.  The royale with cheese was also very good and my wife preferred this more with all its caramelized onion glory.

I still would have paid more for a riserva patty though :)

Overpriced, bad atmosphere & bad service.

We stopped to look at the menu & I saw a "royale with cheese".  Smiling i ask the hostess...have you ever seen Pulp Fiction?  Deadpan blank stare...no.

This restaurant is pretty damn empty except three out of four boothes which were full.

Okay we are hungry and Batalie & Bastianovich have their names over the door.  So we get seated at this small table for two.  We ask if we can have the last booth.  The hostess states that it is reserved.  Okay.

Not feeling a burger, we order pulled pork sandwiches.  The sandwiches come on this stale hot dog bun.

Two more couples enter seperately into this 75+ table restaurant.  Guess what?  The first two are seated right behind us and the next two are seated next to us.  If i spread my arm, i could touch their nose. Both couples ask to be seated in the booth and both are told its reserved.

Our waiter takes their order by standing in the small space between our tables.  His ass is now at my eye level and less than 18" away from my face.  I couldn't make this up.

The waiter never askes if we want a refill on our drinks.  We ask a busser and he obliges.  Next we get the $60 bill for two sandwiches, two fries and two soft drinks.  

As we leave, couldnt help but notice that now 2 boothes are open.  Must be a large reservation, i guess.

Dont be a sucker!  Dont go to this place ever.  Get your "munch on" at the classier place down the street - White Castle!
Had the sausage burger and onion rings some beers during sunday football and they were both great, glad I stopped in

Last Words
I went on the day after the grand opening.

The food here was okay, but the service was extremely slow. It seemed to take forever for everything. Glasses went dry, food took an inordinate amount of time, and our wait staff disappeared for extended periods of time. It took 15 minutes just to get our ticket so we could leave. I think we were here longer than we would have been at a 5-star restaurant with a 4-course meal.

Chosen for it's proximity to the Venetian poker room, I had a pretty good meal. Sat at the bar and the enthusiasm of the barkeeps was infectious. These guys were handing out samples of all sorts of different beer and whiskey, and had a story to tell for each one. Food wise, it was all pretty good. Started off with the fried pickles, which, I am obligated to order whenever it is on a menu. Cmon people, it's fried pickles. Anyway, they were tasty. Ditto for the Eggplant Parm on Ciabata bread with a basil pesto. Delicious. I can't explain why I got good service and others didn't. Maybe you have to sit at the bar.

The service here is so slow. After waiting 45 minutes for my beer I went I went up to the bar to get it myself. I I had the pork parts appetizer, it came in a  reasonable amount of time. My burger which was ordered at the same time is the pork parts arrived nearly 45 minutes later. The burger was delicious. However my onion rings did not come with the order they came 20 minutes after I finished the burger without the garlic aioli sauce that I ordered. The onion rings were excellent as well. The lady in charge of bringing water was absolutely fantastic, I have never had my water glass kept so full in my life. I'm glad I didn't have a show to go to or else I would have had to walk out without eating. I've been here for two and a half hours and have only had 2 beers. If this place was on its game I would have drank 3 beers and been here for slightly more than an hour. This place is bleeding money due to its terrible service. Even though the food was good I will never come back here.

Great outdoor seating- view is from our seat.  

Fries are skinny and perfectly crispy is ordered well done. 
Burger is fresh- okay but no distant flavor, just okay. 

Took awhile to get anything to drink but once received they kept the soda glass full. 

Great location and easy to find.
Excellent service and food!  Wife had the lobster roll, I had the cod sandwich,  15 yr old had an all American burger.  A little pricey but hey it's Vegas!

Everything is expensive on the strip, that's not what my review is about but for what you pay you expect to get the product. On vacation, we decided to go here and ordered fried oysters and a cranberry vodka-not great. I expected more from the oysters, they didn't seem to have they flavor I wanted, the corn mill battering isn't right for fried oysters. My cocktail was way too strong I had to ask for more cranberry for me to even drink it...I wasn't impressed especially for a late night snack.

Nothing bad to say. Service was great. Nice atmosphere and the bottom burger was the best burger I can remember having. Spicy!
Onion rings rocked! Thank u

This has become a must visit place for us when we're in Vegas. Great burgers, fries and shakes and they have the absolute best shishido peppers I've ever had. Service is also good and they play excellent rock music, so great environment; check 'em out!

Sorry to say, I would be amazed if this place is still open in a year.  

It sounded like a reasonable competitor v. Gordon Ramsay's BurGR, but that would appear to be wrong.  Our crew ordered a burger each, and one of our 4-some wanted to get a lobster roll to share (it's a tiny thing and makes 4 very little pieces).

The burgers just weren't good enough to meet the expectation from reading through the menu.  If you see "jalapeno" and "Mario's hot sauce" you'd expect some heat... nope; swing and a miss.  One of our group gave up after going through half his burger.  The lobster roll was a soggy mess... I could not detect the bacon and the sweetness came from the mayo concoction, not the lobster meat.

The plates are plain as can be, with a tiny dollop of pickled veggies to give the left hand side of the rectangular plate some color.  

I think the staff is heavily incented to push sides, the pressure was palpable and somewhat off-putting.  The food took a long time to come from the kitchen (and this serving a mostly empty joint), so something seems amiss.
Seated in a table up against the wall.  Used toothpicks littered the ledge. Silverware was dirty. Food meh.   Service meh.  Better options elsewhere unless you want to be seated by the water. Skip it

B&B Burger & Beer really seems to have mixed reviews, so I was cautiously optimistic about dining here.


I made my reservation on Open Table for 8:30pm on a Friday night. I wasn't sure where the restaurant was located, and the map on the Venetian website was not helpful at all.  Luckily, I saw someone mention that it's near the poker room and sports book. I parked in the self parking garage and just followed the signs towards the poker room. Although my friends were given bad directions by a security guard and ended up at the other B&B. The hostess was very friendly and offered to either seat us inside or on the patio. I thought it might still be too hot to sit outside, but she mentioned that they have misters and suggested that we walk out there to see if I wouldn't mind it.  It ended up being very comfortable out there (although I would suggest more misters).

The patio was great! I would much rather eat out there than inside (although the inside decor was cute). The tables are basically just off Las Vegas Blvd, on the outdoor canal. So you can watch the gondolas go by (and hear singing gondoliers) while you eat.  It was a great atmosphere.

I've noticed that most of the negative reviews are based upon 2 things: bad service and the prices. It's a Strip restaurant, so complaining about the prices is futile.  In the grand scheme of burgers, they are overpriced, but I don't think they are really ripping anyone off here.  They are using higher quality ingredients and cooking everything to order, so I am willing to pay $15 for a burger.

Our server was great! I definitely have no complaints there.  And it seemed as if they are honestly trying to improve on their service, because one of the Managers was walking around, delivering drinks and refilling waters. In fact, when we ordered beers, they came out quickly.

Now for the food! We all ordered something different (not intentionally). We started out with fried pickles. They were good, but nothing remarkable. I did like the spicy pickled veggies that they were served with (like a taco shop). I had the Royale with Cheese, medium rare. It wasn't as cheesy as I expected, but it was definitely delicious.  I could immediately taste the quality of the meat, which had awesome flavor. It was on the small (ish) side, but I still felt satisfied.  My friends got the following:

Lobster roll - she enjoyed it, but I thought it looked disappointing and nothing like what you would get in Boston.  It seemed like it was all bun and not enough lobster. This is the most expensive item on the menu ($21), and I wouldn't order it.

The Bottom Burner - I tasted this and it was really good.  This is likely what I would order next time. I love spicy stuff and Mario's hot sauce is a nice complement to the jalapeno pesto and pepper jack cheese.  She ordered this medium well, and it came out a little over cooked, although our server recommended she order it this way because she doesn't like pink meat. After she saw my burger, she wished she would've ordered it med-rare as well.

We all shared a side of fries and a side of onion rings. Both were good, especially the onion rings. They also had a pretty decent beer selection, which also included some local beers.  It was $9 for a Dogfish Head 90 Minute IPA, which is really reasonable on the Strip.

Overall, it was a great dinner. We were seeing a show and I was a bit worried that we would be delayed, but everything was smooth. I am surprised to see people saying that the food was flavorless and horrible, that couldn't be further from the truth.

Larger portions.  Had the shishito peppers app - seemed to never end... the Hawaiian burger was good - ordered medium - was a little over done.  But still very tasty.  My son had the tater toys as a side and they were fantastic.  A bit pricey - but it is Vegas

Burger was decent.
Fried pickles yum
Onion rings yum
Had some salad which was pleasant, with a little spicy kick to it.
Warm potatoes w/ mayo was yum but a little bit too oily for me.
Would come back here again? hmmm not too sure

Should've taken the cue given this was the only empty restaurant around, but we were a group of starving girls who didn't want to deal with the hassle of waiting and standing around in line. Bad choice.

I ordered the Chicken Heroes Sandwich, served on a pretzel roll. The chicken itself was fine but the bread was overpowering! I love my carbs; however the bread was very dry and on the verge of becoming stale. Normally I don't really pay attention to plating, but this sandwich was served on a very long plate, and it just looked lonely and weird.

Service was friendly and earnest enough, but very choppy, and the staff was clearly inexperienced. Also, this is a casual joint, so I thought it was very strange when they served our food in unison - out of nowhere 3 servers stepped up up to our table and it was like this awkward orchestration of serving our food. i've only seen this done in more formal dining settings, and it just doesn't really jive with the whole beer and burger vibe.

Definitely waiting in line for Noodle Asia next time, that place hits the spot!

We came here recently because we wanted burgers and beer. Figured they had it in the name so they probably had it all.

Service was good here and our food came out super quick. I got the drive thru burger, which is 2 patties with some stuff on it. It was cooked exactly the way I wanted and was very filling.The fries were super yummy, too

I honestly don't remember what beer we had here, but they had a pretty good selection.

Price on the food seemed reasonable, the beers not so much. But it's Vegas and was pretty in line with Vegas prices.

They had a ton of TV's in there and playing the game, which was nice. It would be a good place to go sit and watch some football.

Stopped here after we took in a show at the Venetian.

We ordered the loaded fries, and they were awesome! Literally loaded with sour cream, bacon, cheese, and chives. 

My boyfriend built his own burger and got the potato bun, pickle peppers, bacon, pepper jack cheese,tomatoes, onion lettuce, and chianti mustard and said it was on of the best burgers he's had.  

I ordered the grilled chicken sammie, which came on a ciabatta bun (which is my fav), bacon, avocado, mayo, lettuce, and tomato. The chicken was really juicy and tasty. 

Highly recommend B &B!
This was a decent burger nothing crazy to me though.. The fries were good and they give you plenty to share. Service was nice and friendly. Price is pretty fair for being in Vegas.
Kinda disappointing considering the name wanted it to be a great burger place but it just wasn't.

Wish I could give 3.5 but I'll round up just bc the lady taking our order at the bar was nice and patient with us ordering. Came in here just looking for something to eat on the way back to the hotel and ordered the Royale with cheese, and it was cheesy goodness! The caramelized onions made it that much better. I would order this burger again although if I had to choose I'd go to Gordon Ramsay's BURGR at PH. The burger there was slightly better there to me.

The place might look like a cafeteria but they serve up some tasty morsels. Although I was afraid to order the eggplant parmigiana sandwich on ciabatta bread it did not disappoint. Lightly breaded eggplant arugula burrata and pesto made this an excellent choice. Hubby went with his usual meatballs and loved it. $50 with onion rings tip and tax. A Vegas bargain.

Pretty good burger/sandwich joint operated by B&B.  We ordered 
Pastrami-Rye Bread, Swiss Cheese, Sauerkraut, Line Cook Ale Mustard - Delicious sandwich; pastrami was juicy and tender.
Pulled Pork-Challah Bun, BBQ Sauce, Bacon, Coleslaw, Pickles - It was OK.  A bit on the dry side.
The Drive-Thru Burger-2 Griddles Patties, Sesame Seed Bun, American Cheese, B&B Pickles, Lettuce Tomato, Onion - Pretty good burger
Caesar - Romaine, Parmesan, Croutons, Anchovy Dressing

The only complaints I have are that the music was way too loud and it was freezing cold in the restaurant.

Decided to get a quick snack and a beer. The ultimate decision to come here was the "no wait" factor. The pictures they had online was definitely more fancy than the place itself. It reminded me of a more upscale McDonalds. It wasn't very clean and not the Venetian standard I'm used to. We got the loaded fries which were just ok. I ordered an Angry Orchard cider beer which was room temperature.. boo!!! Verdict? There are probably way better places in Vegas to eat at.
I came here for lunch on 1/23/15.  This was a very good burger and tasty on many levels but was a Lil on the pricey side.  The service and staff were nice though.

This has to be one of the worst burgers I've ever had.. Not just that the service sucked.. We arrived n they advised us it was 20 min wait.. So they asked for our cell # and said they would text  us when ready.. Well 20 mins later no text.. We go check n she says it's ready.. Where was the text?  Anyways we sit down n we don't get waited for a while..a table behind us who got sat after us gets served first. I was really excited about my burger by the looks, but when I started eating it all I could taste was pepper! I would ask for light seasoning on it if I ever go back. The onion rings had great flavor, but there was WAY too much salt on them.

Really?? This is Batali's take on gourmet burgers? Before I rail on the burger, let's give some love to the things that were solid. Nutella milk shake that my buddy had was simply outstanding! The Beer selection is solid, with enough craft beer on tap and by the bottle to pair with any of the burgers. The fried pickles and the sauce for dipping was also a table favorite. Now when it comes to what should have been the star of the show, the burger,  disappointment abounded at our table. The menu does offer what should be some appealing options but when they arrived the were really more akin to a Carls Jr $6 burger than a $15 gourmet burger. Nothing special on the patty and the bun frankly looked like something they had gotten from the bakery section at the local supermarket. If they were not pricey it would not be a big deal, but with the name on the door you expect big things and B&B simply doesn't deliver. I live in Southern California, home to some of the best gourmet burgers in the country. If this place opened there it wouldn't last 6 months. Come on Mario, this is fixable, were talking burgers here!
Went at 1 on a sat. Server was nice but service was beyond slow. All burgers were cooked well regardless of our choice.

Whenever I visit Vegas, I always make it a point to try a new burger joint.

B&B is a burger restaurant with a beer garden.  A fairly decent selection of craft beers, but I came here for the burgers.  And a solid burger, it delivers!

They have a handful of burgers and I opted for "The Morning After" since I have an affinity for egg on my burger.  Who doesn't love egg on their burger?!

Good burger overall.  Patty cooked to order.  Well possibly a tad rarer but that is fine with me just don't overcook it!  Good meaty flavor in the patty.  But the truffle aioli was the clincher and tied everything together!  All the different parts worked together wonderfully!  Just ask my stomach!

My only complaint?  The patty was smaller than my liking.  Only a 6oz patty...  For me, an 8 - 9 oz patty packs the right-sized punch of flavor.

Good burger but still not worth a repeat visit anytime soon with many burger options in Vegas.
